body: This app is GREAT for tracking macros. It’s got a huge database of foods, and adding custom foods is easy! You can set Your goals, then monitor your progress throughout the day as you enter food. I especially like being able to “Change amount Eaten” to adjust if necessary, at meals. There are several options for adding and adjusting foods. I’ve looked at many apps for tracking food, and this one is just the best!

title: LOVE IT!
body: This app just keeps getting better and better.  I really like tracking exact macros, being able to easily change daily macros, copying meals from any day, easily change recipes, having a running count on remaining macros.  Recent update allows you to post the contents of your recipe individually or by recipe name..brilliant!  Super simple app, great customer support, can't imagine using anything else. Thank you Jason!

title: Love this app
body: This is by far in my experience the best app there is when tracking your food . I prefer it over my fitness pal which has a lot of inaccurate data . My macros is very good for beginners new to tracking and very user friendly . Their support team is always so helpful and quick to getting back with any questions . I seriously couldn’t live without this app

title: Better than MFP
body: I had been using MFP for a few years and finally did the switch when my MFP premium ran out. Just make sure you do custom entries and let the app calculate the calories. This app makes me more accurate and I am reading labels more closely now. I like how the app tracks your weight and gives you the average in addition to the graph. Highly recommend this app and the price is great!

title: Database is Non Existent
body: I signed up for MM+ only because I’m working with a coach who syncs to it. I’ve used MFP and LoseIt and MM+ by far has the worse database of all the apps. For example, I tried searching for an English muffin this morning and one from a restaurant came up. It is easy to scan your food but if you’re searching for a fresh food or an item off a menu be totally prepared to input it manually. The interface is nice graphically but the $19 premium is NOT worth it as nothing loads and works online. But really for me, ease of use and ability to track quickly are key and the lack of foods in the database makes this app horrible.

title: Best macros app I've used
body: I'm only one week into this app, & already love it. It's straightforward, had a myriad of ways to input your meals (be it through search, manual entry, or barcode scanning). Entering notes & adding favorite meals makes it much easier to personalize. Best feature: definitely the different goals you can save and set. So now I can meet my macros on gym AND rest days! Super helpful and user friendly app.

title: Not a fan.
body: I've been using MFP for years and decided to try this when signing up for Avatar.  Logging food with this is time consuming and frustrating with so many duplicate or wildly inaccurate entries.  Plenty of foods came up with no macro information, just zeros or "non." Good luck if you go to a buffet and try to manually search for foods.  Some of the bar codes worked, some didn't.  I also did not like the layout of the tabs - confusing. $2.99 down the drain, going back to MFP.  They have better data, better user interface, and macro breakdowns as well.

title: Terrible search results
body: This App could be great for tracking macros but the search results make you want to give up on life. It makes me more frustrated than an Amish electrician. The search results have almost no connection to what was searched. Don't pay for the app. Stick with MFP. For more specifics, I searched for a "Maple Bacon Donut" (a fairly common donut) only to see results for maple bacon. I decided to search for "Maple Donut" an even more common donut especially from Dunkin Donuts to see no results of it but a bunch of peanut butter results that had hardly any correlation. I then went in MFP and searched for "Maple Bacon Donut" and guess what?! The results came up for Maple Bacon Donuts!

title: Got me on track
body: I have tried several times to figure out Macro counting. It took this app and my trainer for it to finally make sense!!

title: Crashing
body: Every time I open the app it just shuts down it started out perfectly fine after i tracked my whole day worth of meals and began editing serving amounts it started getting laggy on me, I managed to edit what I needed, finished and closed the app. now I can’t even open it back up, every time I try to launch the app it doesn’t even show interface just flashes a gray screen and shuts down very frustrating since I’ve had this app since 2016  and used it perfectly fine - never on the iPad though feel like I wasted money. Fix this issue I didn’t pay for no reason this is ridiculous
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Not worth it!
body: Okay I know the overall rating is really great because that’s what got me into buying this. But trust me, don’t buy it unless you have a lot of patience and a lot of free time. It takes a very long time to add food, adjust serving size, change units, etc. Most of the time you can’t even be positive it’s correct because food is measured in grams, and I’m obviously unable to carry a scale around with me everywhere I go. Even at home I’m not weighing my burger/salad/pasta/avocados. It’s not user friendly and way over complicated. I feel like it would be easier to just keep a hand written log instead of buying this.

title: Not worth the money, better apps on market
body: I purchased this app hoping it would give me more than the basic macro count and was sold that it states it has a data base of foods with nutritional value already calculated. Well, I rarely found the information correct if the database did find the brand item I was looking for. And maybe it was user error but I couldn’t even find the correct numbers for simple things like a bell pepper.

title: Not as efficient as MyFitnessPal
body: I really love the interface of this app and all of its features. It blows MyFitnessPal out of the water when it comes to that!

title: Very helpful tracker
body: Love that I can custom set to my needs, but the search is really cumbersome when trying to add a recipe.

title: Love this app!
body: I was tired of paying the yearly fee for MFP after 2 years I switched to this! This does almost everything that the premium MFP does but for 2.99! It took me a while to get used to switching formats, but I actually like this format better now. I also just signed up for the additional monthly coaching option & so far I have really liked it! I'm very grateful for this app!!

title: Great App - one big problem
body: Great functionality and pretty easy to use. Only issue is there isn't any management of the food database that I can tell. There are seemingly endless duplicates of the same item that come up when doing searches for foods without barcodes. If the one you want isn't what immediately comes up, you're searching forever and unlikely to find what you need, if only in the interest of time.

title: Love it
body: I overall love this app and it's tracking.  My only minor complaint is that searching for things sometimes yields odd results, so if they could make it so me searching for an egg doesn't give me an egg bagel, this would get 5 stars.

title: Not user friendly, doesn’t accurately track servings
body: I’ve used this app for only a few days, but am too frustrated to continue. It’s not user friendly (very confusing how to navigate through the app), but I can get past that. The final straw is the actual tracker. When scanning items to add to my tracker, I tried to change the serving sizes (1 gram of butter is minuscule) and it won’t adjust the fat, carbs and protein for the new serving size. I have no idea what I’m actually tracking and how I’ve ended the day. Wish I didn’t spend $3 on this app. Waste of money, especially compared to all of the free options.

title: Best One
body: Between the barcode scanner and the ability to customize just about everything this is a lifesaver.  It takes a while to get proficient at getting around but that’s the trade off of having all the bells and whistles (which I use almost all of them) and it being simple but too limited.  Really top notch and I’ve looked at a bunch.

title: Potential But Not There
body: Been using MyFitnessPal for years. I decided to try MyMacros because it’s the preferred tracker of Macros Inc. It’s impressive. I like the ability to create unlimited labels for meals (dinner,

title: Best Food / Macros tracking app around
body: I’ve used and purchased just about every macro tracking app and 3 years ago I found my macros + and never looked back. 3 years of tracking history , I don’t have to subscribe or purchase anything extra to make the app useful, everything is available from the get go . Seriously purchase this app .

title: Bring back the copy meal feature!
body: I was a loyal user of this app, but the most recent update took away the feature I use the most - the copy meal feature. Now you can only copy the entire day. It is completely useless since I frequently repeat half my meals but vary the others. Now I have to reenter every food item every single day or copy the meal and delete half of the entries.

title: All data gone after iPhone upgrade
body: I’ve been using the app for a few days and love it. It is clearly designed with the IIFYMer in mind.

title: To my rescue!
body: I have felt that the my macros app has been the most reliable and easy to use food tracking app available.  But, can I tell you, they also have exceptional customer service as well?!

title: Not there yet
body: I was super excited to try this app. Great price for macro tracking. But after I started searching for food I can see why. Almost every item I type in the food search does not populate. It’s not like I’m typing in crazy unknown food choices. Like this morning I typed oat milk and nothing popped up. Apps like weight watchers and my fitness pal almost have everything single item

I really like the app. It makes tracking much more manageable. I like the fact that I can track daily weight and water consumption. The best part for me is that my wife also tracks and it has a feature where you can save a meal from someone in your circle, so we don't both have to add it in. I use Avatar Nutrition and it works flawlessly with that.

title: Been tracking food/macros for over 15 years. Best ever.
body: If keeping track of calories and macros is your goal, there's honestly no better option. This was such a huge gift. Interface is clean and clear...unlike other tracking apps I've tried. And it caters to people like me who measure things by grams. You'd be surprised by how many trackers fail in that regard.

title: Frustrating and more work than MFP
body: I had a friend recommend MM and she told me to “be patient once you’ve got your data imputed it gets easier” I’ve been using this for over two months and it’s the biggest pain ever. If anything it makes me track less often because I can’t search for specific items and there are few “verified items” in the data base. I’ve been using MyFitnessPal for 2 years and it might be less organized and not a clean but at least I can find things easily. My gosh.

title: Outstanding meal tracking...just missing activity tracking!
body: App is awesome. Love the features to track my food, easy to use, very intuitive. Plus I am surprised at how many foods the library contains. My only note to developers is add an activity tracker. Wish I could add my exercise for the day so everything can be done in one app. Worth the small price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

title: It’s Okay
body: This app is just okay. I like it because it doesn’t shove adds in my face, but like all apps they have certain areas that are only available to subscribers. The app is pretty basic, but if you want to just track your calories then it works. It does lack a lot of food, but if you’re okay imputing it once yourself it’s no big deal. I will say the Apple Watch app for logging water does not work for me. When ever I try to log water it crashes, which is a bummer.

title: I had to go back to MyFitnessPal
body: Don’t read the review title and think this isn’t a great app. That’s wrong, it is amazing! The only reason I went back was the search function just is better on MFP. There is a major lack of verified items and exploring restaurants and even finding nuggets at Wendy’s is tough and there are so many variations people have made. If you have the time to type in everything and not rely on search, this app is better than MFP in terms of detail etc.

title: Awesome!
body: This app is awesome, so easy to use! And so easy to add food! You can scan a barcode or a nutrition label and Bam! there it is. Setting up your calorie and macro goals in the profile section is simple. I absolutely love this app. I always knew that tracking my food was helpful when trying to reach a goal but it was hard!!!  Not anymore, thank you thank you my macros!

title: Critical error in calculating macros
body: I do think this is the best designed app for tracking food and logging recipes.  However there is a critical error in calculating calorie count and subsequently macro ratios.  The app does not subtract fiber and instead accounts it towards calories and macro distribution.

title: Inaccurate database
body: Literally everything I’ve scanned with the barcode scan functionality has been in the database. That’s great, but, literally everything in the database was wrong! And wrong in a bizarre way. Like a piece of bread being 107 calories but 3g of carbohydrates. Way off from the actual macros. I definitely think there’s some issues with the database, and, at this time, that makes this app unusable for me.

title: Great app & customer service
body: MM+ is a great app if you want accuracy in tracking macros. Their customer service is stellar! I got a new phone, and all of the custom food I made disappeared. I tried to sync myself with no success, but with a quick email to them, they got everything back in record time! Well worth the couple of bucks for the app!

title: Love it
body: Literally perfect for tracking my macros. Downfall is they don't have a huge food database like MfP but it's easy enough to google or scan a barcode and enter it in the system. I’ve been using this app for about four years and it is always consistent and easy to use regardless of what features are added. Super easy to navigate as well!

title: Not as good as other apps
body: I HATE that when I scan a barcode or search a food that the nutrition facts are typically wrong! It’s so frustrating to have to enter it all manually when free apps don’t have this issue. I do like how this app tracks my macros and the layout of the meals I’ve eaten, but the functioning is terrible. Currently, the app isn’t even working. I click on the app, it pops up for 1 second, then crashes and goes back to my home screen. For a paid app, I am SO disappointed as I know free apps work better.

title: No customer support
body: I tried to call customer support and is a personal phone and never is available. I requested the cancellation of my membership few times because won’t reach my expectations and they still charging the membership and twice in less than a month. Really I don’t recommend this app!!!!

title: Your buddy to keep you accountable.
body: I’ve been using this app for well over a year and I can’t say anything but great things about it.  With the updates of nutrition scans and barcode scanners, it just gets better. It’s helped me be accountable and it’s easy and fast to use, even with the Apple Watch! I won’t use another app for macros-sorry. This is the best.

title: Not going to work for me
body: Bummer that I paid for this. I was expecting some help and additional features when it comes to macros and everything I wanted to do had an additional charge or subscription required. If you want to just keep track of macros and/or calories there are many other more user friendly (free) options out there. Also disappointed in the barcode scanner, the search, and that the app froze on me - all within 5 minutes of purchasing.

title: Great App!
body: I love this app! It took a while to learn how to use it, but once you have your favorites set up and your recipes, it’s easy to get what you need tracked. They are also improving too! Now I can copy only certain items from one meal to another (whereas before we had to copy the whole meal then delete what we didn’t eat). I’m sticking with mm+ 🤩

title: Best Macro App I’ve Ever Used
body: I never write reviews but this is the most user-friendly, comprehensive Macro counting app on the market. I’ve used it for a few years now and it’s been fun to see it transition into what it is today. More updates keep coming and the app just gets easier to use and easier to track your long term goals. Great job, team!

title: It’s ok. Others are better
body: I really like the way this app presents the nutrition information for the day. However, I have a really difficult time finding foods to add for meals and/or recipes. For example, it was very difficult to add an entry for honey - even with the global search. This could be a great app if it had more variety in the foods on here as well as more restaurant foods. For the cost it’s not terrible but I’d rather pay a little bit more for better functionality.

title: LOVE THIS APP
body: Seriously the best app for tracking macros and great customer service. It is super easy to navigate and has set me up for incredible success. Also I had switched phones and thought I had lost months of entries and recipes but Jason in customer service was able to get them all back. If I could give more than five stars I would!

title: Exercise tracking
body: This app is not worth the 2.99.   I downloaded this because I believed it would work with my Apple Watch and health but it doesn’t.  It adds the food you eat into apple health but does to figure in your workouts.   Which being highly active I need to be app to track how much I have burned versus how much I have eaten.  Have tried to contact support twice with no response.   Don’t wast you money on this.  You better off tracking with carb manager is it does track you exercise from Apple Watch. And their support team actually gets back to you.

title: Love My Macros!
body: I was a MFP user for so long, but recently started using Avatar Nutrition coaching with automatically syncs with MM+. It's great that I don't have to adjust my macros daily, but I like the option of being able to if I need. The database was a little tricky at first, but now I love it. I love the "Recent" tab as I usually eat the same things over and over. Totally worth the $2.99.

title: Best tracker for macros
body: This is worth the $.  I can track my exact macros, save different nutritional settings and easily change them if needed.  I love how all the macros are right at the top of my day and will automatically subtract and show what I have let as I input my food.  However only 4 stars because sometimes there is a glitch when I use the barcode scanner.  Other than that I love it.

title: Proficient
body: It gets the job done. There is a little learning curve but once you get it, it is pretty awesome. I used consistently for 5 months now and had a inputted a specific macros plan. It got me the results I wanted and now I use it to keep in check with my goals. The barcode scanner has some opportunities but works. I mainly have to manually input my food but at least that way I know it is correct.

title: Would recommend 100%!
body: I have been using this app for almost 5 years and I LOVE it! Not only is the app great, but the customer service is top notch. I accidentally deleted my whole food library after getting a new phone and Jason emailed back in less than 30 mins with a solution. Thank you so much Jason!

title: Love this app
body: I used to use the app Lose It to track my calories, but I just felt like the UI was too annoying and dumbed-down.

title: Better and better with time
body: I have been with MyMacros+ for over at least 5 yrs.  The app was great back then and over time it has only gotten so much better!  The current flows are so easy to use and intuitive, they have put a lot of thought into everything and it shows.  Great work, keep it up!

title: Unfortunately getting worst
body: Last version broke setting or changing the macros goal; can't edit values or add new goals.

title: Nothing works
body: I have both the app and the website subscription. None of the features work. None of my custom foods show up to be entered as ingredients for my recipes. None of my recipes I entered on the website show up at all after trying to sync the app. When I search for ingredients for my recipes, there are like 40 duplicate entries and you have to scroll forever only to see that the food you are looking for isn’t even there. Still waiting to hear back from customer service about all of this...What an effing waste of money.

title: Love the simplicity of this app!
body: This macros tracking app is fantastic!  Super easy to use. I can add or correct foods found in the search feature, it keeps those I’ve added in a section on the app that is easy for retrieval again .   And I love how i am able to customize my macros versus only use what the calculator provided!  Love this!!

title: Poor food database
body: Once again, I hope for an app that thinks globally.  This is not it. I downloaded and paid 2.99 for that privilege, immediately discovered I had to pay lord to get any of the advertised data.  On top of that, the first 4 barcodes I scanned were not in the database. I can only assume it is because I don’t live in the US and the database doesn’t contain international foods. I understand that I can add foods of my choice, but I don’t have time to do that.  I will have to return to MyFitnessPal-still free, still well populated with many foods. Please give me back my 2.99 USD.

title: Needs a few improvements but Great!
body: I love this app and use it a lot. I like it better than My Fitness Pal because I can be more specific with grams of macros. I would like to see a search option within your food list so that you don’t have to scroll. Also if the amount of items that show in recent could be increased this app would be perfect!

title: Amazing App!
body: I have been using MyMacros+ for a year today. I signed up using Avatar Nutrtion and this was the app partnered with it. I love all the features it has to offer! Avatar came out with their new app and me personally did not like it, so what does MyMacros+ have??.... My macros set with Avatar Nutrtion can be manually entered into MyMacros+ which is a huge plus! I will always use this app!!

title: Love this app!
body: I’m constantly finding useful features that make it better and better. They are open to feedback and responsive which I appreciate. Easy to use and no low calorie suggestions or ridiculousness like you get with MFP. Couldn’t recommend this app enough. Well worth the annual fee for premium.

title: Like it but….
body: Great interface, great price BUT the food data bank can use a lot of help and updates. The scanning option always returns data that is incorrect. It’s frustrating to spend so much time inputting new data. The search option doesn’t alway bring up your foods. So it can be time consuming but I still prefer it over other apps.

title: Not great
body: The most important function, searching for foods to add to your daily counter, is lacking something serious. I can see that there’s a ton of data in the system but the search function can only handle one term at a time. You can’t say “peanut butter jif” or “apple gala small” for example; you can only search “peanut butter” or “apple” and scroll for 10min until you find what you need OR input your item yourself. No one has time for this app. I wish I could have my $3 back.

title: Just about done
body: More then 1000 days tracked, with countless frustrations under my belt and I’m just about tired of this app.

title: You HAVE to fix the “Macros Left” shortcut.
body: The implementation is busted, I make a shortcut and it not only gives me macro goal numbers that aren’t even saved in my app, but also tells me the tracking for a completely different date, that was like 6 months ago. I’ve tried deleting the shortcut and remaking but problem persists. I want siri to be able to tell me my macros please.

title: Umm It’s just ok.....
body: I’ve used other trackers in the past, and most of them are able to scan the barcodes majority of foods found in the grocery store. I have had to manually input the nutrition info a lot of the foods that I buy. Because of this, I find myself using my old carb manager tracker app because it recognizes almost every food that I buy. I wanted to use this app to help me track my vegan meal plan macros, but it is very limited.

title: Worth the extra cost!
body: I’ve used multiple food tracking apps (My Fitness Pal being the main one) and I still prefer this app more. It’s easy to use, you can mark your favorites, edit anything you want to customize the exact information you need. Recommend!

title: The Best Marco Tracker
body: MM+ has been amazing to have. It has been my favorite calorie app for a few years now. It’s very simple and the scanner is very quick and updated. I move my calories around quite a bit into Surplus, Deficit and Reverse Diet and the way of naming my calorie goals with a theme works awesome. I just love this app and know you will too.

title: Love it
body: This app has been crucial in reaching my nutrition and fitness goals. It does a lot that other apps just don't do very well such as the in-depth analysis tools for premium users. My only complaint is it can be hard to find certain foods and there are a lot of user entries that are just garbage. Otherwise it works fantastically!

title: Great app for tracking macros
body: Tracking macros is the only thing that has ever worked for keeping my weight in check and this app is great. Only negative is I wish I could enter my exercise/activity for the day on the same screen and not have to go into a separate  app. Wish I had this in my life 20 yrs ago!

title: Helped to get over the hump!
body: Had lost a lot of weight on my just watching portions. Started working out but then plateaued on weight loss. Started doing the IIFYM thing and MyMacros+ was the bomb!!! Found it much easier to use than MyFitness Pal. It has helped get over the hump! Just downloaded the fitness app by Jason also but just starting to use that.

title: Can’t live without.
body: If you don’t love this app it’s because you’re using it wrong. If you take the time to learn how to use it the right way your life will be so much easier. The features blow the other tracking apps out of the water.

title: cumbersome to use
body: i agree with many other posts, too time consuming to gave to reload data or manually enter because the food database is very deficient. has good platform but it feels like the moved on prematurely. i wouldn’t recommend buying i’m going back to my fitness pal.

title: Suggestion for developer
body: I love this app! It does exactly what I want it to do except for one thing.. I’d love it if when I entered a meal it kept track of what time I entered it. I try to eat every 2-3 hours and sometimes you forget to look at the clock when eating and lose track of your schedule!

title: Best tracker hands down
body: Been a LONG time user and absolutely love it. I have my clients that have iPhones get this as ease of use, tracking, and all the information available is awesome!  Get this you won’t be disappointed and no I don’t receive a single thing from this review just my honest opinion.

title: Frustrating
body: I bought this app to track my macros and I’ve found that the barcode scanner and nutritional label scanner and very rarely accurate.  Unlike other apps, when you scan a barcode you have to double check that the nutritional information that shows up is correct ... which I promise it won’t be. For myself, this has added much frustration to counting macros... which is a pain in itself.  I can’t said I would recommend this app .

title: Great till you switch phones/restore backup
body: Great app to track progress until something happens to the device you’re tracking on.  Even with a backup to the cloud and other devices, all info does not transfer, had to re-apply macro goals, weight progress, and custom meals. Very frustrating and annoying.

title: Easiest way to track as a client and a coach
body: The only reason I don’t give this 5 starts is because the food options available I feel are a little limited. To overcome this I look up nutrition. Information and very easily plug it in to my journal. This app makes everything from coaching to adjusting macros. To managing and tracking your macros insanely easy.

title: I'm addicted!
body: This app helps me keep my sanity as a female working on body composition.  When bulking it feels really odd to be overeating but this handy app keeps me calm!  It does have some bugs: syncing between devices sometimes and cutting and pasting a prior meal into today sometimes sticks it into wrong day.  And being I live in Europe it doesn't always see my barcodes. All in all- a solid 4 star

title: Easy!
body: Even though this app has lots of options and features, it remains easy to navigate. And along with the rest of the positive reviews, the barcode scanner is extremely helpful! If you are tracking your daily macros and total calorie consumption, this app is for you.

title: Very good app could be better
body: I've been using this app now for about 6 months, I like it a lot but I feel the food data base is not what it should be , seems like every time I scan a item it's not found and I have to manually input it , also the search. Oils be better . I have 4 stars because it's better than what I was using before .

title: Best Macro Tracker Around
body: This App lets me track macronutrients better than any tracker I've used before. I love that I can put as many meals as I want down. Other apps Ive used in the past only let me track 3 or 4. But I can sometimes eat 6 to 8 times a day. This is hands down an excellent choice for tracking Macros.

title: Standout Among Many
body: It takes a little getting used to, but once you do, it is great!   I wish it showed net carbs but minor nick pick.  Being able to quickly see where I am at in a day or for a meal quickly without looking at each food for us memory challenged individuals is awesome.

title: So helpful!
body: This app has made my first week of keto very manageable. Don't know what I would've done without it! Once you learn the basics, it's easy to use for each meal. I love that I can easily play around with potential meals so I know exactly what my macros would be at the end of the day. Really helps me stay on track!

title: Wish I hadn’t bought this
body: Haven’t even gotten to dinner on my first day, and I’m done with this app. Have used free macro calc apps that were much easier and convenient than this.

title: Waste of money
body: Not only did I have to pay for the app, but to just set my macros I have to sign up for a monthly subscription just to make sure my days macros are within my goals. I get subscriptions that enhance and give extra features, but just setting a baseline macro for a macro app should be included, especially if you have to pay for the app. Also the good nutrition stored in this app is very poor and some of the items aren’t even in there, like raw tomatoes. Unless your talking about anything from a restaurant, it’s not in there.
response: Hi TheBwii29, really sorry for the confusion but you can set your macro goals for no extra charge than just the paid app price. Go to the "Set Nutritional Goals" settings page and hit "Add Goal Profile". Then you can enter in your macro goals in grams, no extra subscription required.

title: Not worth my three dollars
body: I like the way it’s interface is displayed and how it tracks my fats, proteins and carbs in a visual chart. Part of me wants to subscribe to pro but it doesn’t feel worth it.

title: Best food diary app
body: Easy to use and edit foods if the entries are wrong. As a side note, when I got my new iPhone 12 Pro I lost all my previous data from years of using this app. Customer service responded promptly and was able to retrieve all my data for me

title: Overly complicated for what it does
body: I guess I'm not the target audience. It just needs to track my meals. Not a hard or complicated task... but it takes 5 or 6 clicks just to do something simple.

title: Easiest fastest Macro Counter
body: Yes, the database isn’t great, BUT, just look up the information from another app, put it into MyMacros+, and it’s always there!  Easy search, easy edits, few clicks, no adds, my favorite!  (I don’t trust one source for numbers anyway, I look up macro numbers on multiple sites before I save it in MyMacros+)

title: Worth the small fee. Well done!
body: I’ve only had this app. for about an hour and I’ve already set my macro. goals, added all of today’s meals and water, and used the barcode scanner to add the foods that I frequently eat. I can already tell this app. Is amazing. I will be recommending it to friends. Thanks!!!

title: Hands down best nutrition tracker
body: Extremely user friendly, hands down better than MFP, and customer service was amazing when I switched phones and couldn’t access all my data. I don’t like paying for apps, but this one was definitely well worth the $!

title: Not worth it
body: They hardly have anything in their food bank. I literally have to enter all my food that I’ve found the nutritional facts to through MyFitnessPal. Or I have to scan everything (that’s if they even have the food you’re using in their food bank.) The app doesn’t even work on my Apple Watch. I have to use other apps to track when I can’t get to my phone. I love the idea of it, but they definitely need a lot more work on this app.

title: Better Than The Rest
body: This app is perfect and only getting better.

title: Good App
body: Let’s just say I’ve struggled with tracking my food for years, but I came across this app and it makes it so much easier. I love it. The only thing is sometimes when you scan certain foods it’s off just a little bit, but overall I like this app better than all the other food tracking apps.

title: Forced Calorie “Got Your Back”
body: This app is wonderful and I’ve used it for a little over 3-4 years now. BUT, the “forced” calorie got your back option is kind of stupid. This should be an option to turn on/off. Not something forced on the user. Especially, when the macro entered is 100% correct and the one being forced is 100% wrong.

title: Calories won’t work
body: I tried to submit a custom food that was 641 calories. This is normal because I usually add a lot of custom foods to this app. The app decides to lower the calories to 423 no matter what I try. I try to update how many calories are in the food and the app doesn’t change a thing about the meal when I’m done updating. I’ve made sure I’ve clicked update food when I’m don’t but nothing works. This is a rule breaker for me and I’ll have to switch to MyFitnessPal if the issue persists. Can I get some help on this situation?

title: I love this app!
body: I find this app very beneficial but it would be a lot more convenient for me if it could sync data from either the Health app on iPhone or the HelloFresh app or both. Also it would be great to be able to track body fat percentage as well as weight. Keep up the great work!!!!!

title: Great platform
body: I am writing this because I am tired of the pop ups telling me too.... but overall great platform, it's hard for me to give 5 stars for any app. Reason here is that the food library isn't too large, especially when compared to mfp. I am speaking in terms of exterior places such as Chipotle, and food places. (Don't dog me, I am not strict on counting right now haha)

title: I'll never go back!
body: Once you get used to the app and how to track macros this is an amazing app! The recipes are a bit tedious but there's not really any way to improve that. The database isn't like MFP but I feel like it is way more accurate than MFP so there's that! Love the app use it every day, worth the money

title: This App is a Diet Game-Changer
body: I love this app! With the help of it and regular exercise, I have lost 85+lbs. over the last year and a half. The missing link for most people attempting to lose weight is tracked no their food. My Macros+ makes that task simple and easy.

title: No meal customizer
body: First off, I'm looking for an app that will help me check my protein and carb intake. Loved how I found a brand name pizza I ordered and got exactly how much carbs and protein I ate (Papa John's 8" pizza).

title: Almost there
body: I'm really happy with your app.  I find it user friendly and had no issues with it.  However, if anyone is counting macros then they are surely exercising and it makes so sense to have a sister app that is horrible.  Maybe give us a small section here that updates everyday exercises such as walking, elliptical, weights, running, etc.

title: Easy and user friendly
body: After tinkering in app for a few hours (setting up meals and ingredients) the app becomes really easy to use. Highly recommended by me as well as a good friend of mine. Still haven't explored my circle but so far it's been really fun tracking my meals and learning what the app has to offer. 4 stars for early frustrations on usage. Great app.

title: Valid Marco Counting
body: If you're getting serious about counting your macro and micro nutrients, this app is for you. You can create your own foods and/or take barcode pictures. I give 4 stars because the 'search' ability is not helpful. The search engine doesn't find food easily nor do the pre-added brands consistently match to realistic calorie counts. Overall, great app! I've been using My Macros+ for a year!

title: Easy to track !
body: I just started tracking my macros, and I love this app. It makes it easy to customize your food entries, and I like all of the meal options. You are able to edit the macros of food that you have scanned the barcode, and I don't mind manually entering my food.

title: I like it’s format however....
body: I do enjoy the format of this app. It’s easy to navigate and add things in. However, every time I scan a barcode the nutritional facts are inaccurate...as well as the label scanner. I then have to go manually add the item myself which takes up a lot of time. I don't think it’s worth the money if you can’t even find the items you’re looking for.

title: Don’t waste your $$
body: I bought this app due to recommendations from Macros, Inc. What I didn’t realize is that you have to manually enter all your own food. I do wish there had been a free trial of this app.

title: Easy to learn & use
body: This app is great for macro tracking in higher detail! Very easy to learn and use. It remembers your foods, meals, recipes. My favorite part is you can set multiple macro days (high/low carb, etc) and also switch back & forth from what you've eaten that day & what you have left.

title: Works for me!
body: I use this app everyday for macro tracking and it works great for me. Once I learned my way around it and customized common meals/foods I eat, it has streamlined the process immensely.

title: Too clogged up with duplicate foods
body: I want to love this app but I just really find it cumbersome to use. When I search for a food there are often many duplicates and they're sometimes different units, or not units that we typically eat. Maybe creating my own database is the way to go. I'm willing to keep working with it because I think macros are the way to go - that's what I want to track, not calories.

title: Great App
body: I've paid for the plus version and I use this every day. It allows me to keep track of what I need to eat and for the most part has almost every item you need in the barcode database. Can't think of anything that would make this better.

title: Used for a year and still an empty database
body: Ok, I can see the database being empty when first created but this has been established for at least two years yet still an inefficient database. I still have to have MFP on my phone simply to search items not in My Macros. Not really something expected from an app you pay for

title: Love this app!
body: My Macros + is easy to use & navigate!  If i have any issues customer service is very prompt & helpful. They are always ensuring the app is up to date with new features.  I have literally tracked my food (almost) everyday for practically 3 years!  Keeps me in check!!

title: Needs an update/bug fixes
body: For an app I paid for, I expect a little more. The layout seems squished on my normal sized iPhone. Seems more suited for a plus maybe? My account tab and add food tab are practically on top of each other. The add food tab is half off the screen (cut off).

title: Broken
body: I’m going to try again in a week to see if there’s just something weird going on, but the only thing I’ve tried to do so far is as one type of food, then play around with how the serving information is displayed, and add it to a meal. The result was the app saying that I’ve consumed only tiny decimal amounts of macros from that food, but somehow gone 1.2k calories over my daily caloric budget. Obviously not the case.

title: Way better than MyFitnessPal
body: I love the way this app is structured. MyFitnessPal feels extremely all over the place and it caused me to overthink every macro to the gram. This app makes it so much better from a visual stand point and it's more cut and dry. MyFitnessPal is way overboard on information overload. No thank you. mm+ is where it's at!

title: Great app
body: The is a great app for macro tracking and customer service was quick and responsive when I lost my data due to having to delete and reinstall the app. Everything’s running perfectly now. Highly recommend!

title: Way better than MyFitnessPal
body: If you've used MyFitnessPal before, you know some of the limitations in the app.

title: The best in macro tracking
body: This app is very easy and to the point. If you are a first timer calculating macros this is the best app to use. Adding custom meals is simple and you can always copy over previous days meals into your current day, that one function alone helps so much.

title: Great app, easy to use
body: I love this app. The barcode scanner has worked on the majority of items I scan. I have to manually enter some items but it doesn't take long so I don't mind. The saved items make it easy and fast to add foods to your day. No complaints.

title: Umm... macros coach
body: Am I missing something ? I used to be able to access my macro coach / calculator and now I have to pay $10 a month after I already paid for the app ? 👎🏻 shouldn’t advertise that as part of what you get if you now have to pay additional money .

title: Loyal User but Needs Improvement
body: Developers need to stop adding useless features and add things that matter. For example, sure you can have various nutrition goals that allow you to cycle but why is there no option to preprogram a week of carb cycling? That makes no sense. I don’t want to have to switch out every day. And database needs work no matter what you say.

title: Easy to use
body: This app is very easy to use! I’ve had it for two years and it’s been great! I would highly recommend you build your own database so you know it’s right plus let the app calculate the calories. Would highly recommend!!

title: Love this app
body: Love the app I’ve used a lot over the past 2 years.

title: Best macro app!
body: Love this app! Easy to use! I’ve been using it for about a year and have built up my database of macro data for the food I eat. Recently thought I had lost all my data when I got a new phone. They recovered and restored a year’s worth of my food data. Thank you

title: A little wonky, doesn’t make much sense.
body: It’s also almost impossible to find standard items in the search such as onion, potato, or other fruits and veggies.
response: Hi Jay, I believe our support just assisted you this morning about how you must have accidentally deleted the food from your log which is why it wasn't showing up in the frequent and recent lists anymore.

title: Amazing team
body: My macros team has been incredible to help me get my app working after buying a new phone. They were quick to respond to my email and I am extremely satisfied as their customer for over 4 years.

title: Great app
body: This app is so simple to use. After trying several macro tracking apps, I've finally found one that has everything I need. From a macro calculator to a daily food diary, etc. This app has it all. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Great tool but could improve
body: I love the app I just wish there were more options when searching for foods. I'm not sure how they acquire their database but I feel like it comes up with no search results too often. The add custom food feature makes this only a minor inconvenience though.

title: Great app overall
body: Overall works really well. Could do a bit better with fast food options. But if you save it once after looking it up and creating it in your quick log it not bad.

title: Not able to link with Fitbit
body: Not a very large food data bank as compared to MFP.

title: Best diet app
body: Been dieting and bodybuilding for 8 years!

title: Hard to learn
body: Still struggling to figure out the app.  Would like some pages to close out when done editing.  Little things I’m use to with other apps

title: Best nutrition tracking app
body: Way easier to use than my fitness pal and plus it’s cheaper, so win win. They also stay consistent with updates and it looks way better than it did way back when I downloaded it.

title: Bad update
body: Would’ve been five stars but they got rid of the option to search your own customized and recently inputted foods. Rather than search I have to scroll through every single one now. Kind of mind blowing this WAS a feature and they got rid of it. As time goes on and I keep inputting more foods I’ll be more and more likely to drop this app. Please fix.

title: Great App
body: I love using this app. Makes tracking macros easy. And I have used many other apps in the past. I love being able to scan the barcode instead of having to type in the nutritional info.  Customer service is very helpful & fast as well. I highly recommend!

title: I wanted to like this app
body: I’m a long time mfp user and they are the number one app for good reason. This app is so time consuming. I think the major miss here is the inability to change the measurement of a food. For example, I weight my Kirkland egg whites, but it comes up in the app as per cup. I’m not trying to do all these conversions. Logging food is annoying. I just want to be in and be out. It doesn’t seem like I’ll get that with this app.

title: What a joy to find this
body: I used lose it app since getting serious about diet and calories in Jan. But realized that while I was eating lower calories some days I'd eat too much carbs, other days fat or protein was out of wack.

title: Love It!
body: This is one of the best macro tracking apps out there. User interface is intuitive, the library of foods is large and it does a good job showing you where you are and what's left. My sole suggestion would be to add an area to report exercise.

title: Problems!
body: Although this app seems to have great potential, it is not easy to navigate. In addition, I’ve only had it for about an hour, and it has already crashed on me 10 times! Come on guys, get it together!

title: Best ever!
body: I've been using this app for about 2 years and I can't say enough good things about it. I've compared it to other apps that people have told me to use and I just find it to be easier and more user friendly!

title: Lost data
body: I’ve had this app before and stopped using it since I had been religiously using MyNetDiary. I had been tracking here as much as possible since the first of March. I wanted to customize my meals better. somehow I lost all of my data... not just from the first of month but everything that I had entered from prior use! As customizable as this can be, it’s a huge hassle coming from other apps 😑

title: Fantastic customer service.
body: Responded to my issue right away on a Sunday. Problem with the iOS 12 update was resolved quickly. Rather than be annoyed for a few days it was taken care of in hours.

title: 5 Stars
body: I love this app- it’s helped me track and figure out macros for nearly a year now. When I switched phones I lost all my data. I reached out to customer service and they were super helpful! Got all my data back! Highly recommend!

title: Not great for having to pay $2.99
body: They don’t have a huge database for food like MyFitnessPal so it’s been taking me way longer to input everything manually, also you can’t change from kcal to cal. I’ve tried to put in red potatoes for a meal and it will not show up under the meal and doesn’t subtract the calories, protein or anything from my totals but if I try to add it again it acts as if it’s already been inputted. Overall too many issues for not being free.

title: Nutrition Goals No longer work
body: Hi! I loved this app and use it every day to track my weight however after the recent update you can no longer create a new nutrition goal profile via nutrition calculator because the activity level option doesn’t work. When you click on it it does nothing. This now makes it impossible to create a new goal/macros and track your goals.

title: Great app but there is a learning curve!
body: This app is great and has tons of features for tracking your dietary and fitness goals. It does take a little bit of time to figure out how to use all these features but it’s fantastic once you do.

title: Eh. Could be better and free app can do more
body: Cant track some of the stuff. Tried to put 160grams of chicken and it wouldnt let me and didnt gave me an option go do it. It just had per piece and that was it. Tried to custom my own meal by putting in all the info and still wouldnt give me an option for oz or grams. Everything cant be measured by per piece or pieces cuz it weighs different.

title: App was incredible until it started to crash every time I tried using it
body: This app was amazing and so handy for me until it started to crash and not letting me be able to use it. Is there anything u can do to stop this problem. I’ve already tried rebooting my phone, updating the app, deleting and downloading it again...

title: Great App
body: I used to use MFP to track my macros, kcal and gauge my weekly intake. Since they have added crazy fees to all the features, I looked for something else. I found this app and I love the advanced tools, layout and features. I recommend this app to my clients as well.

title: Could not be happier with this app
body: Ranked No. 4 for Health and Fitness is no surprise. Great job creating this extremely useful and beneficial app.

title: New layout
body: I loved having my total macros visible at all times at the bottom of the screen. Now every time I make changes to meals I have to scroll to the bottom to see the new totals. App is still great, but it’s a bit inconvenient now.

title: Awesome App
body: I use this app and my wife uses MyFitnessPal. I looked over their configuration and layout it, it seems more complicated. This app has more flexibility when it comes to inputting food nutrition over MyFitnessPal.

title: Great UI, sucky food info
body: I give it a 5 for user interface— nicely organized and easy to use.

title: So hard to use
body: Nothing is eAsy to track in this app- the same meal that takes me 30 seconds to track in my fitness pal takes 3 minutes here. Would not recommend.

title: Feedback Ability
body: Would love to be able to submit feedback to n the app without having to write a review.

title: Great, and easy to use!
body: Not really much to say other than this is by far the easiest macro/calorie tracking app I’ve found in the past 3 years of looking.

title: Great App
body: This app fits my style way better than MFP. I can set the exact macros rather than have something try to set it for me. It isn't so much for someone looking for something to tell them what to eat. You have to figure that out somewhere else.

title: Has great potential
body: This app is easy to use but the barcode scanner need to be more accurate .  It doesn't always coincide with the label info.  I'm getting so used to using this though that I refuse to switch to anything else!

title: Doesn’t save your foods
body: I have entered foods into this app several times (which is VERY TEDIOUS and time consuming) and had a list going. I haven’t used the app in a while and now all of my saved foods are GONE! This has happened more than once, so now I’m not sure if I want to waste time entering all the info for a THIRD time! I’M SO FRUSTRATED WITH THIS APP!!! And contacting them? Forget it, there’s no contact info within the app to provide feedback or get help (if there is a way, they’ve hidden it very well).

title: Really well done and frequently updated app
body: I’ve been using this macro tracker app for over a year and absolutely love it. Easy to add in new foods, update existing values, build recipes etc.

title: Love it except...
body: I hated giving this app 2 stars. I love the app, there is one flaw that makes me hate it. There is a barcode scanner available when just searching for food. But if I am making a recipe, it takes FOREVER to find the correct items in my recipe. They need to incorporate a barcode scanner in the recipe search bar as well. It would help making recipes soooo much easier and more accurate.
response: Hi . Good news is that feature has been there for years, sorry It wasn't as intuitive to find, we'll definitely work on that.

title: Watch App issue
body: Love this app and was so excited to see that there was Apple Watch compatibility. Unfortunately, every time I try to open the app from my watch, it crashes. It will not load at all. I have looked everywhere online for solutions, really hoping it is just a bug that will be fixed soon, because I’d love to be able to use this feature! Brand new watch, and I’ve tried uninstalling, restarting etc. nothing has helped.

title: Rip-off
body: This is touted as being better than MyFitnessPlan because there is just a one time cost of $2.99 while MFP has a monthly cost.

title: Awesome app!!
body: Love it! Love the scanning feature and how easy it is to create recipes. I have bern using it for a while now and love it. Haven’t had any performance issues like with myfitnesspal that keeps changing my macros and calories to something different.

title: Water
body: Thank you so very much for outstanding service in responding to my request to fix my inability to add water measurements to my Macros. Great response and the updated that was provided exceeded my expectations on when that fix would be implemented. Outstanding.

title: Missing a lot of brands
body: As a major Kashi cereal eater, this app was totally useless to me. Also, names of foods with tons of variants get cut off so it’s hard to tell if you’ve found the right food (e.g., Almond Breeze almond milk).

title: Fantastic!
body: I use this app every single day. It is super intuitive and easy to use, especially with the custom food builder and barcode scanner. I highly recommend this app for anyone looking to track their daily caloric and macro nutrient intake!!

title: New convert
body: This app has made it so easy to keep track! I already feel a big improvement in energy level and focus. Before the app I thought I was in range but it quickly proved I was way off.

title: New version is great!
body: I've been using this app for over 1.5 years now. Everything works great. There was a hiccup once where all my favorite food in the history had their brand name removed. But besides that, it works great!

title: Love!
body: So I was tracking carbs with another app and then would come to this app to see meals... ultimately this app after learning to use t properly gives me everything I need to track my macros and gain the results I'm working towards! It's 80% diet!!

title: Food library not as good as other free apps
body: Food library is not as good as other apps that are free and it’s annoying that you can’t just add a custom food without putting in the entire recipe. So for example. You can’t add “Mexican egg scramble” or whatever and enter in the nutrition info without actually creating the recipe and putting in every ingredient. App is just ok

title: Not what I thought
body: This had a coach, and calculator, that if you pay an additional 10 bucks a month you can use. So I just paid 3 bucks for the app, and it won’t even calculate my macros that I should be eating, unless I do a 7 day trial that will most like turn into me paying $10, because it won’t get cancelled correctly or until after the due date. Not what I was looking for.
response: Hi Arsenaut, Sorry for the confusion but the nutrition calculator is completely free, no extra charge. Macro Coach is our artificial intelligence powered macro coaching system which is an optional in app purchase, but the nutrition calculator is fully included.

title: Not happy with this updated version
body: The older version was easier to maneuver... you could copy a meal from day to day without having to copy the whole day and then subtract everything but that one meal.

title: Not intuitive
body: Trying to log food portions wasn’t very intuitive. Everything about every food entry can be edited so it’s easy to enter the wrong information. I was unable to find a way for my macro goal to only count net carbs for keto diet. I honestly don’t know why this is getting so many positive reviews. It takes too much effort to learn and figure out how to do anything and support is no help at all.

title: Frustrating + extra time consuming
body: You search for a food, and it gives you an infinite list of foods that have nothing to do with what you’re looking for... example: I’m looking for a burger, it’s showing tacos and burritos, avocado oil mayo??! I wish it was more straightforward... it’s very time consuming if you’re just beginning to use the app...

title: Very glitchy on iPhone 12 Pro
body: This app needs a lot of work. The barcode scanner won’t read half the time, I try to add custom entries or change the method of weighing things and literally nothing changes when I hit update. Would be a nice app if it worked like it should, although someone like my mom wouldn’t figure it out in a million years because it’s not intuitive at ALL.

title: Great for MMA fighters and athletes
body: If you want to track your diet and macros for weight cuts or competition this is a great app. It also works for general diet tracking to keep yourself on track for healthy lifestyle. The barcode scanner is my favorite feature.

title: Awesome App
body: If you are trying to track your daily macros, this is the app for you. Let's you customize and add as needed. Love it!  Especially since MFP sold out to corporate and they now charge you to have multiple macro settings, etc.

title: Don't Let The Description & Pictures Fool You
body: I was excited about this app based off reviews and the pictures. However, it was extremely disappointing and frustrating that the graphs and analytics described is not included. Once you purchase the app you have the option to make additional monthly payments or an annual payment for the added features. Wish I would have know this before I purchased it.

title: Food logging
body: Is it possible to scan food items in?? If not can I get a refund? I don't think this will work for me! It seems very overwhelming to log each individual food and nutrition content.

title: Perfect for those trying to lose weight
body: All I need to track my meals and stay on track with my diet goals. Definitely would have bought for a higher price.

title: Frustrating
body: I tried entering a recipe and 10 minutes later, I've only added 3 ingredients. How does the database not have basic, whole foods like avocado and a fresh onion?! I can find packaged, processed foods all day but when it comes to fresh produce, it's an absolute pain!  It's hard enough to track accurate macros when you're first starting out and this app does not make it any easier.

title: Better than MyFitnessPal!
body: I highly recommend this app over MFP. I have a lot of experience using both apps to track my calories and macros... once you use this app, you will think MFP is a joke! This app is 100x better!!!

title: Database is confusing
body: There may be a ton of entries but it’s confusing to use. For example, I searched for chicken broth and got no results. I searched for bell pepper and got everything but bell pepper. Also the barcode scanner does not give correct values- at least it doesn’t match the nutrition label on what I’ve scanned. Truly the UI of this app needs to be improved especially if your going to charge for it.

title: I hate the changes!
body: Why did you do this? I use to recommend this to my clients over My Fitness Pal. You removed all the reasons why. In addition all my foods are gone and they can’t be searched. So disappointed 👎🏾

title: And now with better UI
body: This app has always well done functionality wise, but the UI was lacking. The recent UI update was definitely a step in the right direction. Keep it up!

title: Just what the doctor ordered
body: Not really, I didn't need to see a doctor but this app has held me accountable. I'm more cautious about what I eat and find keeping track of my daily caloric intake intriguing. It's awesome. I couldn't ask for a better app!

title: Extremely Disappointing, Lots of work, Tedious, Underwhelming
body: They advertise the MyMacros+ app as swipe and done.  Wrong, Wrong Wrong.....  Just try to find "raw ginger". Not there.  You will look thru hundreds of entries (ginger ale, ginger beer, ginger candy) but no raw ginger.  Or, try to find "raw carrot".  Again, you will look thru maybe thousands of entries for carrot cake, carrot bread, before you find just plain raw carrot.  Its mind numbing and wasteful of my time.  Especially for an app I pay for and pay the additional monthly fee.

title: THE BEST
body: Okay, let me just say that I've tried other Marco tracking apps and this one is BY FAR the most user friendly, easiest to track, and amazing app I have found to show my fitness goals who's boss.

title: Loving it
body: This app has almost everything what it doesn't have you can create your own. It charts and graphs everything I had no idea I wasn't getting enough calories. It's really helped me to achieve my goal.

title: Love the app!
body: The barcode scanner is so convenient, and any foods not in the system already can be quickly and easily added and saved. I've used this app every day since downloading.

title: Trash
body: I purchased this app months ago and I really disliked the process of inputting your meals. I could never find what I was looking for. However, I really enjoyed the graphs that showed your body weight. I was recording my body weight everyday until today when the app started telling me it was now a pro feature! I already paid for the app and now I need a monthly subscription just to record my weight on tracking app??? TRASH APP

title: New update ☹️
body: NOT impressed with this new update. I had been loving the app, but the fact it no longer shows how much you’ve gone over is very frustrating. It also doesn’t show what your goal calories is for the day. I like the way it looks in general, but the ease of use has went downhill.

title: Great app!
body: I’m a strongman competitor and keeping track of what I eat on a day to day basis makes preparing for a weight cut so simple. I’m able to share my meal log with my coaches and teammates for feedback, which makes tweaking my plan so simple. Thanks, Jason & Crew!

title: ok but why buy app + pay for subscription?
body: the app is ok. as other people mentioned, the barcode scanner is hit or miss. the food search is hit but typically miss. if i want to search for a simple Granny Smith Apple, the weirdest results come up. most offensive to me - i paid for the app. then within the app they want you to subscribe (i.e., pay more money) for the remaining features. a disappointment.

title: Doesn’t track net carbs correctly
body: My experience has been that this app doesn’t track net carbs correctly whether by scanning the label or searching for it using the barcode. In addition the food database is limited. The search wouldn’t bring up any results for a yellow bell pepper. I do really like the label scanning feature.

title: Blows MyFitPal away
body: So much better than my fitness pal. MUCH more detailed. Better goals. More power to edit settings. Set multiple macro goals per week 10/10 better than any other app.

title: Easy to use
body: This app is super easy to use. It's been a big help in sticking to my plan. I especially love the macro status bar at the top of each day, letting you see exactly what you have left for the day.

title: Seriously awesome.
body: THE easiest way to stay on task with your nutrition/fitness goals. The custom food entries are crucial. Once you take the time to add all the main foods that you eat through out an average week the rest is smooth sailing.

title: Not always accurate
body: Love this app but I’ve noticed I have to correct a lot of the nutritional values after scanning a barcode. Luckily, it’s fairly easy to change but just kind of a hassle at times. Other than that, I really LOVE this app. The best macro tracker I’ve used so far.

title: Great tech support
body: Love the app and easy to use. I got a new phone and thought I lost all my data but customer service was very prompt and helped my out quickly. Highly recommended!

title: Great tool for nutrition and fat loss!
body: Easy to use tool to track nutrition for weight or fat loss! We think we know what we eat until we track and really see exactly what goes into our body. 👍🏻

title: Very complicated to enter
body: When you search a food it doesn’t pull up foods easily and then it doesn’t give you options to change the serving you have to research and scroll through and it takes forever to find the brand or you have. I found this app very difficult in comparison to MyFitnessPal. The only thing I liked better was you can enter your macros as the goal opposed to calories.

title: My Macros App
body: Wow. I’ve had this app for 3 weeks now. Very impressed with how detailed it is and all the really precise and accurate features that help me get dialed in on managing my nutrition goals. Seriously considering upgrading to the pro version.

title: why are my recents and fav foods disappearing?
body: love the app until recently when items i’ve looked up and favorited as well as my own custom entries are disappearing!

title: STREAK GONE - AWFUL APP
body: My 253 day streak has changed to a 3 day streak with the update today. I pay for premium, but I’m not even sure why anymore since there are constant issues with this app. The streak was the only thing keeping me in this app, but since it’s screwed up again, I might as well go to another app with a much better, verified library items that’s isn’t so cumbersome.
response: Hi Trixie, In the last update we didn't change anything with the calorie calculation aspect of the app. If you're having any problems please shoot our support an email and we can definitely help you out!

title: IIFYM!
body: Great for managing macros if you're only focusing on total calories, fats, carbs, and protein. I would give the app 5 stars if the body weight graph would allow weekly averages instead of bi-weekly averages; reason being is that macros are better adjusted when analyzing body weight averages over 7-day periods.

title: Bodybuilder's Dream
body: This app makes tracking your macros so easy and the creators are so responsive. They've even included some of my suggestions. I use the app everyday and can't imagine not having it.

title: Love it!!!
body: I have used all the other apps as well as Nutribase software since I am always conscience of my nutrition being a bodybuilder and I find this app the best of all! The only downfall is searching for some foods can be a task.

title: App problems
body: The app so far is about 3 stars, issues when you are sliding back and forth between the meals and scanning or adding food items. When you slide back and forth it thinks you are trying to delete or change an item because it is so sensitive.

title: Good but would love more data
body: Tracking macros and calories is super helpful, but I’d love to be able to see weekly, monthly, and yearly averages of my macros and calories for when I do go off under or over my macros.

title: Painfully inconvenient
body: This app is so frustrating to use. The barcode doesn’t recognize a lot of foods. I have had to add my food based on ingredients and obviously that is sometimes incomplete if you have to order out or get prepackaged prep meals. It also doesn’t carry any of the newer brands of food that supply meals. If you cook every single bit of your own food, this app is okay at best. But if you are on the go, this app is not for you.

title: Had it for years
body: By far the best macro tracker. No monthly subscription. Very straight forward and easy to use. Way better than any other app I’ve tried for tracking macros.

title: Has a fatal flaw
body: The app has good features, but it has a fatal flaw: from my experience, there is no way to select different serving amounts without “editing” the food and having to manually adjust all the nutrition data! Most nutrition tracking apps I’ve used allow users to easily switch serving amounts-usually with a drop down menu. This app has no way to this basic functionality.

title: Good app
body: It took me a minute to figure it out but now it’s a very easy app to use and I’m able to keep up with my macros. I have already lost a few pounds in one week and plan to keep going.

title: Buggy
body: This app would be perfect if it didn’t crash or have UI glitches that require restarting and make features unusable. When searching for foods, if you try to filter the UI moves upward and you can’t go back to your search, making it unusable. Many items also can’t be found by barcode. Disappointing.

title: Worth every penny
body: Can't think of a better interface and design for the application, not to mention the seamlessness in which new foods are found and added. Great work, well done!

title: The best calorie tracker
body: Forget my fitness pal, this is the best tracker. I got it hoping it would help with macros as well as calories. It does just that. No ads, no garbage, worth more than the price. Easy, comprehensive. I have nothing bad to say.

title: Good, but room for growth
body: Overall, I'm happy with this app and use it daily. Once custom foods and recipes have been added, it's a snap to add them to the daily log.

title: Great App- but crashes whenever I attempt to register an account
body: Great app- I’m able to keep track of all my food and water intake. However, i am attempting to create an account but the app keeps crashing whenever I click ‘Register New Account’.

title: If you’re going to charge at least make it work
body: I have no problem paying for an app, but this thing is so buggy it barely works. I want to add a recipe and have to do some finagling just to get it to add. I can’t go online to add it either since I’m not a “premium” subscriber. If I can’t add stuff via the app I’m not going to pay more to do it online.

title: For Math it’s good
body: To keep this review simple.

title: Best Tracking app EVER!
body: I love this app. It tracks everything so much more accurately than any other apps I’ve tried. I use all the features and don’t have a single complaint about any of them!

title: Works great
body: This app works incredibly well and I love how the developers have shown promise in recent updates to the design and functionality. My ideas for needed improvements: allow us to track a NET carb macro, and the Apple Watch seriously needs a complication.

title: Best macro tracking
body: Love it. Way more consistency in terms of accurate macro nutrition within database. Has all the options that fit pal charges a monthly rate for. Versatile, user friendly. Helped me to lose over 50lbs!!

title: Sometimes hard to track
body: I really like this app and have used it on and off for years. This time as well as in the past it’s difficult and timely at first until you get your regular foods logged in. Once that happens it seems better.

title: Great app!
body: This app is extremely intuitive and easy to use! My only complaint is that the database of food isn't big enough and is sometimes inaccurate.

title: Best app for preps
body: Way better than MFP for those who know what they're doing when it comes to counting macros. So much easier to deal with, interface is hassle free and completely customizable.

title: The gold standard
body: Heard about this app trough a JRE podcast. This is the first time I've been able to track my app with this much ease. Haven't run into any glitches yet after 1 month.

title: Incorrect
body: I don’t have the time to input everything I eat because non junk food is not in the database.  One egg...in ounces?  Database of 500,000 foods all repetitive but incorrect amounts.  Make drop downs that a food can be inputted correctly, please.  Half of a raw avocado, sliced...not an option, just mashed or cubed option...I don’t have the time to put in all my foods separately and then figure out the macro nutrients.  I thought that was what this app would do?

title: Awesome App!
body: Love the accuracy, and the ability to really take control of my diet.  I never have to guess if the entry is correct, because I know it is with the setup!  The change was tough initially, but so worth it!

title: Great app
body: Great app to track macros. I had an issues transferring my data over when I got a new phone and support emailed me back within hours to figure out the problem

title: App
body: The app is very buggy. That alone takes away from the experience.. it also seems like a very small data base of food. Just stick with my fitness pal...

title: Down from 261 pounds to 167 pounds.
body: My son got amazing results with my macros plus.

title: My macros app
body: Overall good app to keep track of food. Had to manually enter quite a bit of food. I like it has feature to calculate macros or you can change. Wish you could adjust calories.

title: Great app
body: I love this app! So much better for tracking macros than MFP. I love that I can add all my foods as custom entries and it does the calorie math for me so macros and calories always match up. The customer service is great as well, very responsive.

title: BEST APP TO TRACK MACROS
body: I seriously love this app!!! It's easy to use, visually appealing, and I haven't found a single food not on there. Definitely worth the price, and after using several different nutrient trackers, I know this one is the best.

title: Wasted money.
body: This app is awful. The database doesn't contain Whole Foods or fresh veggies. I can't find zucchini or onions. I can't find BUTTER!! Only processed crap listen in the broad, sweeping results. I bought this to sync with avatar but it's totally pointless. Give me my money back so I can give it to someone else. It's easier to use a better app and not have the avatar syncing than to manually google the stats of onions and enter them into this app.

title: Pretty Ridiculous for the Price
body: Seemed like the app I was seeking but upon actually downloading it, the functions are more basic than some of the free versions of this. It’s 3 dollars just to buy the app and then you need a subscription. It doesn’t show how your intake of nutrients matches up to the daily recommended values. Maybe it does when you pay more but I am not going to risk paying more for a crappy app.

title: save your money find another app that constantly want more of my cash
body: after struggling for a few months and building keto recipes till i’m blue in the face i’ve taken it off my phone. they may brag about millions of food items in the data base i’m tried of searching through endless scrolls on my smart phone.  the online browser version should work with the smart phone app without bleeding you for more money.   the exercise app should work but you have to purchase another app.    i’m all milked out of cash and having to work way to hard to track     go to sparkpeople it’s so much easier and found all the keto foods already in there database and all for free!

title: New update is not good
body: Not liking the new update where it puts the entire nutrition info at the bottom. It’s so crammed and hard to tell if you went over/under overall calories. Please revert back to the old one where it just has the caloric/total macros at the bottom

title: Awesome app!
body: I have been tracking macros for years now and I absolutely LOVE this app. Create different macro goals to use for different workout days. Spread your macros over the day however you want.

title: Great app
body: I have been using this app for the couple of years.  I feel the tracking is more accurate than other apps.  Customer support is awesome as well!

title: Excellent
body: Love this app!  And the customer service is phenomenal!!!  Thank you Jason Loewy!  He helped me solve my problem between my new phone and the app and got me back up and running!!!!  Thank you!  Thank you! Thank you!!!

title: Tracking Macros Great Coach Portion is NOT RECOMMENDED
body: I’ve been using this app for 4 years.  It works great to track foods versus macros.

title: Best Marcos counter for bodybuilders
body: I love my macros +. I have tried a few counters and this one is the best for bodybuilders. Easy to use and lots of functions for the standard price. No monthly fees for tracking and showing macros.

title: Easy to Use
body: This app makes it easy to track my daily macros. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for an easy tool to track.

title: Great app
body: I love this app! The food database isn't as extensive as myfitnesspal (you can add new food easily in this app anyway), but the levels of customization make this a must for any macro-tracker. The recipe feature is amazing too!

title: Not beginner friendly
body: If you are wanting to manually enter every single nutritional fact about every food you eat than this app is for you. Unless you buy every single meal from a restaurant you will have to put in the nutritional facts and find out how many servings you ate or plan to eat.

title: Great App & Easy to Use
body: I love this app! I’ve been using it for about a year now to track all my macros. It’s even easier once you start adding all of your recipes and custom foods.

title: Not bad
body: The app works for the most part for tracking. The issue is when switching to a new phone, it removed every recipe I’ve ever favorited and made in the app.

title: Food log
