body: Not impressed with the food search and portion sizes given. Barcode works occasionally when scanning foods.

title: Update needs fixing!
body: I need to enter a new macro goal and when I enter it and click done it just goes back to the screen. Isn’t actually saving.

title: Best app
body: I’ve been using this app on-and-off for about 5 years to track my macros. It is by far the best one out there and I will never use another macro-tracking tool. (CrossFitter & Runner)

title: I cannot figure this app out
body: I downloaded this app because i didn’t want to pay $80 to renew my MyFitnessPal subscription. I scanned my food and it didn’t accurately upload the information. I scanned 6oz of egg whites and everything was 0? This app is not user friendly. I cannot figure out what I’m doing wrong? I played with my settings and watched the video on how to enter food. I ended up renewing MyFitnessPal.

title: New Update. Looks Good, Worse Stats
body: New update messed with my daily streak, and it’s also no longer tells you how much in the negative you are for the day. It just caps at 0 remaining and won’t tell you how far you went over. In general it looks nicer, but the above issues and general ease of access of the app have gotten much worse

title: Great App use it with Avatar nutrition
body: I love this app it works great for tracking your macros. Takes a little bit to get used to but once you have your frequently eaten foods in the data base it's awesome.

title: Useful
body: The only issues I run into are that the barcode scanner isn't always accurate and even with global search on, I don't always find the food I'm looking for so I end up manually and entering a lot of foods

title: So convenient
body: Decided to finally start counting macros, and this makes it stupidly easy. Way easier then scribbling notes in a notebook after each meal.

title: Needs improvement
body: Every time I try to click on the custom & fav it completely shuts the app down. No matter if I'm on my phone or my IPad. It has been doing this for the last 2 years. Really like the app but it does need some improvements. Overall it is a good app.

title: MyFitnessPal is much better
body: This is cheaper, but you get what you pay for. Catalogue of foods is not accurate and the app is not intuitive. You also have to pay extra to manage on desktop. Poor quality app trying to solve a problem that already has a solution. Waste of money.

title: Love it!
body: I've tried multiple different food tracking apps, this one is by far the easiest for me to use has made all the difference!!!

title: Needs a larger data base
body: I would prefer to use this instead of my fitness pal but I always find myself turning back to my fitness pal to find the nutrition information for the food I track in this app.

title: Awesome
body: Customize your own entries

title: Excellent Customer Service
body: I emailed customer service with a question about an app feature and they got back to me within hours!

title: Love the update, bbuutttttt....
body: The decision to put white typing on a light grey background for the search bar in the customs and favs section was not well thought out. I cannot read what I am typing AT ALL. Pleas change the font to a darker color.

title: Awesome tracker!
body: So just started using Macros and this app has been very helpful! Love the calculator, scan option, and the ability to adjust all the information!

title: 3 dollars for this?
body: Not worth it, I thought I'd be investing in a quality app, nope, it's worse than my fitness pal and then they have the audacity to ask for a subscription for the things they advertised for the 3 dollar purchase.

title: Pretty good...but...
body: Like the app, but I can't wish they would set it up so you can just click on what meal you want to input, not find all the food first then hit the meal. All my meals end up under one meal most days. Otherwise, good app.

title: Gym owner and trainer
body: This app is the best hands down. I recommend it to my clients over many others. Yes it takes time, but it's worth it once you get your stuff entered. Re-entry of info is a breeze.

title: Not user friendly
body: I found this app a bit confusing and for having to pay for it I didn’t feel like it offered very many options. There are other apps on the market that are free to do the same thing this one does. Maybe it’s great for their clients and integrated with both of their apps but I definitely found my $2.99 to be a waste of money

title: Great App
body: Great App for tracking macros.  The only drawback is sometimes have to edit scanned item results or have to directly input items not found.  But overall it is a really good app.  Glad I found it.

title: Great mea tracking app
body: I’ve been using this app for years and it works great, the developers make regular updates and are responsive to questions. Thank you!

title: Do Not Purchase
body: This app is terrible.  Their library of food is insufficient - even when you scan bar codes they do not populate. When you send questions and inquiries it takes days to get responses.  The responses are irrelevant and the person replying seems to have little education in regards to the basics let alone more sophisticated questions.  Save yourself the headache - go somewhere else.

title: Day 1 Review
body: After downloading the app and getting all my info input it seems pretty good. I would like to see venison added to the meat section and maybe even a place to add or synchronized workout information.

title: Calories + Macros: The Best Way to Loose
body: I lost 20 pounds and with the help of a coach learned how to eat properly, control volume and keep my weight consistent.

title: Great easy app for tracking diet focusing on macros
body: There is room for improvement, but this app is awesome as it is. Responsive and simple, I use it everyday and it gets me back to life quickly.

title: Won't sync
body: Can't get syncing to happen. It's been almost a week and it hasn't been synced to Avatar yet. Support tells me to wait a few days and log some food.  Both thugs I already did before reaching out for support. Hopefully once this is corrected, I will like the app.

title: Latest Update Causes Crash, Can’t Open
body: Please fix, I can’t open the app since the update on 9/29!!! Tried re-downloading the app, restarting phone. Doesn’t work!!!

title: Toddler nutrient tracking
body: Finally found an app that works for little guys. Would love the option of tracking macros but just happy getting the protein, carbs and fats for now.

title: Calculate and the activity level is not working well
body: Calculate and the activity level is not working well  as previous version of the app.

title: Billing Issues
body: I had heard good things about this app so wanted to give it a try. After a couple days realized not for me and just went back to MyFitnessPal. I have tried to cancel payment for a month now and I can’t cancel. It just doesn’t show up in my active apps/subscriptions. I have followed all suggested ways to cancel but none work. I can’t get anyone to respond.

title: Needs work
body: I’m disappointed as the search feature really doesn’t work well at all. Unless you have a UPC to scan it’s hard to find anything. I like that my macros are across the top to see what I have left. It is difficult to navigate and rather frustrating so I’m going back to my old app.

title: Bad updates
body: I have been using this app for upwards of 4 years and have always loved it until recently. The last couple of updates have really messed with the effectiveness of the app. It’s become crazy glitchy and being unable to now add or even change my existing macro goal renders the app basically unusable for me. Please fix to return to the app I once loved!

title: Through Life’s Changes
body: I’ve used this app during bodybuilding competition training, pregnancy and post partum.  The changes keep this app current and fresh.

title: Great App
body: Been using since January 1, 2019. Then I weighed 208 and felt and looked fat.  Now over a year later my weight holds at 177 and I I feel great.  I track my food everyday and I’m never hungry. MyMacros is the best.

title: Like it! Would recommend to anyone
body: Have been using this for a year and it has everything I need

title: Perfect for tracking!
body: I've tried several other apps to track my calories and macros, but this one is the best by far!

title: Disappointed
body: After so many glowing reviews, I found the app lacking to say the least. Used the barcode scanner option (which I frequently use in other tracking app) and it doesn’t even give me the right items. When it actually finds the correct item, the values are all wrong. It was a total waste of money.

title: Scammy app with horrible customer service
body: Do not use this app. Cancelling is a nightmare and they won’t even explain it to you. They will tell you to look on the website where there are unhelpful and confusing links and other nonsense. Disgusting marketing practices here.

title: Don’t waste your money, get nutritionix
body: I wasted my money because this came highly recommended by Dave Asprey (Bulletproof Diet founder). I used this alongside nutritionix to see which would be better and to see the differences/similarities to ensure I was consistent.

title: BEST macro app out!
body: I’ve been using this for over two years now and it works so well. I recommend it being used by all of my clients. So easy to use

title: Won’t even allow me to log in!
body: Heard a lot of good things about the macro tracking and figured it was worth the 2.99. WRONG! If you create an account from their website, good luck getting the app to login to that account. I had to reset my password multiple times only to come to a conclusion that it’s just not going to work. Hopefully apple will refund me for a dud!

title: Stop messing with the app we love!
body: With the constant layout changes it’s gone from clean, simplistic and easy to use, to looking like a display on a kid’s toy tablet. If you wanna make changes, there should be an option to change the “theme” so people who like the old layout can continue to see their nutrition the way the wanna see it!

title: Love this app! Using for 5yrs +
body: I’ve used this app to help me stay on track for fitness competitions the last 5 years and now I’m continuing to use it for everyday maintenance.

title: Database is too low
body: The amount of food in the system isn’t as big as fitness pall and I Struggle as not all foods have cup measurement which is how I often like to measure what I eat.

title: Could have stuck with my fitness pal for free
body: My friend recommended this app to me. So far it's been extremely inconvenient. The foods I scan can never be found, and a lot of what I search does not pop up. I wouldn't have paid for this app if I'd known it would be so inconvenient. However, I do like how it calculates my macros for me.

title: Helpful, wish there was more
body: This app is great, but I wish that it were easier when it comes to adding food items.   The food library doesn’t seem as vast as some of the other apps out there, but honestly, if you aren’t lazy about it...just hand type everything.

title: Great app but my app keeps crashing
body: Great app been using since 2015 but this app suddenly is crashing everytime at launch. Please fix this soon, thanks!!

title: Last update
body: App works great, but the most recent update causes the app to open for a few seconds and then close on its own.

title: This app needs a lot of work
body: I signed up for a free trial so I could have the help with calculating my macros. The food library is not very big. The app is clunky and hard to navigate. To top it off, it took me more than 5 minutes to figure out how to cancel my free trial subscription so that I wouldn’t be charged. Definitely not worth the $9.99 upgrade. Lots of room for improvement.

title: Best nutrition app!
body: I use this daily for every single meal and it’s great! On the last update - you took away the macros total bar at the bottom - PLEASE PLEASE BRING IT BACK! It was the primary view I used.

title: Great tool
body: I am very pleased with how easy this app is to use to capture my food intake. I love being able to compare with previous days, too.

title: Incorrect macros
body: I used the barcode scanner and most of the nutritional information was incorrect.  I attempted to change them but when I would change the info and hit update, the incorrect information from the scan would show up.  It could be a glitch.

title: MyMacros is awesome
body: My wife and I both use this app.  The ability to store recipes and adjust them each week and apply them to meals really helps!

title: Horrible app
body: This is the worst. It shouldn’t be hard. Literally nothing comes up on the search easily and it will limit measurements of things like almond milk to milliliters. It measures bread in grams instead of by the slice. When you search something simple like zucchini you have to scroll through a bunch of processed foods to get to regular zucchini. Same with a simple boiled egg. Awful. I’m deleting it.

title: Eh about like MyFitnessPal
body: I tried this app bc my coach who is an elite Xfit athlete uses it. The inventory of food options is fair to average. Also, when making a recipe, the 'x' that let's you clear your search doesn't work. Lots of bugs to workout when I paid for this app.

title: Was working well....
body: The app now replaces anything I've deleted back into the meal where I deleted it from. Clearly a tracking glitch is a major concern.

title: Best App
body: I have tried every type of app like this. I found this to be the best one for me. It works for me. Wish I would have come across it earlier.

title: Terrible
body: I keep looking for an improvement over MFP, but this was definitely not it!  I’d rather have no database than one like this where items are duplicated many times, making it hard to find things.  And I was frustrated by the non-intuitive way it always logs things by weight instead of servings.  How many people actually weigh a Wendy’s frosty?!

title: Cash grab
body: After paying $4 for this app, the first thing that happens when I open it up is the app hits me up for more money.  It wants a $10/month subscription to “unlock” all the features that I thought I had already paid for when I bought the app.  DEFINITELY save your money.  To spend $4 just for the privilege of paying $120/year is unacceptable.

title: Progress!
body: I have made tons of progress with my diet and my muscle and strength training thanks to this app. I can easily and accurately count out my macros to see what I need to eat or cut out. Hey thanks

title: Easy to use.  Great customer support.
body: I have used several different macro trackers and MM+ is by far my favorite.  I’ve been using it for years and am 100% happy.

title: Mostly awesome app
body: I would love a body fat % tracker built into the app and it would be nice to visit a friends daily meal and save individual food items rather than saving the whole meal.

title: Data volatility?
body: I loaded the app back in January but didn’t get started using it. I’ve been using it for about a week and except, for when the barcode scanner pulls up the right food, find it pretty cumbersome. I’ve also had issues with meals or whole days disappearing. A day later.

title: Updates are awful
body: As soon as you get used to the app they change it. EVERY FEW MONTHS. It is so annoying!

title: Don't purchase
body: This app does nothing significant for the price they ask. My fitness pal app freely offered by under armor is much more simplistic and easily understandable when tracking food. The app also does not even calculate how much calories you should be eating a week to maintain your body mass. This app it terrible for athletes, body builders or anyone who has a passion for nutrition and exercise.

title: Use it everyday!
body: Only thing I wish it had it was more food options. I find having to create custom favorites more than I'd hope to do. Other than that I like it.

title: Difficult to navigate
body: It seems to be more difficult to navigate and find simple foods. Nothing ever shows up on the search bar for “verified” foods. There is very little consistency with macros on the same exact foods. For $3.00 I find it much easier and better to use my free MyFitnessPal app from the start.

title: A Coaches Must Have
body: Easy access to your clients, great support team, access to your clients weigh ins, and a much cleaner database than My Fitness Pal all make this a must have for any serious coach in the industry.

title: Love this App
body: This app has taught me to look at food in a whole new way!! I have lost 20 lbs just by tracking and learning about food content!! Thank you!

title: Unnecessary to buy
body: The app alone doesn’t do anything any of the free macro trackers do, so for those that do not want to spend money to get the app and then 9.99 for a subscription for added use, I do not recommend. I would recommend Lose It for those that don’t want to spend money on a calorie counter but you have to do a subscription for macro tracking

title: Lost all info entered
body: It was working well until the latest upgrade to the app. Now everything I entered is gone.

title: Best macro app ever!
body: This app is a HUGE help. Very easy to use and helps me track my food intake accurately. Well worth the money. I just wish it would sync with my versa2 watch

title: Good app overall
body: Good app for tracking, but has some annoying glitches that delete entries or make it hard to edit sometimes.

title: New phone - data lost??
body: I love this app!  But I just got a new phone and all of a sudden all my data is lost - food, weight, etc. It’s disappointing :( but the app is great! Just assumed my account would save it.

title: Best I've found!
body: Stop the search this is what you want. Even been emailing with developer to implement a few suggestions

title: Fantastic and simple!
body: My macros is a fantastic app. It's simple and to the point. I prefer this one over MFF any day. It also aligns with avatar nutrition making everything a breeze!

title: Awesome App
body: Easy to use. Almost all of my food has been in their database using the barcode scanner. Works with Avatar Nutrition's web program.

title: Search function
body: So much of this works well but the search function is not workable compared to other apps. I have to google the item in question for nutritional numbers and manually input into Macros.

title: Not impressed
body: Not sure if it’s me but nothing matches labels that I scan. Constantly having to manually enter all my foods. Going back to My Fitness Pal app.

title: Better than myfitnesspal
body: Easy to see your numbers, meals, has an extensive database, and easy to use barcode scanner.

title: Easy
body: So easy to track and create custom recipes.  Now if it only had suggestions on how to fill out the remainder of your macros 🤞🏻

title: Food Search Needs To Be Work On
body: App seems okay, but when you push tab to search food there should be more items.. even broadening globally didn’t work.

title: Love it!!!
body: Best $3 i ever spent!! Actually a lot easier to use than MyFitnessPal.  And i like you can adjust macros without having to pay that premium from MyFitnessPal.

title: Used to love this app...
body: The changes that have been made to this app have gotten out of hand. Not only do the buttons not fit on the phone screen, but tracking anything has gotten absolutely painful. Edits to the food info don’t get saved which is unbelievably frustrating.

title: This app is it easy to keep up with macros and calories.
body: Very simple to use. Great database and I love it. Anyone interested in fitness and tracking their meals should get this app.

title: Amazing!!!
body: This is the best app I have ever gotten! I have lost 55 pounds as I have used this app. It kept track of the foods I was eating as well as my weight each day. Absolutely love it!

title: New to tracking
body: Really helpful in helping me understand and track nutrition better. Would be nice if the search library could somehow include restaurants. Otherwise very nice!

title: Best app hands down for tracking calories
body: Used this app all throw my 26 week contest preparation and couldn't have done it without it!

title: Ok, but confusing.
body: I use this app because it syncs with Avatar Nutrition. It's very confusing. Lots of time spent trying to navigate the app, googling nutrition info and entering food in manually.  They have tons of pre-entered food to select from, but I rarely find what I eat in those selections.  It gets the job done, but could be improved.

title: Convert
body: I wish there were a converter between measures. Sometimes when I scan something, it’s hard to convert it to gram from oz. They should consider this for their next update.

title: Can’t find what I’m looking for
body: The catalog of food is too limited for me and has made it frustrating to document my meals.

title: Not User-Friendly!
body: It should not be so difficult to enter a food item and edit quantity/portion. SO AGGRAVATING and TIME CONSUMING!

title: APPLE WATCH
body: Would love to see my remaining macros as a compilation on my Apple Watch so I could just quickly glance and go.

title: Lost weight in a smart and easy manner
body: I definitely recommend this app that enable you to change the unit for instance.

title: Digging It
body: It's the only app I've ever used for tracking macros and the only app I'll ever need. Offers everything I need to track all my meals.

title: Useful
body: It's usable once you get the hang of it. Its definitely better and easier than other apps available for tracking meals.

title: Intuitive app to use
body: This app does a great job of letting you add and customize your food. I would however LOVE IT if the developers also let you track Potassium micronutrient intake from food and not just simply Sodium. Please, please, please add this in the next update 🙏🏽.
response: Good news is that feature is in the works. We will allow you to track all micronutrients and vitamins in a near future update.

title: Waste of $$$$
body: Other than being able to customize macros this app is not worth paying for. 98% of the foods I scan with barcode aren’t recognized and I have to manually enter. And not real impressed with the search function either.

title: Not impressed
body: Just downloaded this to use something other than myfitness pal. Two days of logging and it’s a pain. Seems very “buggy.” Keep having to shut it down and reopen, edits to custom foods do not save, and I’m finding I’m having to add 80% of the foods I’ve eaten in just 2 days.

title: Food Search
body: The food search is limited and returns dozens of unrelated finds when the global is on. If global is off very few results. I am a MyFitnessPal user and the macro customization is why I tried it. Way too time consuming to try to get your foods into the tracker. I wasted my money. I do like the macro customization.

title: Seems OK but not what I needed
body: I didn’t appreciate you sending me at for y’all your spam nonsense  This is very tedious you have to enter in each individual thing I was looking for something that actually calculated percentages if you give a certain amount of calories so you can figure out what percentage of fat carbs and protein you need this app does not do that

title: Search is horrible
body: Bought this app today. I wish there was a return feature!  The ability to search for items

title: Great App and Great Customer Service
body: Simple yet very useful application, does exactly what it states it does. The team is very helpful when it comes to any assistance needed.

title: Terrible if you want to import your own recipes
body: You can’t adjust the type of measurement so my entire bag of almond flour is one serving for example. Lemon zest doesn’t even come up as an option. You search ingredients and then after you save them all you enter the amounts instead of being able to do it as you go.

title: Better than mfp
body: Easy to use, and so far through 2 months of dieting with it I have lost 30 pounds

title: So much easier!
body: I love this app. You can stay on target on your new way of eating bc it does all the math and tracking for you!

title: Search function not useful
body: The app is good for tracking macros, but the search function is almost non existent. It won't locate even the most simple foods. Had to manually input avocado. That's a little ridiculous.

title: For the money, NOT WORTH IT
body: MyFitnessPal is way better. Not even close. And myfitnesspal is free. This app is not. The food bank in this app is laughable at this point compared to MFP. You need to enter ALOT more foods manually, and a lot of the foods saved here are not correct. Not worth the money. Needs improved if it is going to cost money.

title: The best fitness app
body: I use my macros plus and my workout plus for all my fitness needs! Highly recommend this app!

title: Awesome app. Some suggestions.
body: It’s an awesome app. I totally love it, for tracking my keto

title: My macros is Awsome
body: This app is so easy to use. It does all the work for you! I don’t like diets and I don’t like counting calories, so this has been wonderful.

title: Excellent app
body: I just wish there was better UX around meal selection. I am constantly adding foods to the wrong meal. At the very least it could reset to breakfast in the morning.

title: If you cancel the trial they remove all of your entries
body: I paid $2.99 for the app. I understand not moving forward with their subscription, but how do you delete someone’s entries and saved items from an app they paid for. The app is connected to your account and you share with your coach. This is a low move.

title: Disappointing
body: No free version to try.

title: Greatness
body: Phenomenal diet tracking app. Completely superior to most. Now with the expanded database it only gets better and better

title: Love it!
body: Could use some type of reminder for tracking? Otherwise, it's great!

title: I prefer it over MFP
body: I like the fact that I can link this to my Avatar Nutrition profile, so my macros on MM+ are automatically adjusted to reflect changes made on AN.

title: Best value for a weight tracking app
body: Easily better than anything else I've tried in the App Store.

title: Great app use it daily
body: It does have a bit of a learning curve but once you figure it out it's a simple app to navigate.

title: Great app
body: Only thing I don't like is how the food bank is not as full as my fitness pal. Everything else about it is great.

title: Disappointed and feel tricked
body: Use mfp, works perfect for what I want, except tracking the macro part. I purchased this to track macros, seems like I have to pay extra for that, which if I would have known, I would have passed on this app. Should be upfront in the beginning. Unless I missed something completely...dissatisfied.

title: Great Tool for Competitive Lifters!
body: I have loved this app for awhile and it just keeps getting better!!!  Critical that I can see all my nutrients and track by grams versus ounce!!

title: Seems like they broke it intentionally.
body: The app used to be great. Now it’s database is never able to find common things. When trying to filter search results, there is no option to close the filter page. So you have to close out of the app and restart it to leave that screen.

title: Unusable on iPhone SE
body: Several parts of the interface run off the screen on iPhone SE, making some buttons unreachable and some functions in possible. For example, if I try to filter the food list by brand, there’s no way to apply the filter or exit out of the screen. The buttons, I assume, are off the screen.

title: User friendly, so many foods
body: Great for counting macros! Nothing like seeing yourself hit that magic number! 👍🏻👍🏻 highly recommend

title: Makes tracking so easy
body: I tried out a couple different macro teaching apps before deciding on MM+. The database is pretty great and the barcode scanner is awesome.

title: Best macro tracking app
body: Love that it integrates with Avatar. The food database is not as good as myfitnesspal, but the fast track feature and the Avatar integration more than make up for the food database.

title: Highly recommend!
body: This is my favorite tracking app by far!

title: Solid App!
body: I definitely like this App, it shows promise and is easy to use.  The developer listens to feedback and that! says a lot!  5 stars!!

title: Frustrating
body: If you’re used to My Fitness Pal but looking to get more detailed , maybe this could be it? But the learning curve is seriously frustrating. Changing from grams to ounces, cup to ounces-ugh...searching is tedious....it takes longer to log my food than to eat it.

title: Don’t pay for it
body: NOT WORTH $2.99! I’m talking if you want the absolute basic of all calorie trackers, by all means please download. However, there are no features at all.

title: Absolutely the best investment for my health
body: This app has been a game changer. It’s easy to use and has relevant updates when necessary

title: Amateur App
body: It’s much more difficult to change the unit of measurement than on MFP. If I scan the barcode, I can’t change the serving measurement very easy. I have to change the serving size and the serving unit of measure and then still put in how many “grams” of this frozen dinner I ate. HOW ABOUT I ATE ONE SERVING? Going back to my fitness pal

title: Hated it
body: Way too complicated to use. It forces you into incorrect food options because there is no flexibility to simply input things that are not on the list. The macro info is quite inaccurate for the items I was able to find. Just a very frustrating app that added more stress to the process.

title: Good app needs small improvements
body: I wish I could change the measurement sizes for more items and not be bound to the one I'm given, otherwise good app.

title: Good tool
body: Good tool to track macros, but wish modifying amounts, meals was easier. Not all foods are entered correctly, so pay attention. This app is making tracking so much easier!

title: Some suggestions
body: The core functionality is great. But I’d really like to see some additional nutrition fields or the ability to add custom fields. For example I’d like to keep tabs on my daily caffeine intake.

title: Crashing
body: Just bought this app, it will not open and continues to crash. I have restarted my phone as well and it still crashes. Waste of money!!
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Can’t set macros without paying $9.99 a month
body: After paying $2.99, I found this app not useful at all. Great idea, but I can’t enter my macros and info without paying $9.99 a month. Definitely asking for a refund back since there’s other apps that allow you to enter your macros and keep track of them.

title: Love it
body: I've been using this app everyday for about 4 years now.  It's perfect for me and keeps me in check for my goals. LOVE the new UPDATE !!

title: This app is ridiculous
body: Hard to find the right food. Hard to figure out how to use it. Hard to edit things. Super disappointed. If my mom or sister tried to use this app they would fail. I don’t like using it because it is so hard.

title: It’s OK
body: Friendly interface, and I love that you can choose Fast Track for when you just want to input known values, but I have found other similar apps have more preloaded foods readily available.

title: Edit Days
body: Although there’s not the database MFP has, I love that I can track macros better. You just need to fix it so we can edit the day we ate something. Just entered about five things and somehow I was on Yesterday. 😩

title: It’s been 100% worth it
body: Clunky to learn but once you have it not too heard.  I’m trying to do Keto, love having my cumulative numbers to adjust my last intake for the day.

title: Needs a better database
body: I like the app overall and enjoy features such as different day profiles and being able to add and name meals but oh my gawd is the database AWFUL. Has a long way to go to catch up to its competitors.

title: Helpful and easy
body: I love this app, it has made tracking my macros so much easier, and less stressful.

title: Really great tracker!
body: I love using this app--makes tracking macros easy and I really like the fact that you can set goals.

title: Very helpful!
body: At first it seems like a lot of work, however, once you get your foods in its very easy.

title: Great
body: Perfect interface to track macros, they should do easier to change the units of portions

title: Very UNIMPRESSED
body: Paying $3 for an app with a barcode scanner is great and all, if the scanner actually worked! I have to change EVERY one of the numbers EVERY time I scan something. What a joke. And you charge $10 a month just so I can plug in my information to see if I’m going over in macros or not. Really wish I hadn’t purchased the app now.

title: Tracking helps
body: I was introduced to this app in 2018 and it has been helpful with me keeping my diary of my health journey

title: Useful tool with simple UI. Food database lacking.
body: I enjoy the app but find that the search option for foods is vastly limited. Major fast food data is very minimal.

title: Great App!!
body: Love this app!  Top notch tracking and excellent support.  Purchased the Macro Coach feature to get some help with achieving my goals.  Just go ahead and get it!  It’s Bomb!

title: Inaccurate
body: I regret switching over from MFP. Wildly inaccurate! You can’t even search for something basic like grilled chicken without it displaying all fast food. Scanning a product has displayed all inaccurate info too. Can’t convert ounces to grams easily without it being wrong. This app is awful and MFP is way better

title: Great app
body: I enjoy being able to keep track of my macros easily. The app really makes it simple.

title: Calculate should be changed
body: I just started using this app. It's annoying that I can put in strawberries and change it to grams. Instead it only keeps it at cups. I should have the option to change it to be more accurate

title: Very helpful app
body: Love this app for tracking carbs and fat. It really helps you see what you're taking in. I love the barcode scanner. Great app thanks!

title: Great macro tracker
body: I've been using my fitness pal for a while and when then I switched to Mymacros. Best decision ever.  Easy to use. Worth the three dollars.

title: I never write reviews
body: I love MM. it's simply the best and they truly care what their customers want. It's the easiest app to track!

title: Remaining macros
body: Well I used to love the app but for some reason they removed the ability to see my remaining macros that used to be at the bottom of the screen when in meals view.  Hoping this is a bug that they fix and not an intentional update.

title: Best Macro Track App Available
body: I have tried several different apps and none of them beat My Macros+.

title: The best!!!
body: I’ve loved this app since day one and I’ve been with it since the very beginning of it. Nothing better. 👊🏾

title: Not enough food in search
body: The search feature for types of food is not helpful. There are weird brands and not a good selection. For example I couldn’t find basic steamed broccoli or a sugar cookie.

title: Easy & helpful
body: Love using this app to track my macros. Makes it really easy to log meals and easily add frequently eaten meals.

title: Great macro tracker
body: I've used this app for 6 months now. I've lost 15 pounds just tracking my macros everyday. 5/5 from me

title: Great app
body: Great for tracking meals. Once you get used to it and save meals and have custom entries all lined up...it's super fast and easy to use.

title: Great app
body: I've had no problems with this app so far. Just wish there was a wider selection of foods in the database

title: Has mad potential
body: It’s good I always use it but they need to step up the barcode scans and their database as a whole other than that it’s great

title: Latest Update Crashes, Won’t Let You Open the App!
body: This app is usually very good, but the developers really need to get around to patching with another update ASAP. The newest version always kicks me back out to the home screen the moment I tap on the app. I can’t even view my macros! This is frustrating!
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Database is Awful!
body: Having paid for this app you would think you could easily find items. Wrong! Most things I have to manually enter. What a tremendous waste of time. My Fitness Pal is free and I had much better results there. Update this. Wish I could get my money back. Don’t waste your time with ghis

title: Decent
body: Not the best selection of food. It makes it a little harder to track when you eat out or are not in a position to make your own food.

title: Very frustrating.
body: Very frustrating. Not intuitive at all.

title: Great app but new issue after last update
body: Cant change meal time with left swipe unless there is more thsn one item in the meal.

title: Such a great app
body: Love the app and all the features it has. Combine it would coaching and your body will thank you.

title: Best Macro Based App
body: Very simple to use and it can help you track your macro intake very precisely to help you get your diet dialed in the help meet your goals.

title: Love this app
body: Super user friendly. I use it everyday and I love how easy it is. Great app, definitely suggest it to others looking to focus on Macro intake!

title: Simple to Use
body: Nothing super fancy, just a straight forward nutrition tracker. My boyfriend and I share our recipes, very handy.

title: Great way to watch your macros
body: They make it so easy to use and the list of foods is incredible

title: Perfect App To Track Macros
body: MyFitnessPal is a joke compared to this app. Been using this for a few years now and makes it easy to follow a IIFYM diet approach.

title: Not for beginners
body: This app is terrible if you are new to food tracking. Nothing about it is user friendly. They forced me to put in my last 5 days of macros counts in order to start my profile. Well if you are brand new then you won’t have those counts! The food library is a joke.

title: Only Food Tracking App You Need
body: Amazing app with much better customization. Worth every penny!

title: Worth it!
body: App really has improved my consistency with staying on track with my macros!

title: Waste of money
body: Annoyed that I spent $3 on this. The barcode scanner and label scanners don’t work on anything. Also there are very few foods already logged on app. Most things I eat have to be manually logged because they don’t have it as an option when searching.

title: Disappointed
body: Most of the brands I eat are not available in the app. Difficult to navigate. Only thing I really like is the way the macros section is set up, but there is no way to add foods if you know the macros, only by ingredient. Generally disappointed.

title: Love it!
body: I have been using this app a few months now and love it. I love that I can add my own food items.

title: Great app
body: This app is super easy to use! I love how you can set your goal each day and it helps you keep count!

title: Don’t waste your time or money
body: Although My Fitness Pal has shortcomings, at least it’s functional. This app doesn’t search/find common recipe components. Very frustrating to use compared to other trackers.

title: Great app
body: Really easy to use and a great database. The only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is because the new nutrition label reader doesn’t seem to work.

title: Love the new update
body: I’ve always enjoyed this app, but the update makes it even better. Good job, guys! (:

title: CF
body: The app is extremely difficult to navigate. It does not allow corrections without having to delete content. Nice idea but have some bugs that desperately needs attention if the developer hopes to move beyond the free version

title: Great app
body: It doesn’t have any many foods as my fitness pal, but it also doesn’t have all of the stupid adds that my fitness pal has.

title: Zero stars if I could
body: I gladly paid 2.99 for the app. Then I go in the app and there is another fee. That is not normal. Usually it’s free to download. Then you get a trial. Then you pay. Okay well anyway, I clicked free trial. I entered a very popular cottage cheese - not on their list. Then I looked up a very

title: Not user Friendly
body: Ive been using MyFitnessPal for several years but saw this app as a great way to count macros for less money. You get what you pay for, and I will be going back. The last straw was the barcode scanner function has yet to find a single item scanned. I’d go elsewhere.

title: Brand searching is impossible
body: This app isn’t user friendly and found myself spending 15 minutes just to log my breakfast and lunch. Also, it apparently isn’t aware of many brands out there when using the barcode scanner. I wanted to like the app but it’s a no go.

title: So easy to use.
body: Easy format to track macros! Won't use anything else!

title: Excellent product
body: I use this app every day, it's been extremely helpful

title: Love it!
body: I use it several times a day. Helps me stay on track with my Avatar Nutrition numbers and my water intake.

title: Helpful app
body: This is a great app for tracking food. Easy to use and works with My Workouts

title: Save your money!!!
body: MFP does everything this app tries, plus much much more. On top of that it "loses" a lot of the food I input and whenever I have attempted to get technical help they just use canned responses and eventually just stop replying. Pencil and paper are a better option for tracking macros than this app is.

title: Search function is too cluttered
body: It's easy to use, but searching for simple foods (e.g., "peach") is next to impossible. Branded foods show up first and you can only filter by brand or serving size, which doesn't help when you're looking for something generic. Won't be using and wish I hadn't paid for it.

title: Love!!
body: It is easy to use and keeps me on track. Just started using and already lost 1 1/2 lbs

title: Trash
body: This app is garbage now, they ended their partnership with Avatar Nutrition and now I’m left holding the bag. You can longer input custom calorie goals to hit for the day without paying 10 dollars a month for their “coaching”. I’d like my money back, but that won’t happen. DO NOT PURCHASE

title: Great app
body: I’ve been using this app for almost a year to track my macros. It’s easy to use.

title: RIP OFF! DO NOT BUY!
body: I paid $2.99 for the app thinking that was it. When I opened it up, it would not let me go any farther than putting in my information without agreeing to pay $9.99 a month. I’m so sorry I wasted my $2.99. Don’t buy this unless you’re ready to commit to another $9.99 a month. Use a different app!!!!

title: Great app
body: Great app is all that needs to be said. There's no way my wife and I could get through contest prep without it!

title: Love it!
body: Best tracking app out there! Recommend it to all my nutrition clients. Won't use anything else!

title: Wildly disappointed
body: I bought this app because I wanted to sync it with Avatar Nutrition.  I went out of my way to like it (scanning foods and manually entering information) and it just doesn't come anywhere close to MyFitnessPal.  I went ahead and bought MFP's premium subscription and its head and shoulders above MM+ in terms of usability.

title: Best food tracking app hands down
body: Blows My Fitness Pal out of the water. Smooth and streamlined

title: I like it.
body: It works the way it's supposed to without all the extra crap.

title: Love the app for a newbie
body: I am new to macro counting and so this app was recommended to me. At first, like any new app, it was confusing but once I tried adding food to practice , it got easier.

title: Not intuitive
body: The app is not intuitive, it is too difficult to adjust portion sizes and change measurements. Hard to find simple food items (add stevia to your database.)

title: App is currently crashing
body: Been using the app for quite some time. It's now crashing when I try to open. Will this be fixed soon?
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Lacks in every way
body: Barcode scanner is useless. Rarely finds foods in the database, so I have to manually add everything.

title: Can never find foods and macros are inaccurate
body: Paid for the app and I’m sorry I did. It’s rare to find actual products in the database and inputting everything is tedious. I am very disappointed and have requested a refund- which I probably will never see. There are better apps out there!

title: Unless you like surfing the web for information to put into the app don't get it
body: It's ridiculous that even just for a banana or an avocado or even just a glass of milk I have to surf the web for information on that food then put it into the app to get information waste of money.

title: Scanner issue
body: Would’ve given it 5 stars, butmacros aren’t   always exact when scanned.

title: Hate it
body: Confusing to navigate. Barcode doesn’t always work or inputs incorrect information. Difficult to enter serving sizes that aren’t whole amounts.  I have used apps like this for years and this is by far the worst one I’ve come across....AND actually paid for. So disappointing…

title: Limited features unless you pay
body: I wish I wouldn’t have bought this app. If you’re willing to pay for their monthly subscription, there are some great features. Otherwise, there are other free (and better) apps out there. Very disappointed

title: Best macro app
body: Ive been using this app for ...5-7years now, best app. They’re always looking to improve your tracking and make it wasy

title: Very helpful
body: I’ve used this app for several years and it works great

title: Not worth the money
body: I wish I hadn’t paid anything to download this app. The first three items I tried to log all required me to manually add the nutritional info. There’s an option to use the “global” database, but you have to pay a monthly fee?! I already paid for the worthless app!

title: Can’t find food
body: When i search for generic food, it does not show up on the list.  For example, i can’t find cherry tomatoes when i search for it.

title: Needs improvement
body: I’m mad at myself for not trusting the reviews. It’s impossible to track stuff. There’s no way to convert Ml or Ounces and when you barcode scanning something it’s completely different. I have to change the entire nutrition label. It’s ridiculous. Back to my fitness pal.

title: Great but
body: I love the app but stop updating the layout every couple of weeks! I am all for updates but changing the layout regularly is frustrating

title: Like it
body: I like it, but I don't love it. If I barcode scan stuff, half the info isn't there. So I have to edit it. Dang you people. Also type in peach and you get a wide array of stuff. Rice is even worse.

title: Not worth it.
body: The database is limited and the app itself is not intuitive or user friendly. I have to enter so many things individually! I wish there were a tab to log workouts, which could then recalculate the users macros and food allowance for the rest of the day.

title: Love it
body: Easy to use and great that you can communicate with other people.

title: Water Goal
body: Nice app. Would be nice to have a daily water consumption goal ability too.

title: Barcode scanner
body: 0 stars !!! If you edit the amount from 1 serving to 4 servings it divides it instead of multiples it.  And you can’t go back once it divides it.  I’m doing trig problems to get the info right every time .  What a waste .  I’ll use the free app and input my own info.  So it’s actually correct
response: Hi NastyNate, Sorry for the confusion.

title: Must have!!!
body: I absolutely love this app and it is fundamental for my fitness journey!! I’d avise anyone who wants to own their healthy and fitness to download it!

title: Not great.
body: I liked that you could be specific with macro grams, and the overall app layout. What I did find thought was that it’s really frustrating to find what food you want to log, unless you’re taking direct pictures of the labels. Not easy in that sense at all.

title: Helped me reach my goals
body: Love this app. It’s so easy to use and has helped me track my macros to reach my goals.

title: Barcode scanner frequently doesn’t work
body: The app’s good at what it does, but the barcode scanner frequently doesn’t scan anything. Regardless of the focus or light, it just doesn’t register that there’s a barcode.

title: New updated version 🙁
body: Don’t like whatever update that was pushed out recently.

title: Very useful
body: I had used myPlate for a while but always wanted to know at a glance how many macros I had left to eat for the day. MyMacros does the job well!

title: Super awesome happy time
body: Best app I've ever downloaded - makes it very easy to track macros and gets macro goals pushed from Avatar.

title: Doing Keto... love it!
body: I love how easy it is to add food, scan barcodes and really love how it tracks exactly what I need and tells me what I have remaining.

title: The BEST Macro Tracker Ever
body: This app is amazing!!  Took a couple of days to get used to but now I absolutely love it and can’t imagine not using it!

title: Don’t like the recent updates
body: The update that made the calorie bar just say 0 remaining when you’re actually over is AWFUL

title: Nice design but this app is INACCURATE
body: Nothing I logged had accurate nutrition information. It was so annoying to go in and have to manually add or correct everything. I love the design and thought of the app but it’s not worth spending any money on.

title: Annoying
body: It doesn’t have the food info of a lot of items and I have to add everything manually. I paid for this app since I assumed I would get that but adding all my food info is not worth the haste. I had to delete it the same day I bought it. Enjoy my $3

title: Awesome price !
body: I’ve tried My Fitness Pal and My Macros+. I love MM+ better because you can copy an entire day of food (not just one food at a time like in MFP) AND MM+ is only $2.99 ONCE vs. MFP which is $50 A YEAR!

title: Not for me
body: This app does not give me any options for foods when logging. It is not as user-friendly as many other apps available. There are some great features however, the features that are most beneficial to me and my goals are lacking.

title: Not worth 2.99
body: I have to pay another 2.99 to track workouts. Not thrilled at that. Why not just add a sync option for smart watches or exercise tracking.

title: I love this app
body: This app is definitely worth buying. Breaks down sodium, cholesterol and every fat. Better than Fitbit.

title: Great app!
body: I enjoy using the app the biggest downfall keeping it short of 5 stars is their database. If they can expand it then it'll become a 5 star app.

title: Frustrated
body: I bought this app.  Right out of the gate something simple like "scrambled eggs" doesn't exist.  I'm thinking that this app is better for people who eat only packaged goods which I do not.  The database seems lacking. Pass this one buy.  I only bought it bc of avatar and wish I'd read reviews first.

title: I liked it but!
body: I tried to like this app but found it much to complicated for my needs. I was looking for something to simply track my daily consumption.

title: Junk
body: I wasted $3 on this. Tried several times to just register a new account and every single time it froze and shut down. Also I hate the fact that it doesn’t let you log your workout? You need to download a separate app for that. Lame.

title: Great!
body: Easy so far I would love to be able to see how many grams of fat, sat fat, etc instead of just showing a percent.

title: Needs improvement
body: This app is set up well but it does not have a wide selection of foods and if it does have what your looking for, it does not allow you to change the units in how your measuring it.

title: Easy to use
body: Fabulous application. The recipe creator is the best part since I cook most of my own food.

title: Good app but the accuracy in food is off
body: Half the stuff I scan I have to constantly verify it or change it.  Love the app, love the features and the look.  Just do not have time to verify accuracy on scanned items.

title: Hard to search
body: App is great tracking if you find things, but it’s hard to find ..I was typing in baked potato and got no results ...I may be doing it wrong ..app should be able to be linked with fit bit like the app my fitness pal....water tracking is good though

title: Lacking
body: Lacking many food options even in global search.  After a 15+ minute tutorial and using all the features this app is still not user friendly and not worth paying for. Myfitnesspal is a much better app.

title: Great app
body: Helps me keep my macros in check for a small fee each month. Well with it!

title: Helps build good habits
body: Suits my needs better ban other apps for tracking macros.

title: I want my money back
body: This is the worst app I’ve ever used. Every time I open it, it asks me to sync across devices. You can’t set goals or see how close you are to meeting your macros unless you pay a monthly fee. You can’t even add multiple servings of a food unless you pay extra. SCAM! I WANT MY MONEY BACK!

title: Love it!
body: The only thing it’s missing is the ability to sync to Apple health!

title: Great app!
body: Great app! Love how it shows total macros as well as macros per meal. The app also tracks water intake and weight. I wish you could attach progress photos with the entered weights. But other than that it’s a great app!!

title: My Macros
body: I’m trying to use this app but it’s difficult to understand for the average person.

title: Could use some adjustments
body: On the search function- maybe I’m not using it right, but if I search for ‘Blueberries’ the top 15 options are for waffles or protein shakes.

title: My macro
body: This app doesn’t work at all for me. In many cases the fat content is not broken down into sat fat, poly or mono. It just gives total fat. Also all weight measurements are in grams and if you want to use ounces you have to change each item individually. A waste of money for me.

title: Overly complicated interface
body: While the functionality is good, I found the interface to be needlessly complex and not intuitive.  There are better options (and some of these are "free").

title: Best Macro Tracker...
body: Ever! I tried FitnessPal and can honestly say I much prefer MyMacros. The interface is so easy and helps me keep me on track.

title: Love it
body: Easy platform for tracking

title: Love This App
body: Excellent app to track macros and calories in food. Using it for over a year now...

title: Way better than My Fitness Pal!
body: No comparison in my book. Love the app. Totally geared towards iifym and you can tell 👍🏼

title: Not worth paying for
body: This app is definitely not worth paying for.  You have to put everything in manually even nothing that comes up is ever correct.

title: Outstanding tracker
body: I had a tough time finding a macro tracker to replace my pen and notebook, this is exactly what I needed.  Worth the buy.

title: Really great app!
body: Seriously a great app. I like it much better than MFP. I’ve been using it for a over a year and the customer service is great!

title: Best tracking app ever!
body: This thing seriously rocks. My life is 1000x easier when MM+ does all the math for me

title: Meh
body: I was excited with this app. Visually, it’s almost perfect. However, looking up food isn’t optimal. The measurements are strange, sometimes they’re measured in cups, grams, or ounces. But you can only convert from grams to ounces or vice versa. Overall it just doesn’t quite cut the mustard for me.

title: Updates are SUCKING
body: They change this app so much with updates that make it harder to navigate. This newest update got rid of how many calories you’ve gone over and doesn’t show your daily macro goals next to what you’ve consumed. I’m switching back to MyFitness Pal.

title: Bad customer service
body: Used this app for a long time and mostly liked it. However, my recent customer service experience trying to cancel my subscription has left a sour taste in my mouth and I will not be using the app again.

title: Started crashing today
body: Won’t open all of a sudden, have deleted and reinstalled, restarted phone and haven’t been able to fix.  Just started happening today after months of tracking!!!
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Very Unfriendly
body: Very difficult to figure out how to use it; very unfriendly. I simply want an App to log what nutrition I generated from the food I ate, simple like that. The food are all over the place, too many info makes it a mass. I tried 20 mins, wasted $2.99, bye-bye. Won’t use it again.

title: 5 Stars for Body Builders
body: This app is awesome, I am 100% happy. I will always use this app to track my calories and macros.

title: Useless
body: I can’t even push the track now button. If you scan anything it lumps it into lunch. Back to my fitness pal. I’ve pushed all the buttons to get it to work. It doesn’t. Ive tried multiple days. I wonder if I can get my $3 back. I feel ripped off.

title: Misleading
body: Not as functional as they’ve made it seem and not enough food in their database to track. Also the calories displayed for certain foods were completely inaccurate.

title: Not what you expect
body: This is not a user friendly app.  I would not buy it period and actually want my money back period.  The items I did want to use required me to purchase another app.  Again, even if it was $2.99 it was bad enough I want my mo eye back!!

title: Thank You
body: This app.... needed it, glad I found it, soooo worth the investment!!! Great product/ service!!!

title: Disappointing
body: Everything I have looked at is another subscription. Big disappointment

title: Not the best
body: Foods are hard to search for. For example ground beef pulled up everything but actual ground beef. Also there are no restaurants listed if you try to search by restaurant name. Very disappointing for a paid for app.

title: Absolutely love it!
body: I have nothing but great things to say about this app! Very easy to use.

title: Awesome
body: Helps me keep everything on track.

title: Great app
body: Well designed. Easy to set your macros. Better than the competitor.

title: Helps me keep track!
body: A but clunky here and there, but does what I need it to do!

title: Perfect for IIFYM
body: Been using MFP for two years. This app is so customizable!! Portions are perfect for IIFYM, so little math for the user. Highly recommend!

title: Sweet
body: Wish it had quick add those or grouped things with what you always eat together

title: Didn’t like it
body: Asks if I want to sync to all devices every time I open the app. Also isn’t user friendly. Starts to get annoying. Just because it’s called macro tracker, doesn’t mean it’s better. Opt for my fitness pal.

title: Five stars!
body: I’ve been using mymacros+ for over a year now. It’s by far my favorite app!

title: Not as many food options
body: There aren’t as many food options as MyFitnessPal or carb manager so I’m manually putting in food which is kinda annoying. I barely use this anymore.

title: App won’t open
body: Just bought the app, tried everything from reinstalling to updating app. App would crash everything it opens. Tried two different devices and still would not open.

title: Best app for Powerlifters!
body: I absolutely love this app! It's simple and does everything I need it to without a monthly fee!

title: The very best way to track macros and food journal!
body: Nuff said. Use it daily, don't know how I lived without it. :D

title: Faulty
body: When changing serving size from a custom food, the macro counts are completely off. This makes the app inefficient to use. UPDATE: very much appreciate the developer response.
response: Hi Danno, When editing a custom food if you delete the calorie amount it will automatically calculate it for you based off of the protein, carb & fat amounts

title: Limited
body: Not impressed and wish I could get my money back. Very limited database when you scan with barcode none of my items are showing up. Then I have to manually enter and it's taking to long for such a simple task.

title: Good app
body: It’s a good app I just wish it had a bigger data base and some of the things I scan don’t come out right

title: Great app!!!
body: I’m using it to track my food, macros, and weight.  I love how easy it is to use.

title: Works well
body: Great for tracking your macros and worth the price.

title: Prefer MyFitness Pal
body: I don’t find this app very user friendly at all. I’m trying to cancel my subscription following their directive both online and through app. Keep getting redirected. Please update your directions for cancelling with your current app. I’d rather use MyFitness Pal for free.

title: Disappointed
body: Sorry I bought this. Very un user friendly.  Berries  should not be in grams. Should be in cups and there’s no way to change it so I end up trying to convert it. Plus I have to custom add a lot of basic foods.  It’s quicker to look at the labels and do the calculations myself. Sheesh.

title: Ugh
body: What a frustrating app! Can’t change any of the measurements, nothing is accurate, and the database is terrible! Scanner doesn’t work properly and neither does taking a picture of the label. It still gets it wrong! Waste of money.

title: Awesome
body: Totally simplifies macro tracking. Wish I had this months ago.

title: Love it
body: Super easy to use. Tracks your macros with ease. And the food list is endless!

title: I'm very happy
body: I'm very happy with the tracking and food scanning. It would be nice if it would save the serving size

title: Awesome app!!!
body: Love how organized everything is and it charts your progress. Just wish it had more food imputed into it.

title: Awesome
body: Good stuff. Worth the price. I like that it shows the macros of each food. Searching is pretty terrible though.

user_name: Just here so i dont get fined
title: Adding food broken on XS Max
body: I used to love this app but since getting the Xs Max I’m unable to add food to my tracker because the edit buttons are displayed in the notch. Every time you try to click on them it’s either unresponsive or brings up the apple control panel.

title: Luv it
body: Except finding foods is kinda complicated. Not as user friendly as MyFitnessPal as far as finding food in the database

title: Won’t close account!
body: I have written twice requesting to have my account shut down.  Cannot get response to my request instead just continue to send additional emails.  Will file complaint with attorney general

title: Fine, if you don’t mind starting over
body: When you get a new phone, you’ll lose years of recipes and custom entries. All that math for nothing. I guess they can’t be bothered with servers. Bummer.
response: Hi, sorry for the confusion but if you go to the "Sync Content" settings page and hit "Download All" all the way at the bottom it brings all your data right back so you can pick up right where you left off.

user_name: Can I get my money back??
title: Don’t Waste Your Money
body: Bought this thinking it would make good tracking easier and help me to be healthier. You have to buy the app, and then pay monthly as well to access all of the features. Going back to MyFitnessPal.

title: My macros
body: Was introduced to this app by my trainer. I love it. Really helps keep me in check about my meals.

title: Awesome
body: I have been using this mymacros+ for over 2 years straight.. Absolutely love it.  A necessity, truly.

title: Very helpful!
body: Really helps me keep track of calories!

title: Great
body: Helps keep me on track. Syncs with Avatar Nutrition profile which is a plus.

title: Awesome!!
body: Very user friendly. I wish they'd get into more restaurants and grab some more info for premade foods. By overall really great!

title: Difficult to add food
body: If you are completely paleo this would be a good to but very difficult to find specific brands of foods. Used for about two weeks and went back to MyFitnessPal.

title: Great tracker
body: Love that I can add my own recipes! Plus so many foods already in there!

title: Great app for tracking
body: This is hands down the best macro tracking app with such a great group supporting it.

title: Good
body: Best app ever to track food and nutrient intake. Very easy to find foods in their system and to add them

title: Great app
body: Nice streamlined interface, easy to use.

title: Not worth it the money there’s better free apps
body: So in order to use the macros tracker you have to pay 9 bucks a month. The app also Has a very small library of foods and most of them are brand named frozen foods

title: Horrible
body: This app is horrible unlike my fitness app your only allowed to add one thing for your meal. Way to confusing. At this tome I don’t have half a day to figure out how to use this app. I’m more upset I wasted 2.99 on a app then you want 7.99 per month.

title: Great Macro Tracking App.
body: This app is perfect for tracking macros, especially when I’m cutting.

title: No food in database
body: I love this app in theory but gave up and went back to MFP after 2 weeks when I didn’t see green peppers in the food database to track. It was too cumbersome to check google then input into the app. Definitely disappointed!

title: Best tracking app out there
body: Best tracking app out there

title: Not good!!
body: This app is not worth paying for! The only nice part is being able to set your macros at exactly what you want. The foods available in the search are very limited and the barcode scanner did not work very well.

title: wouldn’t recommend buying
body: not very user friendly and the design isn’t my style, i prefer myfitnesspal. there’s a lot of food missing from the log, and i find it harder to find certain foods. other than that, it makes checking your macros pretty clear-cut.  if it were easier to track foods i would really like this app.

title: Worth it if...
body: It’s worth it if the yearly subscription can be made through Apple Pay, not your website. Please make it so.

title: Loved the old version
body: I don’t like the new version and miss the old version. All my data and favorites are also gone

title: Food options
body: I find it harder to find food and putting it in is not as easy as some apps, I’m gonna try again to use it but sad that I purchased it

title: Luv it
body: Much better then my fitness pal. Soooo much easier!

title: Great app
body: Well worth the couple bucks. Helps keep me in the right zones in terms of macro dieting.

title: Favorite app
body: Easy and very helpful app. Waaay better than MyFitnessPal. Definitely worth it!

title: NO Complaints!
body: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this app and I love it a lot!!

title: App won’t even open
body: Literally just bought this 5 minutes ago. App won’t even open. Restarted phone, deleted app and re-downloaded. Still will not open. Was looking for an alternative to Under Armour’s MyFitnessPal app. Please help...
response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: From clean to a hot mess
body: I’ve been using this app for years and loved it. In the last update, the clean display at the bottom was replaced by a hard to read mess. The app has devolved considerably. What a shame. I’d pass on this until it gets cleaned up.

title: Great app
body: This is an easy to use app for keeping track of macros!

title: Too difficult to use
body: This app is not intuitive and in order to get all benefits they want more money. Charged me more than I agreed to, can’t get through to customer service  and I do not recommend this app.

title: Search function
body: Search function in the custom and favs has mysteriously disappeared.

title: Latest UPGRADE terrible
body: Still really decent but I payed for this app and since it’s upgrade it’s on a lower version. I guess still alright but not really I would recommend go elsewhere!

title: Great App
body: Easy functionality, good food selection.

title: Potential

title: Please let us change total daily carbs to net carbs!
body: Following a Keto way of eating (I refuse to call it a diet due to the stigma around the word... If you eat food ever then you're "on a diet" is how I see it) limits the amount of carb intake, but it's net carbs not just total carbs (being into fitness, I'm sure you're aware of this). Right now it's a bit difficult to track the total net carbs on the app. Yes, you can change carbs to net carbs shown for each individual meal, but it doesn't count the net carbs in the daily totals. When looking at the daily total, summary and macro breakdown it looks like I'm over most days on my carbs and didn't hit my goal when this is isn't the case. PLEASE let us change the total carbs to total net carbs! This is the most important change I'd love to see. I also agree with some of the other reviews... The app is pretty nice, but I'd love it more if it were a bit more user friendly. The serving sizes/options are sometimes off, the barcode scanning can be hit or miss (once I got a completely different item than what I scanned), and there's SOOO many options when searching an item.. In some ways this can be nice, but mostly it's just confusing because they all differ slightly on the counts and you aren't sure which to choose, especially when you don't have a nutrition label to go off of. I think this is a pretty nice app, it's clean looking and has a lot of great features. But please consider adding an option to change daily total to net carbs! Thank you!
response: Hi Saint317, Thanks a lot for the feedback.

body: First and foremost, I absolutely WANT to like this app. I’ve been a long time user of MyFitnessPal (which does most of what I want very well) but I absolutely refuse to pay them $50/year just to adjust my macros at fiber increments than 5% at a time. title: Dumb app

title: Cumbersome
body: This app is cumbersome

title: Lots of packaged/brand name foods, few whole foods, by amount is inconsistent
body: I was pretty excited about this app, so I started logging my meals right away. I'm sad to report that I won't be continuing with it. My main complaint: I eat a lot of whole foods and cook my own meals. The food database for mm+ seems to contain a lot of packaged/brand name foods and restaurant meals, but not as many basic/simple components like "chicken, thigh meat," or "sashimi grade tuna." Yes, you can enter your own items into the database... but I was surprised to find these lacking in the first place. I have quite a bit of experience with other food logging applications, so I have a good sense of what these nutritional databases typically contain. I live abroad and I don't eat a lot of packaged food, so the food library as it stands today doesn't really work for me. Also, sometimes I find items that are only listed as 1 serving, when what I really want is the ability to enter an amount (like 3 ounces or 50 grams). I find the input experience a bit laboroius and clunky (too many unnecessary clicks and swipes to enter foods), and I could never figure out how to save common recipes (e.g. my breakfast smoothie) that I'd use over and over again. In short, I wasn't a fan. I've used better applications that I didn't have to pay for... though I will say that those other apps don't as readily support custom macro goals and tracking that specific aspect of your nutrition.

title: Hands down best nutrition app ever!
body: I have tried every nutrition/diet app out there and none of them can even compare to My Macros+! They all want you to sign up to their website, the apps take forever to learn, and they have way too much extra BS you don't need! My Macros+ was developed by a natural pro that knows what you need, unlike most nutrition experts.

title: Great app - new update glitchy
body: Have had this app a couple of months now and really love it! I can program in my macros and as I enter food daily it tallies everything against what macro goal I have set. Great charts and graphs for us visual folks!! Also shows what you have left for the day in each macro so you can plan your next meals and assist in meeting daily goals.

title: PLEASE READ!!! (Missing important components)
body: Doesn't track anything besides calories, carbs, sugar, fiber, fats, protein, sodium, and cholesterol. I was looking for a nutritional app with vitamins and minerals, etc. A lot of health problems develop because of nutritional deficiencies and the limited nutritional data on this app is disappointing. I intended on tracking a wide variety of nutritional aspects of my diet but am unable to with this app, in its current state. I suggest the developers to add all the nutritional data of all foods to this app. Also, I suggest possibly consulting with nutritionalists and dietitians to add accurate nutritional information on the function/importance/risk associated with various nutritional data such as vitamins, minerals, fats, protein, etc. Also, how excess and deficiencies in personal nutritional aspects may effect health. Nutrition does not just effect physical attributes but it also significantly effects emotional attributes such as depression. This app is currently a tool to track limited data but it has the potential to become an education device that could potential help people manage and understand their own complicated health/nutritional needs. This would help people track and develop their nutritional diet to improve physically AND mentally. With the solid support base this app currently has, I feel like a lot of people could benefit from these changes which is why I hope the developer reads this. Peace.

title: Fantastic and only keeps getting better
body: This is a fantastic app and a great competitor to MyFitnessPal. I like that I'm able to customize my own macros and not rely on "ratios". Being a natural bodybuilder this app makes my life easier by displaying my macros after every food item that I add, letting me know if I'm on track to hit my targets. Being a competitor I need to be able to switch macro targets from time to time whether I'm in a cutting or bulking phase. MyMacros has great potential and keeps getting better with every iteration. A couple things I would like to see would be the possibility of scheduling different macros on different days. For example, refeed macros every Saturday and daily macros every other day of the week. Another sweet feature would be reminders to update weight and track if days go by without tracking -this could get annoying, but would be useful to keep folks on track toward their goals. All in all, I do love this app :)

title: Sold app with a nice layout.
body: I was reading the reviews and was really looking for an app I can add multiple meals per day. This you can have as many as you want. Also love how the totals are all are at the bottom of each sheet and the total at the bottom of the day. I find this really interactive and easy to use. It was a change from my fitness pal. The scanner is easy to use and better than previous app. I love the push and pop on the day. Best use of this feature on the iPhone yet. Ok. Complaints. The database is good but needs updates. Like no seared tuna, see its when eating out and trying to search for items it struggles. Also the recipe needs help. In my fitness pal this is amazing, which I still use because of it. The only feature I do miss is the integration with strava or adding workouts. But this is not a big loss. Stick with what you do best which makes this app excellent. Glad I have joined the community. Can't wait to see what is next.

title: Needs Measuring Algorithms
body: Great potential, but this app is in desperate need of food measuring algorithms. I measure my drinks in ounces or cups and my food in grams or ounces, however, if I wanted to pour only 6 ounces of almond milk, this app doesn't allow me to quickly and practically do that. I have to stop and think "how many ounces in a cup?" (This is just an example, I know it's 8) and then I have to divide 8 by 6 and am left with a really weird number to input into the app. There needs to be a quick menu to change from ounces, to cups, to whatever. See MyFitnessPal. Their calculation algorithms are great!

title: User friendly! Truly helpful.
body: My favorite part about this app is the barcode scanner. It's so easy to just scan the barcodes of whatever I'm making, and then input how much I eat. It calculates all the nutritional value and I see how much I'm getting or not getting. It's helped me quite a bit since I started using it. It's harder to reach nutritional goals than you'd think, and seeing what I eat every time helps keep me accountable and aware, since I have quite the sugar/carb tooth. I also like how you can just search things or manually enter them in a simple format when you can't scan a barcode. You do have to enter each part of your meal individually, I mean even the sides or toppings. But that's not a downside to me because I see it as a more detailed breakdown of my food and I'm seeing exactly where the good calories and bad calories are coming from. Overall great app!! Worth it.

title: Very Imprecise
body: I'm trying keno for the first time. Keto is similar to Paleo but even stricter on the carb side. Very little fruit and limited veggies and heavy on the healthy fats. So - I'm exploring lots of unique recipes.  You really need to monitor your ratio of fat/protein/*NET* carbs.

title: Better alternative to MFP
body: I switched over to this app from MFP when that app started playing video ads and wanted to charge a huge monthly fee to properly track macros.  Once I got used to it, I actually prefer this interface.  I don't bother searching the database for new foods, once you get used to it, it only takes about 5-10 seconds to enter the macros for a new food item, so that's easier than searching the database or scanning the barcode.

title: Great app, but a few suggestions
