body: I love the app and I've been staying focused on logging almost daily. But there are a few things missing/tweaks that can be made. It has body weight...and it would be nice to be able to log water consumption and also sleep. I know this app is mainly directed towards macro counting but these features would make it a more well-rounded health logging app in general. ALSO, the app keeps asking me to sync my content. I continually hit 'no' but it will pop up several times while I'm using it. This can be a hassle with iPhone because if I'm adding a custom food and the keyboard is displayed, I am not able to press no or back out of the keyboard to see the 'no' button and I have to exit the app completely and restart from the top. I always pray it doesn't pop up in the middle of adding custom food because it's frustrating and a huge waste of time to redo the math and go through the whole motion again. Please only ask once if a person would like to sync their data and direct them towards a place in the app they can MANUALLY find if they change their mind... or add a 'do not show again' option. Other than that, this app is AWESOME and helping me to achieve my health/fitness goals. Thank you!

title: Great app, 1 thing to fix
body: This was exactly what I was looking for. I am trying to start the iifym diet system (if it fits your macros) and this makes it easy to see where I am at with my daily macro intake. The weight tracking system is very cool too. It allows you to see how on track you have been and gives you incentive to stay on your diet. Also the custom diet plan option is great! Instead of having a set carb/protein/fat ratio for everyone it allows you to choose your own option unlike other apps like myfitnesspal or livestrong. The only downside to this app is that the food database is very limited. I think that if the app developer expanded the food options as well as the brand name options then this app would be unbelievably easy and perfect to use for ALL dieting plans not just iifym. Good start for an app only released a couple weeks ago!

title: Good, but could be even better
body: I’m training for my first fitness competition and downloaded this app because I needed an easy and convenient way to track my daily macros.  It does what it says it does and is fairly easy to use, however, there are some things I wish it had that it doesn’t.  Specifically, this app would be even better if you could track water intake (I need to drink a gallon a day), supplements (I take several), and take notes about your food intake.  Also, I used the app to email my trainer and, even though my total daily calories were correct, the calories for each individual meal were not.  I can’t figure out how to fix this.  I think it may be a bug.  Other than these minor issues, the app is a good deal for the price and I recommend it for any fitness and nutrition buff.

title: Great
body: The App is My favorite, but I see 2 problems that I want to know if it is possible to solves as faster as possible please. One of this problems is that the Kcal of what do you register, in the days goals...There is always bad calculated the Kcal compared to the macronutrients, it count less calories that it should count. The other observation is that when you set a goal, you should personalize it; I mean the amount of fiber, sugar, unsaturated fats etc. Please check this points; but apart of these points, the app is awesome.

title: Great app, user friendly
body: This is a great app to customize and track macros.  As a first time macro tracker, I find this app user friendly and helpful. The colors and numbers on the home page keep me aware of where I am number-wise throughout the day. The daily weight tracker keeps track and shows the user where you are compared to previous days. The user can search foods by brand, find recipes within the app from other users (macros included,) and add food that is not in the app using the barcode or manually adding numbers. I really like how you can save a meal and name it, so that way in a few taps the meal desired is added. The only complaint I have is when searching "by brand" for food, one has to scroll as opposed to tapping the letter on the side like an address book or song search on an Apple product. Super minor detail but nonetheless, awesome app! :)

title: Fantastic Tool
body: This is a wonderful tool for tracking your macros. The only draw backs are that sometimes it doesn't have the food your looking for so you have to create a "custom" food (but the app saves it for future use, so it's not so bad) and it doesn't track the time that you actually ate (yet you can label each meal and even create custom labels, aka snack1 or snack2). Other than those minor things I can't think of anything that I would change (well except if they started adding features that tracked weight and measurements/connected to a fitness tracker/recorded exercise/etc., yet that would  a super all-in-one app, lol). The layout is simple and easy to use. This app basically takes away all excuses for not tracking your macros!!!!! Buy it!!!!!

title: Overall a solid app
body: Pretty easy to use and has a clean UI, although there are some things that make it a little weird sometimes. As of right now I can't (or maybe I don't know how to work It correctly, also possible) have multiple "snack" meals. So, if I have an apple in between breakfast and lunch, and then maybe some nuts between lunch and dinner, they will be grouped together and I am unable to have my meals organized chronologically. I find also that some of the ways that food is calculated/shown (grams/oz/etc) also can be slightly problematic for me since I don't always measure my food that way. I understand that it is much more accurate, but I'm not really weighing the strawberries that I'm cutting up to put in my oatmeal in the morning.

title: Only half good.
body: Mm+ is a great app for tracking your macros IF you input all the data yourself.

title: I use this app everyday
body: I really do love this app for all that it can track. I like have different meal names and being able to copy meals. I really use this app everyday.

title: LOVE, Love, love this app!
body: I've recently began a Ketogenic lifestyle & keeping track of my macros was not only tedious & time consuming but a little confusing at times!! Most "diet" app's are geared only towards counting calories. I was delighted when I came across this app AND that it was easy to use! I love the features & the ability to view graphs based on fats/proteins/carbs. The barcode scanner is a blessing. While there is a decent sized pre-added food inventory, it's very nice to add you own manually or by using the barcode scanner. The ONLY thing that gets to me is that when using the barcode scanner occasionally the nutrients are off from what the actual package says. Just a little thing! Otherwise this app is perfect for me! Thanks so much!!

title: Not near the database of MFP, but better GUI
body: MM+ has a much better interface than MFP in my opinion. However, where it excels in interface, it greatly lacks in its food database and search engine. Adding food is not too difficult, but is a nuisance when an easy search in MFP would bring it up.

title: Good but not great
body: I really like this app but it's severely lacking in a few areas. I really like how the daily journal is set up because it's easy to read and keep yourself on track. You can instantly see how much you have left for each area, which is crucial. No guess work or on the go math needed. It has the ability to back up all of your data...but it doesn't really work. I took a month off for travel/work and now my custom foods and goals are no longer in the app. The barcode scanner is great in theory, but again, it doesn't work. Things will scan and not have any data or will pull up the completely incorrect product. If the food database was larger, the scanner was more reliable and the profiles were actually saved this world be a 5 star app.

title: Perfect for customizing macros
body: Since MFP changed their app, you now have to pay to enter custom macronutrient values (which is total bull). I downloaded this app because of the good reviews and it has been great. I will admit it was a bit confusing at first coming from MFP but now that I know how to operate it, it is so much easier. Completely customizable macro values. I'm currently reverse dieting so my macros are changing weekly and it is easy to change them through the app. Well worth the money. Only thing I wish was that the search engine worked a little better. When I search for things they don't show up all the time but when I scan the barcode they do. Not sure about that but otherwise a wonderful app!

title: Great customer support
body: This app is wonderful once you get used to its workflow. Loaded with functionality, including weight tracker and the ability to look up foods, I have yet to find a food that is not in this apps library. I also love how in the recipes section I don't have to input my own nutritional values for all the ingredients I just look them up individually from within the recipes menu and the app does the work for me! I also had a question about functionality and I emailed the staff using the send feedback button to ask it and I got an answer within hours on a Saturday from the co-founder of the app, who better for a functionality question?! Amazing app that's well worth the 3 dollars, keep it up!

title: Okay app.
body: This app is literally loaded with functionality that it lets you use it however you wanted to. However, there are still some bugs that the developer doesn't address nor respond back in bug reports. Animation is also very sluggish/choppy. He is very responsive for feature inquiries prior to you buying to sell you the app though. Afterwards, nothing but silence.

title: GREAT EASY TO USE APP
body: I have been using this app for a little over a year and couldn't be more pleased. I just add all my foods via the custom input and track my macros from there. I also love how it shows the remaining macros of each day and the percentages of each food group. It also has an awesome feature where it sends you an email at the end of each week to show what you kcal intake was for each day. The only things I would add to app is a time when I eat each meal or when you enter your info in and on the email it shows your overall kcal for the week, so I don't have to add it every time. But other than that totally recommend. Great easy to use app.

title: Half way there
body: The ultimate reason why I switched tracking apps was for the simplicity of macro tracking with that being said I would give it a 5star, very easy and the math always adds up.

title: Love this App.
body: I have been using this app for about three weeks. I had been using MFP for sixteen months. There was a power failure that lasted for twenty four + hours, and I was like a fish out of water, as MFP would not work off line, so I looked for a app that would as I will soon be traveling on a cruise ship for four weeks. Once I found MM+, started using it, I fell in love with it. It is easy to use, you can put in the amount you eat and it calculates the nutrition value for you. As it works off line, I take my iPad to dinner with me as I have been diagnosed as a borderline diabetic, I have reduced my body weight from 203lbs. to 155lbs, and I want to maintain that. I gave the app four stars, as there is always room for improvement.

title: Love this
body: I love this app for tracking and love they keep improving. I do wish I could have the option to search only my custom and favorites. For some reason some foods don't seem to "save" in my custom and favorites either (or maybe I'm just not finding them). So I need to rescan (my butter for example). The longer I use the app and the more foods I add, the nicer it would be to search only my foods. Same goes for search by brand. I wish I could then select the global search or just my foods. But these are wish items. The current app functions great and is helping me change my body. Huge thanks to the creators and the team!!

title: Disappointing
body: This app is disappointing… I use Fitbit to track cals and have just moved on to tracking Macro’s, I didn’t want to pay for a subscription to MFP so tried this app instead. Overall I found the interface clunky, not intuitive to add items. Also, its heavily focused on fast food outlets and brands… I cook a lot, and fresh food and vegetables tend to be way down the list of items. Also, each item only has one weight variable so often hard to find items that meet my specific foods with appropriate measurements, such as kgs, or lbs, etc., had to use “a cup of this, a piece of that, an oz something else…” no consistency. I didn’t subscribe and therefore did not use the extended database, which might be better, but I doubt it. I ended reverting to Fitbit to track cals and developed a simple spreadsheet to track macros. Waste of $2.99 for me.

title: Fantastic Macros Tracker.
body: I switched over from MFP. Iv have been using that for about a year. It always felt bloated and full of stuff I didn't want. I just wanted to keep a food log and track my macros. This app does this with ease. It is well designed and everything iv thrown at it has been in the database. If not then it's just 5-10 seconds to enter it yourself it has a clean interface and is quick and easy. I'm so glad I found this app and support it fully. Thank you to the creater. Please keep making it better. It's already a great app. One suggestion I would ask of though would be to add a + button on the main screen to use the scanner a little quicker. Besides that this app is epic.

title: Best app ever
body: There are some great things in this world...I can definitely say that My Macros+ is certainly at the top of the list. This is the app I have been looking for. After spending months calculating and manually adding/updating and recording macros/cals in the "notes" app, this was a breath of fresh air. It is very easy to use, efficient and extremely accurate. (I've double/triple checked many of the available listed foods and they are spot on!) I can really say this borderline changed my lift and I recommend this for anyone from someone who is "dieting" to drop a few lb's... To the serious competitive athlete or bodybuilder. Thanks for developing this!

title: Not as convenient as I thought
body: I wanted an app that I could track my macros per meal as well as daily. The search function is almost useless as the current database is so small. For example I searched "brown rice" only to get one option (great value) for actual rice and a bunch for rice cakes. The serving isn't outlined so I have to guess how much is one serving based on calories. The barcode function is also useless. Instead of finding the actual item, I get a list of completely unrelated items (infant formula?!) I'm finding it's taking a lot more time to log food on this app then any other I've tried. If I have to spend at least 5 mins logging a 250 calorie meal every time I eat, I won't bother logging at all. Very counterproductive.

title: The Best App for Macro Tracking
body: I started tracking my macros in August 2014. At first I tried myfitnesspal and was left feeling frustrated because the system wasn't intuitive and I couldn't figure out how to set my macro goals precisely. I then began hunting for an app on google.  I StumbleUpon MyMacros+ and loved it from the start. It's super easy to use, it remembers my favorite meals and I can seamlessly switch from a low carb day to a high day back to a low day and then to a Refeed day all with the touch of a button. You enter your different goals once, it remembers and you can toggle through them easily. I highly recommend this app!!

title: Love this app
body: The latest version is by far the best!  Puts MFP to shame!

title: I really want to love it but...
body: I am not new to food tracking but am new to tracking macros. Since my goal is weight loss it's important to me to be able to easily track calories in and calories out but the sync function between this app and my workout+ needs some work. The data between the apps is not accurate. Even when I hit "upload all" to sync the data between the apps one is always off. Right now, my data for today is suddenly my data for yesterday too. Too cumbersome. Would've given the app 2 stars but their response to my email was super quick. Unfortunately their suggestion didn't rectify the issue. Wish I didn't spend the money on the app without being able to test it first.

title: Best app for counting macros
body: This is easily the best app for those that ate serious about their nutrition & tracking their macros. The app is easy to navigate And I very user friendly. The customization with the food is awesome & being able to add your own food and have the app calculate the exact macros for whatever serving size is great. On top of that Jason has awesome customer service. I emailed him with several questions and within minutes I had responses directly from him. He answered all my questions and was great to talk to. This was literally the first app I purchased off the app store and so glad I did. Thanks Jason for the best app on the app store.

title: Simple easy to use. Could use a few minor changes
body: I love this app. It's easy to use, clean UI, great list of food, macro calculator, etc. The most I like about this is the abilities for you to set custom numbers and able to set different profiles from one interface. However, with that being said it could use a few changes. I would like if they made it so that you could move your food around to different meals would be nice without having to delete then search and add then add the food to the corresponding meal. Another is if they would add a barcode scanner icon on the UI for quicker access without having to go search for the barcode scanner to scan food.

title: Good app. Needs feedback, output options.
body: The app takes a little while to get used to, but then the interface starts making sense.

title: Best one I've Found!
body: I read through most of the reviews and after trying my fitness pal and not really loving it, I bought this and it's so much better. if you're like me and eat relatively the same foods, this app is amazing. input foods once, and then just go to your recents to get it (or custom if it's not in recents). I do agree with others that the database has lots of entries that could be right or wrong, but you'll find the same thing with my fitness pal... and it's not that hard to look on the Internet and enter it yourself! otherwise, I love the goal tracking and the display, and everything is so seamless. love it!

title: Good ideas horrible execution and tech support
body: To summarize if you don't want to read the review extremely glitchy and inconsistent.

title: I've always preferred MM+ to MFP
body: I've been using mm+ for over a year now and I'm still in love with it. It's much more customizable than mfp. It's very organized & easy to read. You can be as precise with your units as you want & it does a great job at making conversions for you. You can create & name endless macro goals/splits... Which is especially useful for athletes who are constantly changing macro ratios. With more people using the app, there are now more pre-tracked food options in the "search". Save your favorite meals, most tracked foods, recipes etc.

title: Perfect for Anyone!!!!
body: I have been using this app for a few months now and am absolutely impressed. Most of the apps only allow for 3 meals and snacks and it's hard to categorize your meals. The developer put lots of thoughts into this and I LOVE that I can create my own meal plan which includes a schedule of 7 meals. Easy to use once you figured it out the first time :-).

title: Nice App w/ improvements GREAT APP
body: This app works great to help me stay on track with food. I like the layout better than any other app that I have used. There are a few quirks that I am sure will be improved. The food list seems to be a bit small compared to others. If more items get added this app would be 5 star. Also, if it were compatible with MapMyRun and/or other apps for working out, that would improve the app as well. I like the connection that a different app has so when wearing my hear rate monitor and knowing how many calories I burned would be added to this app. Again, I really love this app for food tracking alone, it rocks.

title: Better than MFP
body: I have been using MM+ for a few months after MyFitnessPal started charging and I couldn't customize my macros. At first, it was annoying and a little glitchy, but I really like that I can customize and correct any food on my phone on the spot, and enter my food in grams (I like it for consistency and accuracy). Manually adding food is easy too. The best thing I like about this is that I can see in each of my meals how much of each macro is in each entry - so I can adjust my amounts of food when I'm meal planning so I can make my macros fit in my day. Also, there's a way to use different profiles if you use less carbs on a rest day, etc .

title: Best app for logging and IIFYM
body: Love this app, before this I used myfitnesspal which is not as good as My Macros. The fitnesspal app wants (for premium) 10$ a month or 50$ a year. With Macros you get premium for a one time payment. Looking back I now would have gladly payed more than 3$ the UI is easy to use and after a week or so of use all your regular foods are there and makes things quick and easy. If you are new to or have been doing IIFYM this app will help you be accurate and will be easier to use than the under armour app with tons of ads (myfitnesspal). Also try pairing this app with the workout one as well!

title: Absolutely amazing!!!
body: Man this app is so awesome it's unreal!!! So easy to track each and every single thing you eat and you can save meals that you eat frequently. Like I eat the same breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack and post workout Monday thru Friday and I just save each one of those meals and you just click on it and it uploads the whole meal!! Takes 2 seconds to enter a whole day. And it's all super accurate. I'm down 4lbs in 1 week and without knowing exactly what I'm putting in my body everyday thru this app, I wouldn't have been able to do that!! Highly recommend this app, beats the heck outta my fitness pal.

title: Perfect fit
body: I have struggled with tracking my meals in the last because it seemed to always put me in an unhealthy mindset which would lead to skipping meals and trying to eat as few calories as possible.  However, MM+ has been a godsend.  It doesn't focus on calories but macros instead which has helped me tremendously.  The food library is fairly comprehensive and I find it very easy to track my meals.  MM+ is a simple but effective tool for macro tracking and is well worth the small fee, especially when compared to apps like MFP that requires a $10/month subscription for macro tracking

user_name: I r r I t a t e d
title: Love it but improvements could be made.
body: I've been using My Fitness Pal for over 6yrs and recently switched to this app because of the simple fact that I can put in my exact macro goals without paying extra! I really like the layout of this app. The only things I would like to see improvements on are the search engine (type in a restaurant name and see food options for that place and so I don't have to be as exact with wording), have recent foods sorted by most recently used instead of alphabetical order and I would also like to add multiple foods to a meal at once instead of individually. I rarely eat the same exact meals each day so saving a meal to add it again later doesn't help me out very much.

title: Great app! Very simple and practical
body: The way this app is set up is perfect, it keeps your goal and current macros on display and even counts down how much you have left every day. It also synchronizes with avatar nutrition accounts which makes using those macro numbers 10x's easier. Some certain branded foods can be a little difficult to find in the search, but you will at least get something similar. Entering in the food measurements is very easy, instead of having to enter grams in multiples of 100 like other tracking apps, you can enter in the precise number and go as high as you want.

title: Customizable but extremely clunky and not user friendly
body: Coming from MyFitnessPal, this thing is difficult to use. Yes, I can track my macros to the gram, unlike free MFP. Foods entered into MM are saved, but in no way except a forever-long alphabetical list. There's no way to organize your foods in a way that makes any sense. Foods that are entered with the barcode scanner work most of the time, but instead of coming into the app as a serving, it comes in in individual grams. Even a pre-measured yogurt cup that I shouldn't have to know how many grams are in it, since it's pre-measured. To access MM online, you have to pay a monthly subscription. This app isn't worth the $3. I have been using it nearly a month now, hoping it will get easier, but it's just annoying. Don't waste your money.

title: Great app!
body: This app is super quick and easy to use, it doesn't have a large food database but I prefer to input my own food anyway. You have the option to create multiple goal profiles with different macros (I have "training day" macros and "rest day" macros") and it displays your goals clearly at the bottom of your food log, along with your current macros, and with just a tap it shows your remaining macros as well! You can create as many meals as you want and name them yourself, so whether you practice intermittent fasting or classic bodybuilding practice with several meals a day I think you'll find this app useful. I'd highly suggest it!

title: Great start & perfect for iifym dieting
body: If you Marco diet, this app rocks! Unlike livestrong, you have complete control over the food nutritional values with this app which was the one reason I switched. It's easy to add new foods for easy re-entry into new meals. Since the app is geared towards Marco counting, it makes easy work for staying on track. For example you can set Marco goals per day, ie training day vs rest day. It's a great start and with some polishing it'll be a 5 star app. I hope the Macro progress improves, even add calories targets with graphs would be great. You can track your weight, awesome, by why not add tracking measurements too. Even as a paid addon.

title: Amazing app. Best macro/food tracking app
body: It's accurate and does everything you want it to do. Used my net diary and my fitness pal and this app is 10 times better. I'm a personal trainer and this is the app I recommend to all my clients. It makes it easy for me to check up on their weight as well as make sure they are hitting their macros. Great for people like me who do IIFYM/flexible dieting. I never review apps, but this one is well worth my time to review! Also if you have issues or suggestion, the developer responds quickly, as he is always looking for ways to improve his app.

title: MFP is better hands down however..
body: For the price you pay for this makes this a much better macro tracking solution. Only bothersome part is the food database is static meaning you won't be searching a constant and always growing database, however this could be nice for when you have no data connection.

title: Great App!
body: I've just started a serious fitness program and am totally new to the whole tracking your food thing. This is the first food tracking app that I have ever used, and it's so easy that its quickly become second nature to just enter my food and go. And I absolutely LOVE the barcode scanner! I actually let out a "woo hoo" the first time I used that!

title: Not bad
body: I do like this app as a macro calculator, but I feel as though it still has a way to go.

title: Hands Down The Best!
body: This app gives me everything I need without having to "trick" it into working the way I want it too.  Finally a gram tracking app that doesn't assume it knows better than me, or force me to use percentages when I want to track precise grams. Fully customizable to my needs.  Recommending this especially to anyone following a ketogenic lifestyle.

title: Had high hopes
body: I loved all the nutrients this app can track.  The list of food is quite a large, and being able to enter custom food was a plus.  I hate that you can only enter one meal.  Once you select lunch or dinner you are stuck with that meal all day.  Every time you add food it just piles on the one meal, oh and there is no breakfast option.  But you can copy that large meal to the next day and delete off what you didn't eat, I guess that is a plus.  So if you track food all day, you either look like you ate 1800 calories for lunch or dinner, I hate the way that looks. And what no snacks! Again you just lump them right in. Will be finding me a new app, as this might be a gimmick to make me by pro, oh wait I did, right?

title: Easy to use, simple health tracker
body: I was introduced to MyMacros+ about one year ago when I started tracking my food for a bodybuilding competition. Once you start using the app, you can create weight goals, micronutrient goals per day, and more! Love the interface design as it is clean and stores food favorites. You can create your own recipes and enter into the app for serving sizes and measurements. Works well when baking yummy treats and I want to know how much each serving yield for proteins, carbs, and fats. Highly recommend for anyone wanting more freedom in healthy eating and an easy-to-use app, accessible via phone and tablet and soon, computer!

title: An excellent app for tracking macros!
body: For what I need a calorie tracker to do, this is better than MyFitnessPal. Primarily, because it is less expensive and doesn't require the subscription for basic things like the ability to have multiple daily goals - which is necessary if you're carb cycling, or doing something like LeanGains. And, the developer listens to what the community needs. The one thing I found lacking was an ability to choose a different nutrition goal before making a food entry; I wrote the developer about it - now, it has that ability. (I'm sure it was requested by others, as well.)

title: Great App!
body: Best app for tracking macros IMO. Very easy to setup custom foods, meals can be copied within day, or from one day to another, and Fast Track feature allows you to add macros for a meal or foods that are not in your list already.

title: Practical & Easy
body: I've tried a few apps including myfitnesspal and I'm so glad that I came across this one because I love the simplicity of this app. You can see your macros easily plus your calorie intake is much easier to track, at least it is for me. The only thing that needs to be added is which is crucial to an app like this are more food options when searching for foods and their brands, its very limited when it comes to that. But again if you know the nutrition facts of what youre eating then you can always add it to the customize section. Overall its an easy to use app!!

title: Amazing App!
body: This app has me finally on track to my fitness goals! It is easy to use and I loooove (and live by) the barcode scanner! The search feature is a little weird, you can't search for specific things, if you want a brand you can't search for it you have to go through the Brand tab, which is a little annoying. Also I would like to be able to edit my sugar info/goals.. Otherwise, this and the track my workout+ app together is better than anything else I have used!

title: Not bad!
body: I really like the flexibility of the app and how specific you can get with your tracking.

title: Great macro tracker
body: One of the best macro trackers I've found. Tried the most popular (My Fitness Pal) but don't like the monthly sub for premium features and daily breakdown of meals is poor. My Macros + allows a better breakdown as well as per meal macro breakdown which is a huge plus over most everything else I've tried.

title: Excellent App
body: This is one of the best macros tracking apps available. It takes some time the first week to get used to tracking, but it holds you accountable for the food you eat! I love how it keeps store of frequent meals making things a lot easier after the first week.  Turns out my problem was I wasn't eating enough food!! My performance in the gym and my energy level has increased tremendously. My advice is to stick with it. It's hard to figure out meals that fit your macros initially, but once you get the hang of it the results are worth it!

title: Frustrated
body: I was happy with My Fitness pal app but after joining avatar nutrition,  they pushed this app and said it was connected to my account so I can I out

title: My Macros+ "Great But Lacks"
body: My Macros+ is a pretty amazing app, would rate 9/10 being the fact that it lacks basic information which I think should be included on the next update. For example macros being counted based on the food labeling and also better barcode scanner with a flash. I also think it's imperative that all nutrition facts are labeled down. Like potassium and vitamins are essential information logs for everyone. Proper food search with macros for various restaurants. A home dash board to view macros is a great idea to implement In an update for this app. I love it can be better great work. 😊❤️👌

title: Great so far
body: Update: still love the app and still use it daily. Regular updates and feedback from the developer make for a fantastic experience. This is still the best macro tracking app available.

title: Wish it converted measurements and had a body fat % calc
body: Not having a body fat % tracker is really the only peeve I can find about this app, and the only thing holding me back from a 5-star rating. It doesn't make sense to be so meticulous about macro tracking, and then encouraging to judge progress based on just WEIGHT alone. We all know the scale isn't everything. Second thing is I would love for it to convert from imperial to metric and vice versa like some competitor apps do (Lose It!). If both of these features were added, it would absolutely blow everything else out there out of the water.

title: All you ever need
body: This app is perfect for tracking macros for whatever your fitness/nutritional goal is! Once you get your customized list of foods down it's very easy to see what ratios and percentages of each macro you are eating. The whole app is very streamlined and I have had no problems with it. Setting goals for each macro (F/C/P) is easy and finding out what you need to eat more or less of each macronutrient is nice. Plus, it's all on the go with your iPhone…..what more could you want?

title: Amazing!
body: Not only is MyMacros+ an amazing app for tracking daily macs and calories, it has an AMAZING developer as well!

title: Works well, but even better with changes
body: I am a novice fitness competitor & just started using this app & I find it very useful to figure macros on a daily basis.

title: Cool but needs more features
body: I like this app. It's clean and has a lot of the features I need except for a few that tap and track pro (my current app) does have. The only thing I have a gripe with is the nutritional calculator. In my opinion it should use the newer formulas and should include Katch-McCardie and Harris-Benedict to predict caloric needs. You should also be able to adjust your calories and macros on your own and have them on the GUI so you can see them as you track your food. I'll stick with tap and track pro till I find this is resolved, but still a very clean app

title: Perfect App- Needs Updates/ Fixes though
body: After using my fitnesspal for about 6 Months now with almost every imput of food being incorrect and my macros always being wrong, this app is perfect. Although your imput of foods are few, adding my own foods was simple and more preferred anyways ( accuracy purposes )

title: Love everything except...
body: ...the food database. You might not find something if you type into the search box, but it'll be there under the brand search. I use the barcode scanner often. Also you can't switch btwn oz, grams, cups, etc. when using a food from the database. Sometimes I just use one of my other apps to get the macros and enter them manually.

title: Best macro tracking app!
body: I've been using My Macros+ for almost 2 years now and I love how easy and flexible this app is. When entering a custom food, I like how it breaks the serving size, regardless of entry, down to the "1" ounce, gram, fl oz, etc. so you only need one entry per food instead of multiple entries for each serving size. It also comes with some pre-loaded recipes, multiple macro profiles, allows weight tracking and following other users. That's just some of the features. It's well worth the $2.99 in the App Store!

title: Best diet and fitness apps hands down.
body: I never write reviews because nothing really blows me away like this app and the sister app MyWorkout+. Both are absolutely perfect if you are tracking your macros and calories in vs calories out since the two apps link together. However, the Workout app might fudge the numbers on calories burned a little but it's still a somewhat accurate depiction of what you're burning throughout your day and during your workout. Anyways, love both apps and will be using them forever.

title: not as good as MyFitnessPal
body: I switched from MFP to this app so that I could input my specific macros, but found it not to be worth it. It's much harder to navigate, and while it's easy to "create" new foods, it makes for a lot of repeating items simply because each entry is spelled differently or something. It makes it really hard to find the food you're looking for, thus prompting you to create a new entry and restarting the cycle. With some tweaking of your percentages, MFP can give just as accurate macro goals, and you don't have to spend any money. If you're just starting to track your food/macros I suggest starting with MFP before spending money on more difficult apps like this.

title: the best tracking app out there but...
body: awesome. download. my favorite hands down. easy to use, plenty of features and flexibility. however, id take the time to enter all of my own custom food. will be time consuming the first week but once its all saved and stored you are good. but some of the "verified" foods in the search are way off. saw a "verified" brain octane (mct oil) that said 1 tbsp was 1100 calories and 274 grams of fat. WAY off. this is minor but just be aware of foods you search for rather than input manually.

title: One Of The Best Apps.
body: My Macro+ is one of the greatest apps I've used to calculate my macros and calories. I switched from MyFitnessPal to this and have to say its one the best decisions I've made. One of the best futures is that you could actually manually enter your protein/carbs/fat goals for the day. it has made tracking easier for me and would like to thank Jason for creating such an amazing app. My only recommendation would be to add in a barcode scanner and create a bigger food database. Other than that, the app is one of the best.

title: This is a must have app!!!
body: Wonderful app and even better customer service!! I sent an email and my question was answered within minutes! This is a very accurate and easy to use app for anyone interested in calculating their daily macros and keeping a log of the food you eat. I have been macro dieting for a few months and i couldn't imagine what I'd do without this app, makes life so much easier. I recommend this app to anyone and can promise you that it is well worth the money.

title: Love the app but 1 thing..
body: This app makes tracking macros super easy and efficient. The only thing I wish they would add (which would perfect this app) is that at the end of the week that they would email you a grid of your total cals consumed each day of the week AND your macros. It would make it a lot easier if you have a trainer or like to spreadsheet your macros to see you're coming along. But i guess for now, I'm stuck scrolling through each day righting them day separately.

title: Takes the guess work out of cutting weight
body: Myfitnesspal is a waste this app has everything you could ever need and the manual entry is my go to for new foods. Once you've built your own database with your most eaten food you are clear sailing the weight tracker is pretty useful to. The barcode scanner is fantastic and if you noticed a discrepancy between the macros when you scan the barcode to when you check the label it is very easy to edit the entry and update the numbers

title: Excellent tool
body: I have been using this tool off/on for a couple years now. I prefer to manually add my food so I am sure it's completely accurate. Now that I have built a substantial food database, it takes me no time to track my food plan daily. It really makes you aware of what you are eating and whether or not it's worth the macros so you don't sabotage your workout. The only thing I wish it would have is the option for your trainer to log on and see your meal plan at any given moment and offer feedback. Now that would be awesome!!

title: Frustrating coming from my fitness pal
body: Only bought this since I signed up for avatar nutrition.

title: Love it soooooo much!
body: This app really makes it easy to track both your overall calories and macro nutrients as well. Barcode scanner makes it easy to add store bought things. Things you eat frequently get added to a list for convenience. When I started using this app I was 205 lbs and and am now a comfortable 175. In the end you are the one who decides whether you succeed in your achieving your fitness goals, but this app is a great tool to help you with the nutritional side of them!

title: I credit this app to the majority of my fitness success
body: I think this app is amazing. I enter all of the nutrition facts myself, which if you're making your own food shouldn't be very difficult. This app is made to track your MACROS...and your macros consists of calories, protein, carbs and fat. If you're looking to track anything else, than this app is not made for you. Otherwise if you're looking to build muscle and shred fat, this app will definitely help get your diet where it needs to be.

title: Great Macros Tracker
body: Following a Keto plan, I prefer to see my information displayed as a 'graph' and not just in grams and ounces. My Macros does this easily. Other apps and trackers are ok but want you to subscribe to a monthly service for the same features My Macros gives with one, affordable purchase. Customer Service is exemplary as well. I had a question and sent an email. I was contacted within an hour with a solution. Great customer service alone is worth the cost of the app. I highly suggest this app. Thanks My Macros (Jason Loewy) :)

title: Good app with issues
body: Initially I had given it 5 stars because the apps been working great. But I got my new iPhone 7 plus. And it didn't transfer my data on to it. I have the app on my iPad and my iPhone. It was working fine with my old phone, but didn't transfer all my food entries from the past and even daily which I am doing at the moment. I will enter data into my iPad, and only some of it will get transferred on my iPhone. Really weird and annoying. I was using this app everyday but if this issue will continue I might have to look for a different app. Sadly disappointed and frustrated.

title: Perfect
body: This is an amazing app. I've been looking for something to track what I eat with basic nutritional info that DIDN'T have a calorie goal. Finally with this app I found it. You can set goals if you want (for fat, protein, and carbs) but it doesn't ask for your current weight and goal like 99%of the other food trackers.

title: Great app for tracking macros.
body: I feel that this app is far superior to My Fitness Pal in terms of the ability to track macros. One really nice feature is the option to create multiple macro goals. This is really nice for folks who modify their intake depending on whether it's a workout day or not. The interface is clean and easy to use. I'm knocking off one star because the food database is fairly limited. However, once you've added the foods you eat on a regular basis, they are easy to access going forward. So it's not much of an issue.

title: The best food tracker ever
body: I have been using MyMacros+ for over two years. I am a Women's Physique competitor and a flexible dieter. I religiously track food and weight daily.  This has been the most user friendly and accurate tracker I have found. I Ana gourmet cook and look the recipes feature, I have many saved favorite meals that make my food planning for the week go very quickly. Jason has always responded to any questions in a timely manner and he's helped me with my issues. Great tracker!!

title: Great app for tracking
body: Works great on my iPhone 6S.  Not seeing any slowness issues or crashes.  Excellent for macro tracking.  If you eat a lot of prepackaged stuff MyFitnessPal might work better as it has a database that seems larger, but I found the barcode scanner worked a good deal of the time when finding foods.  I mostly cook my own food and measure every ingredient anyway, so the fast track option is fantastic for me.  Also love the home screen force touch feature as well

title: Fantastic app
body: I'm working on building my upper body strength and I have to stay within a certain macros. This app allows me to type in anything and it automatically subtracts the amount of that food from my daily allowance. I wouldn't be succeeding in my current workout program were it not for this app.

title: Best app and BEST customer service
body: I have been using the MyMacros+ app for over two years. I used to track macros on Excel, but since the app was born, tracking is much more convenient. Jason is also the best! I was actually IN the store getting a new phone, and emailed Jason in a panic because my data wasn't syncing (you might panic as well if 2+ years of data was about to be lost). He responded right away and walked me though the process, which was simple. I am so grateful for his help! Thank you, Jason!

title: Love it BUT...
body: Love this program but it is missing a feature!!!! It would be lovely to be able to type a comment in each meal! I am hypoglycemic and have to eat at specific times and there is nowhere to record what time I ate. I don't want to keep adding new Feedings with a time because I don't always hit my target BUT it is something that would be very valuable to people like me or people who are carb cycling or doing an intermittent fasting diet. Do that and this would turn into a 5 star review!!! For me, it is the only thing missing!! :)

title: Love it
body: I used to used Nutritionist+. This is far better. In the passed 5 weeks, only crashed once. I love the "fast track" option. You just input the macronutrients and it doesn't save it to your database but saves it to your day of eating. Covinient when your eating out. What I would like to see added is a option to take notes on the days of eating. I believe it would make the app more versatile and totally separate it from all competitors.

title: Great attempt
body: Good execution at a macro app. I just wish it were easy to find the nutritional facts for basic items like a medium baked chicken drumstick and the ability to delete items from your meals without having to delete the entire meal itself. A more reliable and broader food database would be a positive and welcomed addition to this app. Scanning is a positive of this app but you can't exactly scan a chicken leg. This is the best cheapest alternative to the fitnesspal appwhich will cost you $50 annually just to track your macros if carb cycling.

title: Whyyyyy?????😩😩😩
body: Absolutely loved everything about it! All the super cool features, the organization, the fast track.. etc. was finally convinced it was better than MFP when I noticed my food gets deleted... 😓 I downloaded this app a long time ago and it would always delete a certain food entry right after I entered it so I deleted the app.. I downloaded it again about a month ago and nothing has been deleted so I thought maybe the issue was fixed but I went back to a food entry from a couple days ago and a few food items were deleted. 🙁

title: Hard To Use
body: I bought the app because of the great reviews, so maybe I will redo this review when I understand how to use it more efficiently, but to me, it seems very laborious. I find myself going to myfitnesspal online, finding my foods nutrition facts and then inputting them into this app and saving it as a custom food. It just doesn't seem very user friendly, and I am a 20 something who grew up using Mac products. Just a little confusing and not intuitive to me! That said, I will keep using it because you can customize your foods better than you can on myfitness pal.

title: THE app if you follow IIFYM
body: This app really makes tracking macros easy. I recently hired a coach to help me lean me out, they use macro based program and recommended my fitness pal. I didn't like how it wasn't macro focused. This solved all my problems. The best part is if you enter a custom food based on grams it will automatically adjust the entry to show you how much a 1gram serv is. This makes it much easier to input the food the next time you eat it if the serving size is different. Perfect.

title: Great for macros
body: Sometimes I have to edit the macros count for some items that I scan because they do not match. The app takes a little of getting used to when adding your meals and editing if needed. All I don't want to use this app five times a day. Now that I have gotten used to it it takes less than a minute of my time each time. Great for trainers, nutritionists, bodybuilders, or health awareness who want to keep track of their nutrition.

title: Can't live without this app
body: I've tried them all but this is the only app that allows you to track different macro counts for different days. I love it. Other apps can't compare.

title: Very convenient for general tracking
body: Love that this app has a barcode scanner, and an option to remember recipes, meals, and individual items. When you use the barcode scanner, check the first time to make sure the data entry is correct. Also, for some reason the macros and calories almost never match. I can't tell if it's the way the app treats fiber, but it's not so far off as to be a real problem for casual users.

title: Let us move items between meals and move meals in the day!
body: Love the app!! Only qualms are seen in title- esp if they are simple changes, please please consider them. Maybe when you hold down to get into item deletion mode, also let us rearrange items by dragging them around instead of just allowing deletion. Would be so helpful you have no idea!!

title: Needs bigger data base
body: I really like this app and love how I can easily switch my macro plans from rest day to training days. It is difficult to find food in the database and I find myself having to use the myfitnesspal app to get nutrition information and then log it into this app. Isn't really that difficult but I have to spend a good 30-40 minutes every night before bed getting all my food organized for the next day. Overall though I really do like it :) wish it had a way for me to log into a website like myfitnesspal has too

title: Great app
body: I've been using the app for months now. It's great for tracking and keeping up with food intake.

title: Infinitely better than MFP
body: This app is incredible. There are some kinks that need to be worked out as far as streamlining searches for generic items, but otherwise, I love it.

title: Not satisfied!
body: I switched to this app from MFP at the recommendation of several people. They said its great! Its better than MFP and can do everything MFP can do it just tracks macros instead of calories.  I researched and eventually downloaded it only to find that I can't track a lot of my food in quantaties I want such as ounces and it doesn't have the database MFP does! I can't even track my exercise! MFP can link with Runkeeper, MapMyRun, Fitbit and many more but in order for me to track my fitness I would have to spend another $1.99 to get the exercise app that goes with this food tracking app.  Needless to say this lasted less than 3 days and I am back to my happy place using MFP. Waste of $3.

title: Love!!!
body: I just recently started iifym & this app has made the whole process sooo easy!! I love everything about this app. Cant say enough. Totally worth the very small fee! It doesnt have everything in the barcode system but its super simple to add a food & adding a recipe is super simple also. The only thing id change is that i wish it would show your fiber intake with each meal along with the protein fat & carbs. But thats not a huge deal. Love love love this app!!

title: Really great app!
body: I love this app! It is so easy to track and has a really large database. The only thing I would change is I'd like to be able to copy other user's meals. My husband and I both use the app and we would love to be able to copy each other's meals when we're having the same thing for dinner or if I find something I like that he tries later. Other than that, it's a perfect app! I've lost 20lbs using it.

title: Easy to Use
body: I have given this app a 5 star rating because it's so easy to use and it helps me keep track of everything going into my mouth. I love the scanner feature, it makes adding foods so much easier. My only gripe is that in the profile section you can't change the height very well. I am a guy that is 6'4" and it won't let me accurately put in that height. Otherwise this app is beautifully put together.

title: The best
body: I wrote a review about 6 months ago about this app and gave it 3 stars because of a few features that made it less user friendly than it could be. Well I'm back to change my review to 5 stars because those things have been fixed and this is now the fastest, most user friendly app out there for tracking macros. I love it and can't think of any ways to improve it. Buy it!

title: Who knew I could keep a food journal?
body: I love this app! Took me a little time those first few days to get things set up, to get my basic foods entered (not that it takes a long time), and to figure out how to use the app. But now I can typically enter my meals and snacks in no time at all. So easy and super helpful for the LCHF eating plan I started in January. I've never been a fan of tracking meals, but this app makes it easy and actually kind of fun?!?!!

title: Definitely worth buying
body: I was very hesitant on buying this app and didn't like it at first but then I grew to love it!!

title: Great app could use improvements
body: I like how this makes tracking macros simple. However, I would like to see the barcode scanning portions to reflect what's on the actual package, it doesn't always add up for what I scanned.

title: Very promising for carb tracking
body: I have been using MM+ for about a week now and find it much more satisfying when tracking macros/carbs than any other app I've tried before. The searchable database could be improved, but I can live with it. The scan feature works best on my iPad compared to iPhone, but I can live with that too. I appreciate the ability to see meal as well as daily totals. Generally, there's room for improvement but it's more usable than any other I've tried!

title: Best Food Tracking Yet!
body: I love how simple this is to use and how easy it is for me to add the foods I eat with the barcode scanner! I hope they find a way to sync with Fitbit at some point so I can have all of my tracking information in one place and that it integrates more seamlessly with the workout app data and I could see how a meal or snack would contribute to meeting my goals for the rest of the day before having to add it! I think that last thing would definitely make it 5 stars.

title: Great app
body: It's a great app. I can track my macros efficiently. Very simple to use and understand as far as interface goes. Even go so far as to today options which if you like me on a ketogenic cycle you can choose your different days so your macros will change as you choose it. I recommended it to my girlfriend and likewise I would recommend it to other people as well if you're serious about physical fitness

title: Didn't like it at first, love it now!
body: I was a MFP user for a couple years. I tried the online version of MM and was hesitant to buy the mobile version. At first it was annoying to use because I tried adding foods like I did with MFP. Once I started using the Barcode Scanner to enter my food it got so much easier. Really user friendly and I love the weekly email summaries that show how I did that week. Definitely recommend it!

title: The best I've seen
body: I work with clients on changing their nutrition and their bodies. One of the main ways to do this is tracking all of their food intake. There's a variety of apps out there but I think this is one of the best, particularly if you're a serious athlete.

title: Macro tracker
body: This app is awesome. Keeps track of everything you eat, like a lazy man's food journal. It doesn't matter what your goals are, whether it's to lose weight, maintain weight, weekend warrior, or professional bodybuilder/model...you plug in the macros you want to achieve and it tracks them for you by the food you log, and it gives you the remainders you need to meet throughout the day as you eat. Works great with the Renaissance Diet.

title: Awesome app for diet goals
body: That does a really great job of keeping track of foods that you eat and your macronutrients goals.

title: Avatar Nutrition and MyMacros+
body: I hadn't heard of this app until Avatar Nutrition recommended it. I've used it literally every day for the past two weeks and love it. It's not as highly polished as some of the other food logging apps that have been around longer, but macros are my main concern and this app keeps them front-row-center and helps me make more informed and better dietary choices that fit my specific goals.

title: Not bad, but could use some improvement
body: Overall, a decent UI and easy to understand. However, one HUGE annoyance is when you pre-fill an item using the “recent” list. When you tweak the numbers for that one particular meal only (sometimes portions are larger or smaller), it goes back and changes them on EVERY SINGLE instance that specific item appears. This is EXTREMELY annoying.

title: Love it!
body: This app works perfectly for me. It is the first time I have tried the system of tracking macros, and I love being able to make my plan the night before or in the morning, so that when I'm deciding what I'm going to, or NOT going to eat, I can see where I'm at. I also find that this method really reduces my anxiety around food tracking because I'm tracking what's important, and focusing on that.

title: Amazing app!
body: Personally, I consider myself to be a rather avid and regular gym-goer/lifter, and when I began my individual fitness journey in 2013 I knew I would need something great to track my calories/macronutrients with that was more reliable than a notepad every single day. Since then, I've used this app literally every single day to add and log my daily nutrition and to keep track of my dietary progress (or sometimes lack thereof!). Great app!

title: Great but room to improve
body: I love this app. It pairs with Avatar Nutrition and provides a fairly comprehensive diet and weight management system.

title: I love this app!
body: I have tried quite a few apps to track my diet, and this one is my favorite. It's simple and does all the math that macro counting requires for me. I love being able to enter in my own recipes and have an accurate breakdown, and the food glossary is extensive. It's rare that I can't find what I'm looking for.

title: Amateur Bodybuilder - Great App!
body: I decided to try this app for my contest prep for my upcoming NPC shows. I've used it for the past 3 weeks and love it. My prep coach has me changing macros constantly for training days, non-training days, and refeed days. This app makes it easy to change meals from day to day as well as keep favorite meals and foods stored for easy access. I highly recommend if you're a competitor looking to track your daily macros!

title: Best food tracking app
body: I've used several macro tracking apps & this one is my far the best. It's user friendly, doesn't crash & accurate.

title: Could be a lot better
body: For how much you paid for this app, you think they would have updated it already. I like it because it's simple compared to other apps but there are a lot of things that is wrong with it. Camera is slow to read the barcode, not a lot food information in the database, and most importantly i noticed that some of data i already put in gets deleted so when i look back to see how i did for the week, it looks like I didn't hit my numbers. Fix it please.

title: Best macro tracking app
body: It might take a bit of getting used to if you're used to using MFP but it's leaps and bounds better. You don't have to pay to customize macros by grams (instead of percentage). You can set parameters for different days. Updating macros doesn't retroactively change past days. Most products can be auto converted to grams. Come out with a web API and it will basically take over the world of macro counting.

title: Amazing
body: Best app on the App Store for anyone who wants to

title: Great functionality--only one recommendation for improvement
body: Really enjoying this app. Great functionality and easy to use. My only recommendation for improvement would be to include the option to add notes for each day (for example, note the workout you did or how you felt consuming the foods you ate, etc.). It would enhance the ability to really drill down into nutrition day-by-day.

title: Good but could be great
body: My fitness pal is killing you guys with the food database the only reason I don't like them is the monthly or yearly or charge instead of a one time payment. If you could update your food database and instead of a default 1 OZ entry of everything make it the actual serving amount, if we could preview how something will effect macros before adding it that would be awesome and if we could add pictures to the weight log this app would be perfect !

title: Excellent, recommending it to everyone I know
body: Such a great app. Time consuming but well worth it, and much better than the other over priced monthly subscription calorie tracking apps out there. My only problem with it is that the barcode scanner often yields slightly incorrect or even totally off macro counts, and custom adding foods is a little clunky and slightly confusing. Overall amazing app. You're not eating how much (or how little) you think you are.

title: Best Tracking App Available
body: I utilize this app daily. I love the features that allow me to save recipes; copy and paste to the next meal or day; copy recipes from other users in 'My Circle'; the barcode scanner and it's quickness; the data charts for weight trends; the ability to save nutritional goals and apply it to days depending on training schedule; AND it's compatibility with Avatar Nutrition!  Keep up the great work - this app is awesome!

title: Great app! With a few minor touches it could be amazing!
body: I like the app. Was it worth the cost? Sure. I think there could be some things added to it to make it better than the rest. My fitness pal essentially does the same thing, just a little more of a messy interface than my macros. I think the food needs to be better verified and tracked. I, however will continue to use my macros.

title: Beyond Amazing
body: Just made the official switch over and am in love. It's so easy. No more pulling out my calculator to figure out fractions of a serving. This app makes life so easy. I am just stepping into an offseason that is looking to be a great one with this app! I am extremely precise when it comes to my macros and this app is even more precise than I am! If you are serious about tracking numbers this is the ONLY app for you! Awesome job Jason!

title: Great app
body: I'm about to move off to college and have been trying to find the best way to train/diet on the go. This application is going to help a lot and I love the fact that it's made for bodybuilders! My only hope for the future is to have a barcode scanner as well an option to add additional meals in case athletes needed go to eight meals a day etc. Overall, this is a great application and the ability to put in my specific macros makes it well worth the $2.99

title: best app for bodybuilders and powerlifters
body: I do bodybuilding and powerlifting, and this app has really helped me track everything when I'm dieting down. I used to write everything down, but this is much easier and the ability to save mealplans makes it way better than anything else I've tried. It takes a little while to get used to it, but after that it's a breeze

title: Good app, one fatal flaw
body: I love everything about this app besides one thing and that's the selection in the items to search.

title: just a couple of things to make this the best!
body: I've started using this app instead of mfp because I could enter exactly what I wanted percantage-wise. My only gripes are that I liked being able to use the barcode scanner when entering recipes (like in mfp), and just because I'm creating a recipe doesn't mean I wanted it added automatically.  The food database will increase over time, I'm sure, but I could also see why this would be a deterrent off the bat.

title: Good but...
body: It's a very nice app for counting. Although, I have found that I've made a lot of custom entries, more than I should. If I had written this review while using my iPhone  5, I would have given it 4 stars. Now, on iPhone 6 plus, and if I'm in the middle of input and lay my phone flat the entire screen compresses into a very narrow column, jumbling all info and I can't do anything. The only way to use app after that is to restart phone. Annoying as I have had to do this multiple times since buying app last week.

title: Brilliant app
body: This app has been a game changer for me. They say awareness is the first requirement for change and this app makes it so easy to track calories and macros that I've been able to lose 20 pounds. The  barcode scanner is brilliant. Just scan and all of the nutritional information is at your fingertips. With custom and favorite entries stored, I can track my intake in less than 5 minutes. Brilliant.

title: Awesome app
body: I've used a plethora of different food tracking apps, but this by far is the best. It offers everything I need very conveniently and the barcode scanner is the best part! Also, being able to see a nutrition profile and pie chart of you daily intake is a very simple and easy way to make sure I'm on track. Three bucks may be a little pricey, but I'm glad I took a chance on it.

title: GREAT app for macro tracking!
body: I love this app. It is worth the small cost all day long!

title: User friendly, huge database!!
body: I downloaded the app when I started calculating Macros, and it has been better than any of the poplar brands that I ever used to use.

title: I love it, Almost perfect!!
body: I love that this app allows me to track everything and create my own custom macros. There are just a few things I feel it's missing. I eat pretty much the same things everyday, so I would love to be able to copy the entire day rather than just a meal. Also, I wish there was a way to search within the food I've created/scanned. Other than that it's by far the best tracking app out there!

title: Great but small complaint!
body: Overall, this app helped a lot with my transition from Weight Watchers. The format is great! You can adjust macro goals by gram and save different ratios to easily switch between. My complaint is with the database, as it seems many foods taken from usda's database are measured in cups instead of by weight. This goes for pretty much any vegetable I've searched, so I've had to look up info by weight and add custom foods. Fix this issue and I'd say it's the best app I use.

title: Has almost everything
body: I love the barcode scanner and recipe functions. Very intuitive and easy to use. Overall, absolutely love this app, wouldn't leave it for any of the other options.

title: Makes keeping track a breeze!
body: I have previously kept track of macros in my notes app which was quite a pain to do manually. Not impossible, but definitely not as easy as it's been with this app. This app has been so handy and I have found it to be so useful and quick. Thank you for finally creating an app that makes this so easy!

title: Simple, robust tracking
body: I'm using this app to assist a ketogenic diet for narcolepsy, and it works beautifully. It is far less bloated and therefore easier to use than most other trackers, and the ability to define your macros and see them in real time on the pie chart is quite nice. This has been a great help in figuring out my carbohydrate and protein tolerance levels so as to maintain as much freedom as possible in my dietary choices.

title: Addicted!!
body: I love this app and share my love for it with all my clients and friends. I have been tracking my macros for about 1 year and this app makes it so fun and easy for me. I am a bikini competitor, crossfitter, personal trainer, marathon runner, IIFYMs dieter, and a try anything type of athlete! I love challenging myself and this app helps me do that. Thank you for creating this app, I will share my love for it across the globe, a true game changer for me!!

title: Easy macro counting
body: Does an amazing job at counting macros/ helping you reach your goal. Remember, this app is for counting macros, if you're looking for a nutrition log, to ensure you're taking in the correct vitamins and what not, this app will not help you much, because it is a macro counting app. If you don't know what macros are, either look them up or don't bother with this app because it'll just leave you confused.

title: Great tracking app!
body: MyMacros+ gets the job done in tracking my macros everyday. I especially appreciate the barcode scanner and ability to switch between viewing my remaining and total consumed macros. Entering in nutritional information is also very easy. The only improvement I would ask for is expansion of the food database. Otherwise, I am completely fine with manually entering foods that don't already exist.

title: Love it
body: I love this now that I'm familiar with it! I like that you can put your macros in down to the gram, unlike MFP. I just wish it had as big of a food database as MFP, but I'm going to stick with it though because I know it'll just get better! All of the foods I eat consistently that were not in the database are easy to input and now I rarely have to put my own foods in. Customer service is so nice and always willing to help and fix things ASAP!

title: User friendly and works well
body: I am an online trainer and have all my client using this app. It's easy to understand, save recipes easily and tracks macros per meal and for the day. It also doesn't make you add in exercise info which I hate. It's great if you don't eat out a ton. Only downfall is lack of restaurants item info but you should be making your own food anyway 😉

title: Brilliant Tool
body: This is exactly what I needed to fine tune my diet. I just won the novice heavy weight and novice overall at the WA Ironman Natural Bodybuilding competition and knew that I'd need to get more serious with regards to my nutrition if I wanted to compete in the open class next year. This is the app I was looking for. There's a small learning curve, however, once get the hang of things you won't regret the purchase.

title: It makes tracking easy!
body: This app is awesome! It makes tracking macros really easy. I rated it 4 stars because the database isn't quite as large as MyFitness Pal, but I use the two of them together to track my food. It always amazes me how many things I can scan that will come up. I wish some of the restaurant entries would read per serving instead of "grams". It would make things easier so I don't have to do as much research.

title: Dr.
body: This is without doubt, the easiest, most comprehensive and most flexible macro tracker available. The absolute easiness of entering in your diet by either using a database of known foods, entering custom foods or using an easy barcode scanner system is flawless. The graphic representations of The diet along with the flexibility to move and copy meals and create recipes is really innovative. This application rocks! Congratulations to the developer on a fantastic job.

title: Love it! Great and easy way to follow my micro, no more excel charts!!!
body: I love the fact that me and my wife can see each other progress, also friends that as me how I got to where I am!! It's easy now they can see what I eat every day!

title: BEST MACRO/CALORIE COUNTING APP OUT THERE
body: Seriously this app has changed my life... I have always tracked my nutrition with just a pen and paper (I didn't like the lay out and complexity of my fitness pal) and once I found this app everything changed for the better. Download it. It's not difficult to understand, everything is right there for you. Waiting to help you get on the best nutrition plan you've ever had.

title: 1 SUGGESTION TO THE DEVELOPERS
body: I love this app, I tell my friends and clients about it all the time!...but

title: Must Have!
body: I switched from MFP to this and haven't looked back. I am currently carb cycling and I love that it lets me store multiple different sets of macros, and then I just go under "day options" and select the one I need for that particular day! The barcode scanner is a lifesaver and makes tracking macros and planning meals a breeze. This app is a must have for anyone who tracks macros!

title: User friendly , great for personal and client tracking
body: This app is phenomenal! If your an iifym guru or fitness coach looking to track your clients this app is great ! Easy to navigate, plan ahead and enter new foods or even search for foods that are already in the system. The barcode scanner feature is great just requires verification of info as its sometimes wrong but easy to edit ! Bravo !

title: I like it!but I wish it had more restaurant food nutritional facts.
body: 1. It's easy to change your macros everyday with out having to pay more $$

title: Having to pay for app AND a separate subscription?
body: This app is really great. I use it frequently and it has a lot of awesome features. However, I find it kind of crappy that you not only have to pay $2.99 for the app, but now you also have to purchase a separate subscription to use certain features? That's not right. The app should be free then. Like I said, I like this app, but not enough to pour more money into it for only a few extra features.

title: Perfect for novice to advanced tracking
body: This is a great app. Its getting some low ratings because it doesn't have enough preloaded food choices, which is a good thing! You should be using the information on your food NOT a generalized average in a data base. I am very happy with the layout. Cuts my recording time done by a significant amount. Simple, easy and affective. Thank you

title: Changed my life!
body: This app has given me the freedom to satisfy my cravings and still maintain single digit body fat. Foods I denied myself for years are now all on the menu thanks to this app. My only criticism is it would be awesome if they made it possible to set water and micronutrient goals but other than that if your a competitor of just into health this app is by far the best out there!

title: Does exactly what I need
body: I've been using this app for a year and have had no problems with it. It does everything I need from scanning barcodes, to custom foods and meals, and even calculates what macros you need for your specific goals (ie I'm X height X weight and want to gain .5 lbs per week with this macro split). Definitely has been helpful on both bulks and cuts.

title: Incorrect database!
body: Every food I've searched for or scanned in has incorrect numbers. The calories and the macros are consistently incorrect. I've fact checked online or by using the nutritional information on the product. I had high hopes for this app since myfitnesspal is now charging monthly. Everything else about the app is good, but with incorrect information it's pretty much useless. You can edit the information to make it correct, but it's too time consuming. Don't spend your money on this app until they fix the database. I'm surprised that this app has such good reviews.

title: Great app, needs a little help though
body: I really like this app.  It's very user friendly and accurate.  One thing I would like to see is the option to barcode scan while putting in a recipe.  I made a recipe last night and I tried to put the recipe in MM+.  I gave up after being unable to find some stuff in the database.  Other than that, and the almighty limited database, this app rocks.  Much better than MFP.

title: Great App
body: I've tried to diet on one other occasion. Had limited success due to lack of ability and desire to track my intake of caloric, protein and fat consumption. This App makes ability and desire not only possible but fun. Great to look at my goals versus actual intake. Just to know where along that continuum I stand at any hour of the day is an incentive to keep up the effort.

title: Easy to use, great to track!
body: I am a huge fan of this app! The food database seems to be accurate and covers many many foods. The tracking is easy to use and I love the color coding of my macros goals. I have consistently used this app for a few months now and think it has positively impacted my health goals. High five to the developer for great work!

title: Great App for keeping diet in check
body: As a lifter who's always playing with my macros and making slight adjustments this app is absolutely perfect. Keeps regularly used foods easily available, barcode scanner works 9 out of 10 times. Adding new foods is super easy. It even allows you to apply different macro profiles for re-feed days, cutting, bulking, etc.

title: Pretty Good
body: Easy to use app for counting macros.  The format is pretty simple, but watch the nutritional information and servings.  I found I had to change the info on quite a few products.  I would like to see a comment section on each food, just to get more detailed.  I send my food journal to my trainer so she can see what I am eating and how much it affects my macros for the day.  This is a good tool for online food menus/training :)

title: Good way to track macros
body: This app is great. It has a lot of verified foods, but also allows you to customize for homemade foods. You can store favorites for quick search of the food you eat most often. It also provides a weekly summary to really show you how you are doing on a larger scale, rather than getting too lost in the day to day. Works great!

title: Best nutrition app ever made!
