body: This is the app to use if you are serious about nutrition. Everything you need to change your health is here. Not only can you track calories and macronutrients, you can now use the built in diet calculator calculate your ideal calorie intake based on your body and activity, plus you can set up custom macro ratios, perfect for setting up any diet.

title: DONT BUY unless you want to enter everything in manually
body: I purchased this with the hope that since it was designed by a fitness professional the nutritional information would be better than that found in other apps. I was therefore greatly disappointed when the app failed to recognize four out of the five items I had for breakfast. I don’t eat anything special; yogurt and berries with some flax seeds and almond milk. I purchased this app because I have little time to enter these items individually. Save your money, just use My Fitness Pal or other similar apps.

title: Keeps me going
body: This app is super helpful. If you get a food scale and do a little bit of playing around to get the serving sizes right, this app makes meal planning a breeze. -1 star: Wish it was connected to more online data bases with more food options, but that's just me being lazy.

title: This app is perfect for my tracking needs!
body: It does everything I want.

title: Super Great App
body: Very user friendly, the recipe option is an awesome feature to determine the macro amounts for a homemade prepared food. I also like the scanner option, it saves on data entry time. Finding foods you already entered is super easy with the "Recent" or "Custom .." tab.  I was looking for an app. to track my Ketosis meal plans, I was not impressed with the Keto apps., I'm very happy with this app.

title: Love it!
body: This app is so accurate! I used Myfitnesspal for years and was always fixing the numbers to make sure the calories came out correctly. With this app it does the work for me! It takes some time to re-enter everything again but I use MFP for the numbers to plug in and will be using this to track from now on.

title: Great for bodybuilders
body: Have used this app for multiple years, and is very efficient for cutting and bulking cycles.  I like that I can use the barcode scanner for quick look-up of nutrient info.  Great that I can see break-down of macronutrients as well and track calories to meet goals.  5/5 in terms of software interface and ease of use.

title: Making life easier
body: Having to use this app for two weeks now has made my life so much easier. No more manually calculating and guessing. Tells you how much macros you consumed and how much you have left. Almost any food you can think of, this app has nutrition info for it.  Highly recommended for the fitness enthusiast.

title: Great app
body: I love the app, its simple to use once you get the hang off it , i only gave four stars because i wish i had the option to make categories were i can store different foods because I don't like scrolling through the whole list to find something, but other than that ,it's a great app to track your macros

title: I like but have suggestions
body: Overall a great app! But few things could make it easier.

title: So, so good.
body: Hands down the best dieting app for the iOS platform. You need a little know-how in order to understand tracking calories, but otherwise quite intuitive, and you can build your own base of foods to use. I hope that the developer continues to build on this app, and that people understand how good it really is. I'm spreading the word!

title: Great app and awesome help!
body: The database may not have all the food you are looking for but by inputting your own foods then you are 100% sure you are getting the right macros! Also, If you get stuck with any of the details within the app just email Jason (the CEO& developer) and you can get your problem solved quickly. He is very helpful!!

title: Best for counting macros
body: This app is hands down the best app for counting macros. Unlike other apps, this one lets you see the macros of each food as you're adjusting it. Like if you have 50g of protein left in your meal and go to say a chicken breast, as you're toggling the amount, it shows you the macros at each weight. Then shows the macros/cals on the main screen

title: Good Product for flexible dieters
body: I think it's easier to work with than MFP. I love that once you input an item, it changes the serving size to 1 so you can customize it. Cons: I wish you could copy meals from other people, rearrange day on the main interface, and be able to check off meals you've already consumed. Overall great product that makes tracking easy.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS APP!!!!
body: I cannot believe this app has 4 and a half stars. I don't even know where to begin. First of all, the food database is absolutely horrific; it is missing some of the most common brand name foods and furthermore, 95% of the foods have either the wrong name, brand, or both. The worst part is, the nutritional information on the food that is in the database is all over the place. As if that wasn't bad enough, the interface is absolutely horrible and has no organization anywhere in the app. This app is seriously a scam and I can't believe I really spent 3 bucks on it.

title: Missing something!!!
body: I wish there was a way to add notes to each day. Some people are using it just to lose weight (and there is a way to track that) BUT what about those of us using it for performance? There should be a way I can track how I felt, how I performed, how I slept, etc on each day so I can compare fuels/foods. Please add a feature like this and THEN I can give it 5 stars :)

title: 4/5 STARS--
body: This app is really good for the price! It does the majority of what you need to track your intake of macros.

title: Love it!
body: I am really enjoying this app! I've been and a MFP junky for years, but recently they changed to a paying membership and I lost the ability to change my macros..and I wasn't paying for a yearly membership. What I love most about My Macros + is that I can customize and change my macro goals daily depending on my training. Love, love this! My husband is now on board with tracking thanks to this app!

title: Best/easiest macro counter! Must have!
body: What an amazing app! Makes tracking your macros so so simple. My favorite part is you could add your foods and and repeat meals, so if you eat the same thing often you don't have to enter it every time. If you are new to counting macros or and expert this app is for you!! Everyone can use this and stay on track! LOVE IT (:

title: Great!
body: I'm lazy in general, but this app is easy enough to use that I'm doing it consistently. I do wish that my recipes showed up on my daily log as the recipe name, rather than the ingredients, but that's a pretty minor quibble. And it's a little frustrating that there are five thousand of the exact same food in the list. People, why do we each have to add "egg" to the database? It's already in there! A thousand times!

title: Finally!
body: I have been weightlifting for 10 years and just started running marathons.   My third one is in two weeks!  Keeping track of my diet is really important and this app has it all! Easy to use.  A lot simpler than those other ones. Completely without a doubt well worth the money!

title: Should add some more features
body: Great at helping track what I am eating throughout the day. BUT would be 4 stars if it could help me calculate my needed macros. Instead I use a site online. I would give a 5 Star rating if it had the search ability of MyFitnessPal which I still use to get much of my food's nutritious fats which I then input into this app. Does a good job remembering my foods but for the price should add some features like MyFitnessPal, such as saving meals.

title: Good App - Food Info Needs Work
body: Overall a great app for keeping track of your macros. I'd give it 5 stars if I didn't have to use the custom input so much due to food info/serving information being off. I find the serving sizes to be the biggest problem. The sizes range from grams, to ounces, to servings, to cups, to entire meals. It's hard to know what someone else was thinking when they input the info.

title: Has potential
body: This app has potential, however there are better apps out there to track your macros. There are very limited food options and units of measurement to chose from. I tried to input a single days worth of meals and couldn't due to the lack of options to chose from. I will go back to my old tracker until this is more user friendly. The biggest plus for this is the initial user interface, it's pleasant to look at and easy enough to navigate.

title: Okay
body: The app overall is ok. I would not recommend. The food search really needs to be upgraded. A lot of healthy store bought foods cannot be found, yet you have an abundance of fast food from restaurants. The barcode scanner is horrible. If I am not under bright light it will not work. Upgrade this to turn on the phones flashlight to get a better read. There are basic and free apps that have this function.

title: Great for variable macros!
body: I love that setting custom macros is so easy and so is changing which macro set you are using for the day.

title: Best food tracking app for ADF + IIFYM!
body: I used MFP for years but when I was introduced to Intermittent/Alternate day fasting and IIFYM, MFP was completely useless. Plus it automatically changed my calories remaining because it syncs with my phone and other apps. With MyMacros+ I can change each day to set a different macros combo. It's perfect for carb cyclers, ADFers or just regular IIFYM followers. So happy I found this app!

title: User Friendly and Simple
body: Really easy to use interface and quick searches usually pull up what you need to list. I use the barcode scanner most times, and although it can be slow to grab the barcode, it works really well. This is def helping me track my diet and helping me stick to Keto.

title: Great for counting macros!
body: I have just recently started counting my macros & this app has made my life so much easier. Some of the food already listed aren't 100% accurate so you have to look & check the macros, or add your own food with macros. But once you find the foods you want & store them as your favorites, it is so easy! Love it.

title: Aesthically bland, but functions well.
body: The app works well. It does what it needs to do. But the main screen is very bland. It reminds me of Windows XP. They definitely need to bump up the app in that sense. Look at any template for an app, and it has more aesthetic than this one, and the way the app flows just makes sense, unlike this one. In terms of functionality, it works great. I mainly just want a bump up for the looks.

title: Making my life so much easier!!
body: This is essential for any bodybuilder/fitness competitor. Trying to keep meticulous records of your Marcos is a must, but can be so tedious at times. This makes it a breeze   I'm so thankful for this app! You can tell it was developed by someone who knows what it takes to take your physique to the next level. Thank you!!

title: Not enough options
body: I LOVE this app....BUT, every food I scan, the app does not recognize. I just bought it today and I had to enter 5 of my food manually. This is inconvenient and myfitnesspal does not have this problem. I'm hoping within the next couple weeks, a substantial amount of products will be added or I will have to go back to my other app.

title: Great app!
body: I left myfitnesspal after they changed over to a new super McSpecial "premium" plan that seriously screwed over the user. I am SO happy this app exists. I didn't think I would find a good macro tracker, but here it is! In fact, I'd say it's downright amazing so far! Very easy to use, intuitive and very well made. Definitely recommend this!

title: Best food tracker ever.
body: This app is amazing. It's way better than MFP in all ways. Tracking your macros is super freaking easy. You can add custom foods in seconds and it remembers them for you. Everything is great about this app. I'm cutting for a bodybuilding show and this is THE ultimate food tracking app for lifters, body builders, or just people trying to get fit

title: Awesome!!
body: This app is so awesome. Definitely helping me keep track of what I eat, except for cinnamon rolls. Those are sacred. But seriously, if you have trouble making sure you're getting enough to eat or eating too much this is so worth the couple bucks. It stores your frequented meals and you don't have to convert to grams! Best app I've come across!

title: Great app
body: This app is really helpful, I like how you can add all of the ingredients of a recipe and it will calculate the macros per serving. I only wish it would put the recipe title in your meal log instead of every part of it. Other than that minor detail, it is a great app and I have already recommended it to many friends who are now using it!

title: Simple and enlightening
body: I got this app to help myself learn what tracking my macros even meant, and what I got was probably one of the most user friendly diet tracking apps on the App Store. There's literally nothing I haven't been able to accurately record through barcode scanning or manually punching in ingredients and serving sizes. I love it

title: Great app
body: This an awesome app to track your macros!!! i really love it! every sunday i get a tofal of days tracks favorite food and if i meet my goals i love that! i like that it has a scanner to scan food items, i like that i can customize foods i am really happy with this app it hs helped me reach fat loss goals. Better than any other app out there!!

title: Incredible
body: I don't usually ever do reviews, but this app deserves it. It goes above and beyond to make keeping track of food easier and I love the fact that it has food from pretty much anywhere I go. I thought tracking macros would be much more of a chore, but this is better than I could've hoped.

title: Want to love it but
body: I will when the following are fixed:

title: Amazing App
body: Best calorie tracking app I have ever used. Easy to access and very user-friendly. Creating a food takes seconds unlike some other programs and adding/editing foods has never been easier. I prefer this over any big name online app, hands down. You really can't go wrong with My Macros +

title: Perfect
body: Awesome app for tracking macros. The food database is lacking, but I generally just look at my nutrition labels to figure the total macros for each meal, and the easiest thing for me is to use the "fast track" option to just combine each of my meals' macros into one food item that is stored in the specific meal on the app. Great app, easy to use.

title: Full I potential...
body: This app has some amazing qualities, however, the only thing it is lacking in is an accurate barcode scanner. It rarely works for mine which makes me have to research health facts on certain foods and then add it manually. Eventually I got so frustrated with it that I switched over to MyFitnessPal which has a very reliable bar scanner. Personally, I would prefer this app over my MFP if that issue were fixed

title: Love it!
body: I love that I can customize goals, especially when carb cycling. It is so easy to pick that day's macro goal and go! The barcode scanner is great and the database is constantly expanding. Once you get used to navigating the app, it is so easy. So much better than mfp, the only thing I wish it had was a way to track water.

title: Nearly perfect!
body: -tens of thousands of macros of common and specialized foods of both of basic and commercially made foods

title: So far so Excellent!
body: This app does exactly what I need it to do.. Not only that, it breaks down each item. Using this app, actually forced me to give up Mayo while I'm trying to reach my fitness goals. I would like to give another review in about 2weeks to complete my over all thought of this app. Get it and get to work!

title: Better than FitnessPal
body: The functionality, tracking, feedback and price trumps myfitnesspal and every other macros tracker that I have tried IMO. The food item search is not quite as comprehensive as MFP but it is getting better. Personally, I enter all of my food items instead of using search.

title: Great Macro Nutrient Tracking App
body: This app is amazing and the price is perfect. I prefer this app to the other fitness apps because all I really need to track on my phone are my macronutrients intake. Working out programs are easy to remember just using your memory but I can't say the same about monitoring my diet. Huge props to Jason for creating this!

title: Best app for this purpose
body: Just my opinion. Have tried other macro trackers but this one includes a scanner making entry easy. And the weekly email summaries are very helpful for a birds eye view. I have recommended it to others who have voiced the same opinion to me. Get it if you're serious about your fitness.

title: Very Accurate
body: Love this app! Tracks macros down to the decimal. It takes a bit to get started as the database seems to be smaller than other apps I've tried, but a little patience on the front end lead me to extremely accurate tracking on the back end. As a self-prepping competitor, I'm very thankful that this app exists. Start recognizing Aldi barcodes and I'll increase to 5 stars!

title: Best diet tracking app available!
body: Wow this app has everything you can ever think of when wanting to track your calories.  Tons of features and everything is really fast and easy.  If your serious about tracking calories then this will be the best $2.99 you've ever spent.

title: Good App
body: The app is great for tracking, the only bad part is the food library is very minimal and full of mostly fast food. Almost every food item I use was added into the app by me. I tend to eat mostly the same things so I don't have to constantly add new food to the library. Also really good for creating food entries with net carbs. Love that you can create your own macro goals.

title: Easy to Use
body: This app is great for anyone trying to keep track of their daily caloric intake. It's especially helpful when trying to hit your precise macros. It allows you to see the percentage of each macro you're taking in.. Which is key for being in the most control of your body content.

title: Great macro tracking app
body: This is the best macro tracking app that I've tried. It is far superior to MFP in that you can set up multiple daily goals for your macros and the focus is on your macros rather than the calories or other data. The food database seems accurate and the barcode scanner works well.

title: The Best. Period.
body: I began using MM+ about 3 months into bodybuilding. I had been using MyFitnessPal for the previous months and had no problems with it, until i downloaded MM+. The ease of adding foods and serving sizes is incredibly different. I could never go back. I use this app every day for my diet and have absolutely zero complaints. Great app.

title: Love this app!
body: I love this app! It takes a little getting used to of course, but once you get the hang of it, you will love it. Having managed macros via an extensive spread sheet for far too long often founding errors that I some how overlooked, this app just makes living your macros and fitness goals so much easier!!

title: Needs Improvement
body: Love the app! But a few things could change.  First there have been many crashes for me and my fiancé on iPhone 6S, the barcode scanner will sometimes work to only have the item disappear from your day completely. Followers is an oddity as well as it doesn't seem to work half the time.  If these could be fixed then this app would well be worth the $3.  Thanks!

title: Happy
body: I am very happy about this app. I have been using it a little over 2 months and when I started it was working...then I got to overestimating by guessing macros for different foods are not tracking everything, but I got back on track. If you follow your set macros, you will achieve your goal.

title: Excellent
body: Easy to use and very helpful in tracking my eating habits. Only issue is a slight difficulty in finding some "normal" foods in search (but there is LOTS of premade and restaurant data which is more important) but those are best to enter yourself anyways really. Haven't used mfp so I can't compare but I'm a big fan of mymacros.

title: Disappointed
body: I liked the app at first, but its a disappointment.  It won't allow me to backup my data, it says to check my network connection (which is fine) or to email customer support. It also will not allow me to update or edit my profile.  I emailed customer support and they asked me to send screenshots.  I've since sent two follow up emails and have been blown off both times.  Additionally, the barcode scanner is unreliable...I want a refund.

title: What Fitness-Conscious People Everywhere Have Been Waiting For
body: This app is amazing. Whether for cutting or for bulking for just maintaining weight, this app is next to perfect for easily keeping track of macros. So much for fast and easier than keeping it down on paper. I say don't waste your time looking for any other app and just buy this one. You won't regret doing it.

title: My macros
body: This app is a must have for avid food trackers. So much better than my fitness pal. Easy navigation allows for quick entry. Great layout. Best part about the app is creating your own nutritional goals and being able to toggle between them, if you have a high/low carb day etc. Buy this app!!

title: Outstanding!!!!
body: This app is just above and beyond expectations! You really can't ask for anything better than this app to track macros super easy to work and super easy to understand I would not hesitate to buy this app if you're seriously wanting to gain weight or lose weight in a healthy way

title: Convenience!
body: This app is awesome because you can adjust daily macronutrient intake, edit foods and caloric information which makes precision tracking so much easier! I love it because it has helped me tremendously during my first contest prep for my first men's physique show! Highly recommend, and worth the few dollars. 👍🏻

title: The best in macro tracking
body: While the database isn't as extensive as what you'd find with myfitnesspal, it's the best and simplest app out there for tracking macros.  I am a competitive natural bodybuilder, and it's hands down down my favorite.  Any limitations you might find with the database are mitigated by your ability to input a custom food

title: Great app!
body: As a former myfitnesspal user, this is a nice change. Once I got all my foods in (still a work in progress), it's been a piece of cake. I like this much better than myfitnesspal. I like having the ability to change my macros whenever I want and I love that it uses the proper calories on items based on macros.

title: Calculation error
body: I love it app, use it when I'm cutting in prep for a competition and when calculating meal plans for clients.

title: Great App, Need Website Access
body: This is a fantastic app. I have been using it for the past few years and I love how it gives the macro breakdown of each meal at the bottom. Only downside is I might have to switch so my coach can see my food log as you cannot access MM+ online that syncs with the app. If that happened this app would be perfect for my needs!

title: Not worth it
body: I was disappointed in this app for two reasons. First, it doesn't track activity. Even after I bought an activity tracker of the same company, I was unable to synchronize them and ended up calculating the total calorie intake myself. Second, the main page shows how many carbs, proteins, and fats were in one dish, but not calories. Why?! Used this app for one day, will delete it and look for another app. Wish I could get my money back.

title: Best nutrition app out there
body: Love that it's not a calorie counting based app. The library of foods is getting more and more in it so you do not have to add in as much. Also love the serving sizes are mostly in what I measure all my foods out in. I credit the app for getting me to where I am in my physique and my progress in the sport of bodybuilding!

title: Impressed so far!
body: I started to make an Excel spreadsheet because I thought it would be the easiest to track my Macros and, well, I gave up quick when I read about this on the IIFYM website.  This is an awesome app!  I’ve used other tracking apps, like Lose It & MFP, but this is way better!  Great price too!

title: Really good
body: This is a really great app to help you keep track of macros and calories. The only thing I don't care for is that sometimes when you enter a custom food and all the macros it changes what you put in or if you scan a food it changes the serving size from the package to half

title: Great tool
body: I prefer this over MFP. I think seeing everything on one screen is great. I love that you can choose exact macros instead of percentages and keep different goals/ profiles and switch them up depending on the day. My one hope is for it to have a web interface. It would be amazing to be able to log online as well.

title: Amazing app OUTSTANDING customer service
body: Amazing app for tracking macros!!! I've used half a dozen and this one trumps them all.  Customer service is top notch as well.  I've sent several emails asking newbie questions and always get a prompt response.  Updates have been very useful as well.  Best nutrition app hands down!

title: Straightforward and easy to use
body: I have used this app for the past 9 months and it's helped me to lose 50 pounds! The food database isn't perfect but it's quick to add custom foods easily and it's easy to google for anything that doesn't initially pull up in the results. Good UI, reliable and rewarding to use.

title: Beat macro tracker
body: I love this app! I can honestly say, it's the best macro tracker I've used to date. It's easy to use, very intuitive. The fact that you can set multiple macro goals makes it very easy to cycle carbs or do a re-feed. I really like the ability to save and/or copy part or the entire meal, thats a real time saver.

title: User Friendly
body: Great app, easy to use. However, every time I make an update to the nutrition information to a certain item, that item gets deleted from every day's log that it was in. Agree with some users that more nutrition info on restaurants would be nice!

title: Food search is ridiculous.
body: I've been using this app for a couple years or so. The food database may contain millions of items, but deep inconsistent hole. Example... today I spent the better part of ten minutes trying to bring up cheese, or cheddar cheese... I tried brands, mild vs sharp, etc. nothing. I know it's in there, but search needs a lot more refinement. Cream cheese brings up a result.

title: Fantastic!
body: I LOVE this app and use it to track everything about my diet. It's very simple to use but has some more hidden, advanced features that make it pretty powerful (I love the recipes feature, where you can combine multiple foods into one. I use this for my morning smoothies and it rocks!)

title: The best!!!
body: By far THE BEST app for people that are serious. Great layout, I wish they had a better food library but it takes me a second to load something in anyways so whatever. I love how I can enter my macros and a computer the calories automatically. It was right to the tea to my calculations! Great app!!!!!

title: Great app, very useful.
body: Great app, very useful. Couple of issues I'd like to see fixed though. App crashes frequently and the barcode scanner is basically useless, foods are never found when scanned or they're very inaccurate when they are found. Overall, great app though, especially if you're creating and entering all foods manually.

title: So Thorough!
body: I just downloaded this and at first glance it looks awesome!  As a figure competitor, I am always in search of the best nutrition logging app that has exactly what I need and offers ease-of-use and total customization. This seems to do the trick and is more "competitior-friendly" than My Fitness Pal, which is what I have been using.

title: Good buy
body: This was exactly what I wanted. It gives you total control over your daily macro intake on the go. You can even see pie charts for your calorie distribution breakdown from day to day to see how consistent you are being. It's easy to input your custom and favorite meals and save them for later, as well as copying meals from a previous day into a new day. Love this app!

title: Not worth it.
body: I bought this app figuring it would be better than Myfitnesspal. It's not. It's more confusing. It is not user friendly at all. The food database is too small and has recalculated all foods up to a base of 1. Not one serving, but one cup, one ounce, etc. So when I went to enter my cereal at its 2 servings, I had to redo the math to figure out what 2 servings equated to according to this app.

title: Almost perfect
body: Definitely worth the purchase. I switched from MFP a while back. It's great for cycling days. I wish, how ever, fiber showed up in the meal bar like protein, carbs and fat. And most importantly, I wished the recipes would not break into ingredients in your meal. If I log my food the night before, I always have to go back, delete and renter bc I have forgotten how much of the recipe I entered.

title: Calculates your macros!
body: Love how this app calculates your macros and allows you to save more than one option especially for those that like to carb cycle or low carb days for rest days. My only wish is a larger food database with the option to scroll to the unit of measurement within the selected food.

title: An app for the ages!
body: I love the app. What brought me to it is the ability to create goals SPECIFICALLY BASED ON MACROS! This is huge for me. Then I get in and see I can make different daily goals?! Heck ya!

title: Don't Buy Just Yet
body: It has some good starting points but not enough to buy yet. First, when scanning food from a barcode it does not allow you to enter correct info when it's wrong and it's set to 1 gram as a serving for all products. Secondly, why do I have to sign up for your free account when I just paid for the app and your global database of food. NOT COOL.

title: Better than MyFitnessPal
body: I like the fact that you can use precise measurements! It also keeps track of you're weight. Overall easily the best 3 bucks I've spent! One thing I would recommend is allowing users to upload progress pictures like MyFitnessPal.

title: Couldn't be happier
body: I've been using this app almost for a year, and it has been insanely helpful. Unlike my fitness pal, it doesn't have those constant annoying advertisements, that are ALWAYS getting in the way. I myself am a personal trainer, and I recommend this to all my clients.

title: Awesome app
body: This app is the best $2.99 I've spent in a long time. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was I've had issues adding a saved meal from time to time (just refuses to add to the meal # I've selected or to anywhere on my days macros).

title: Buy this app!
body: Wow wow wow! Everything I have ever wanted in a calorie counting app. I am a person who wants everything organized and am a visual learner. This app does all of my macro counting down to a science. Easy to add custom foods, way more choices and features than my plate's live strong app. Buy it. Totally with it. The designer did a fantastic job!

title: awesome app!
body: love this app WAY more then an other tracking app. Easy to use and once you save your food in it its so quick to add food and track! you can also change your weekly goals and update it as you go along n not hard to find or update that info! best macro app ever!

title: Way better than MFP
body: I was apprehensive at first to pay $3 for this app. I was immediately well pleased. Yes I spent my first week plugging in my usual foods but after that it has been smooth sailing. It's just what I need for my macros tracking and no extra unecessary garbage. I have had about 5+ friends purchase this.

title: Love it!
body: I have used my fitness pal for tracking food and find this just as easy to use but easier to see macros!  One suggestion would be when creating a recipe to be able to use the scan function.  Other than that, I love it!

title: Not easy to use
body: Annoying pop up to sync data when there is no other device to sync to.

title: Best app!
body: Hands down best app out there! If you're a flexible dieter then this app is what you need! Very easy to use while tracking your intake and can customize it to your needs. The best part is the service in case you have questions or suggestions! You won't be disappointed!

title: Don't waste your time or money
body: Use a free site to determine your macros needs and use MyFitnessPal. This app is so annoying and clunky to use. You're constantly have to change the amount of food because it defaults to 1 gram or 1 Cubans it's hard to make changes to that unlike MyFitnessPal (which also tells you your macros in the free version). I really don't see any benefit at all in using this app. It also doesn't have the amount of foods MyFitnessPal has. I've never had to search so much!! What a huge waste of time.

title: Perfect.
body: Love this app. Well worth 2.99. And I hate spending money on apps. Super easy to add foods and I love the clean, uncluttered look. Only negative I noticed is when you scan your food the info can be really off but it's not a big deal since they made it so easy to enter the info manually. 5 stars. 😊

title: Love this app
body: I would be lost without this app. I especially love the analysis feature which helps me track my averages to ensure consistency. This keeps me sane on days when I've eaten too much. Being able to see that my averages over time are still on track is all that matters.

title: Outstanding
body: Not the best database of foods but you can put them in little by little.  But once they are in, the app is a dream for the serious athlete that wants to track macros. Just we'll thought out and works better than anything else I have tested. Next closest thing seems to be Daily Burn

title: Great Macro tracking app!
body: I'm not sure what the others were talking about regarding the barcode scanner and other features malfunctioning in this app. I haven't had one problem yet.

title: Just what I wanted!
body: I was waiting for this! It is great! Yes it takes a little getting used to after using other online food diaries, but this is great and I expect will just get better. I have three different macro goals depending on my activity level, so this is a godsend! Thanks for making it.

title: Best macros app period
body: This is seriously the best and easiest way I've found for tracking macros. Don't be that person who turns away a app since it's not free, this app seriously has put effort into being the easiest and most comprehensive app available for tacking macros, you won't regret it 👍🏼

title: I wanted to love it
body: I really wanted to love this app but no matter what I do, it assigns me 1300 calories per day which is nowhere near enough. While I realize I am not counting calories here, the macros are based upon that max calorie amount and it always then looks like I am going over my allowed macros. I do like how you it shows you your food and remaining macros and the barcode scanner but without being able to set the calories my macros are based on, it is not useful for me.

title: Love this app!
body: I had a different app previously, but it crashed multiple times and lost all my info. I have since used the my macros app and I have no complaints. I love the weight tracking, the ease of adding my own foods, and that I can add friends who are also on the app for support!

title: Very immaculate nut. Info
body: Just night the app. And EXTREMELY disappointed so far. Not a single item that the barcode scanner has scanned as accurate information! The name and brands of the food work. But calories, protein, carbs, sodium, everything is off. It was saying my turkey meat had 2 grams less protein, 30 fewer calories, and 1 carb less than actual packaging states. Very upsetting for someone trying to really make lifestyle change and can't even trust the app for accurate numbers. I hope this is fixed very soon.

title: Good
body: Was a little buggy initially but seems to work fine with new ios10.  Cumbersome for finding the raw foods, tons of duplicate entries are frustrating when searching...it would be really cool if you could scan QR codes on the packaged products and have the info populate.  Overall it has helped me a ton over tracking and tallying by hand.

title: Overall a great app
body: This app is helpful to track your daily and weekly macros. It lets you customize the macros you want to take in, or you can use preset options. Searching for food can get a little frustrating at times, but the variety in the database is very good, as well as the barcode scanner option.

title: Pretty good
body: I like the way it tracks macros and allows me to put in specific numbers, the paid analysis looks cool too but I haven't tried it. My only issue is the food database is terrible. I have to keep going on another app to get food info to put in. Other than that I love it

title: Best App for Food / Macro Tracking
body: I've used my share of food / weight / macro tracking apps over the years. Finally this is the one I've been waiting for.  Been using daily for a week now, and I'm still finding cool features to use. Can't recommend it enough.

title: Great app!
body: Easy to use and very flexible to adapt to individual needs. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because the food database still has lots of room to grow. One can still create foods that aren't listed in database. Would be wonderful if linked to an online website that would allow entries across all my devices!

title: Fluids
body: Great app with a large a large data base and the ability to change values and enter customized meals and foods.  Wonderful to use and allows the ability to email your end of the day totals to your trainer or coach.  My only wish for the future is for it to track end of the day fluid intake.

title: GREAT APP FOR TRACKING
body: have been using myfitnesspal for years. But FINALLY discovered this app! Love it! Takes some getting use to. But I love how you input your macros and it counts down how many you have left for the day. You can make recipes,custom foods,add in calories fast. It's overall just a more fun,better laid out app.

title: Great app!
body: Once I decided to track my macros, I realized MyFitnessPal's focus on calories was just going to get in the way. THIS app is one of the few I've seen that actually focuses on the macronutrient goals, and it's faster and far less crash-prone than MFP. My Macros+ isn't quite perfect, but the author is responsive and I find it indispensable for planning meals that meet my goals.

title: excellent tracking app
body: Spent a lot of years tracking and trying out the standard tracking apps—MM+ is without a doubt my favorite. Its built-in food database is not great, but I prefer using custom entries, and the Fast Track feature more than makes up for the database. Thanks for a great app!

title: Highly recommended
body: This app is by far the easiest macro tracking app. Worth every penny. Easily allows you to scan, search, or customize your foods. Also allows to put in exact amounts. Easy to copy meals from day to day as well. If you're overlooking this app you're crazy.

title: Still love it almost two years later
body: My Macros+ has gone through a lot of changes in the past two years and it keeps getting better. I love the barcode scanner and the ability to save entire meals.

title: Very Practical
body: Works as advertised. Good, quality, practical recording and manipulation of useful data. 4 of 5 because the learning curve is shallow, and until you are entering frequent foods, searching foods is slow, tedious, and somewhat frustrating. Hang in there! After you learn to use frequent, repeating entries, the app becomes second to none.

title: Fast track doesn't work on watch
body: I've had this app before and it was great. I wanted to try it on my watch and not only do you need the app to be running o  your phone but the fast track does absolutely nothing after you select the type of food " breakfast, snack, post workout, etc." no information is uploaded therefore this is useless on my watch. Disappointing because I do like the app but sometimes don't have time to sit around and add an entire nutritional menu on my phone.

title: Great app!
body: Finally an app for those of us who know what a macro is!  Very easy to use, and I love the fact that it calculates everything in terms of 1 unit for you - that was my biggest gripe with My Fitness Pal. If the developers could add a scanner and/or a website, other trackers wouldn't stand a chance.

title: Awesome app
body: Really easy to use!  Love to set my goals and keep track of what my body needs.  Lost 30 lbs before my macros and have lost 50 more on top of that after.  Helped me be more disciplined with meals and realize the difference between what my body needs and what my mid wants!  Awesome app!

title: Worst database
body: I was really excited when I downloaded this app because I was able to have custom macros set up unlike myfitnesspal. Once I started scanning and searching for the foods I ate I couldn't find any and the ones that I did find were incorrect. I would love to see this app have a larger database of foods. Manually entering all my foods is too much work even though I eat a lot of the same stuff. I don't want to spend all my time doing this.

title: Great app!
body: This app is awesome, much better than myfitnesspal. Only problem I have is that it closes by it self when creating a custom food and I scroll down to pick which category it is. Now all my custom foods are under "cereal" lol. No biggie, this app still accomplishes what it's set out to do. 5 stars.

title: Not as good as MyFitnessPal
body: Started counting my macros with MyFitnessPal. Worked great because it had any food imagined at a 1 oz measurable. Although on MFP you couldn't select an exact macro goal you still could keep track by looking at our goal detains. On this app the first foods I looked for for meal 1 didn't even find anything. 1 oz of grilled steak brings up different steak servings from various restaurants. Same for over easy egg or anything I searched for. This app isn't worth the money. I'll stick to using MyFitnessPal. Don't waste your money.

title: Best Tracker Out There
body: Easy to understand and simple to use.

title: Love it!
body: I just kicked off a new training program, and the nutrition principles focus macros & micros (sugar, fiber, sodium) for 3 phases. MyMacros+ allows me to easily plan & log my macros, and monitor my micros as well.

title: Awesome app
body: This was obviously designed by someone that has gone thru the trouble of dealing with macros. I'm not sure why everyone doesn't own this by now... This app is amazing. Works nice, not buggy, has many useful features. I'm telling all my friends, because this is a real time saver. Awesome++

title: Disappointed within 10 minutes.
body: App can't add. Inputted all food that I already had eaten for the day (from my fitness pal) and couldn't figure out why the numbers weren't matching. Checked macros in the respective categories (breakfast, lunch etc) and everything added up correctly, however at the bottom (totals) my carbs were lacking 20g. No explanation as of 'why' when everything else matches. Disappointed that I paid for an app that can't add correctly. Heed this warning: check your math!

title: Macros on point
body: So far this app has done exactly what I'd hoped it would do. Now that I can see exactly what I'm eating, I have more energy and I'm noticing a tighter and leaner physique. The search function is a little overwhelming so I use the barcode scanner and manually enter my foods. There was no way I was paying monthly for mfp just to track my macros. Thanks devs

title: Where has this been all my life!
body: By far the best macro counting app. Showing how many grams have been used and are left is the handiest feature. The only reason I didn't give the full 5 stars is because I have to input a lot of foods into the system. Not a big deal, but it does take a little extra time.

title: The best for the price
body: I tried many other apps and this was the only one that easily let me set goals per day (train/rest) and for cheap. Searching could work better but it's still better than the rest. Don't blow 50 bucks a year elsewhere.

title: Favorite nutrition app
body: This is by far my favorite nutrition tracking app. I use it every day to track my macros and make sure that I am on point. The developers were very quick to respond to comments/feedback and updates are promptly made. Keep it up!

title: Amazing!!!!
body: I usually don't write reviews but I had to for this app. It is simply amazing how user-friendly the interface is. Very easy to track your calories and macros. It has helped me lose 7 pounds and gain 3 lbs of muscle in a little over a month! Very worth it, very very very worth it.

title: MFP Still Wins 😕
body: I was so excited when I found this app because I didn't want to pay the fee on MFP. I was really disappointed in the fact that the app won't automatically parse a recipe from a website like MFP. I cook a lot from websites and it is such a time saving tool, especially when you are a busy mom. I also would say MFP has a better food database, but I guess that comes with time.

title: Love it!
body: Had been using other food tracking apps for years to count calories.  Those apps worked great for just that, calories.  Macros were always way out of whack.  This app makes it easy to count macros and calories fall into place. Fantastic app!

title: Easy to manage app
body: This is an easy to manage app. I love I can have multiple macro plans. Easy to find food, if I can't  find the food it's easy to add by manually adding or scanning the barcode. I also got this app for my husband and he lost 13 lbs the first week counting his macros!

title: A++++++
body: I LOVE this app. I was skeptical to get it but I have been nothing but satisfied and impressed. I used MFP for years and now that you have to pay to use all the good features I started looking for a new solution. My macros is the answer! Totally worth the price and the value is phenomenal!

title: Barcode and search do not work at all!
body: I used this app for a couple months back in summer of 2016 and it worked great. After taking a few months hiatus I came back this week and I have to say the search function and barcode scanner do not work at all. I have tried multiple times to find foods or scan a barcode and it literally does not work. What in the world is going on? Very frustrating!

title: Keeps Me Accountable
body: I'm very happy with my macros+. If an item is not in the database, you can scan it and input the label info. Once that's done, your scanned food is saved in your custom foods. It's completely customizable and helps me stay on track. I highly recommend!

title: Love the app but needs more
body: I've been using my fitness pal and bought this one because its so much more geared for what I need for my macro tracking but it's so time consuming and frustrating because it has a very small food database and doesn't recognize hardly any barcodes, even super generic ones. I find myself wasting a lot of time having to manually plug everything in myself. PLEASE expand your database so I can keep using this.

title: Great
body: Excellent macro and calorie tracker! Very user friendly input system. Better than MyFitnessPal for inputting your own macro ratios and/or per gram amounts if you don't use ratios. Only down fall in my opinion is the item scanner, which isn't the most accurate. Other than that this is a great product and would recommend it.

title: Just what I was looking for
body: If your are doing iifym that app is really really great! It has everything I was looking for. Has food already put in and you can put in your own. Keeps tracks of your macros and is easy to see. This app is a necessity for people following iifym ... A+

title: Prefect app!
body: This app is exactly what I needed for counting my macros. It's easy to use and once you input your usual foods, it's super-fast. Not recommended for those who eat out a lot- having labels with all the nutrients in a specific food is useful. I love how you can create your own custom meals.

title: Incredible App just one suggestion
body: I love this app for tracking macros, but the one thing it need is to copy meals of people you are following. My wife and I use this app, it would be help if the persons preparing the meal can input all the info and the other can copy it. Other that that great app.

title: Awesome product in changing your life
body: You want to transform yourself for the better, this product is an essential tool for that process. Take the time to setup your meals and afterwards watch the transformation. Once everything is setup it is so easy to maintain. See for yourself.

title: Very Disappointing
body: I bought this app to replace MyFitnessPal so that I could get more detailed nutritional info. After reading many positive reviews and seeing that they had so many foods loaded in I tried it out. What a waste of money. MFP has virtually every food I plugged in, not so here where less than half of the foods I looked up were either not listed or not listed in the size I used. I started plugging in the data from MFP and then realized what a waste of time that was and filed the app. Hugely disappointing.

title: Wonderful app
body: Love this app! It would be great if you could wrote notes attached to your meals and if you could pre-set future macros because I do carb-cycling and it would make it that much easier than having to go switch the goals every day. Thanks!

title: Great App
body: I think this is a great app if you want to track your macros. Yes, there is work involved with setting everything up so you can customize your foods to your own preferences. However, MyMacros+ makes a very complicated process a whole lot easier!

title: Best macro tracker
body: I've tried several different trackers and this app has a lot of food items in it. Calculator is on point for your goal and if you meal prep and have the same meals, you can copy the meal to another day. Awesome app! Still getting use to the new layout.

title: Amazing support, ultra simple to use.
body: Great app, too many fitness apps are bloated with fluff making them annoying to use. The last thing I want to do while dieting is fumble with complex apps after every meal. This app is a no bs way to record macros and the best out there. Worth the price!

title: Takes some time
body: I was pretty meh about this app, once I started to explore it more and asked a friend I found the fast track which has made a huge difference. I find the search option frustrating and difficult to use so unless I'm inputting a recipe I just use the fast track.

title: Great app
body: This app is great for tracking macros. You set them up based on your needs. You can also save different macro plans for carb cycling, etc. I had an app question and emailed their support. I received a response within the hour. Great app and great company. Highly recommend.

title: Great app!
body: I used to use myfitnesspal,  but when I found out about this app it didn't take me long to jump ship and transition over to MM+! The recipe section is awesome to get more ideas for meals - and it is super easy to copy meals from day to day and edit recipes. So happy this app exists!

title: Way better than MyFitnessPal!
body: I recently switched over from MyFitnessPal to this app, and I am very pleased. I love the ability to set your own macro numbers and I love the ability to easily switch the goal profile (i.e. High carb day, low carb day). Well worth the cost of the download!

title: Mint app for your calories
body: This app takes the confusion out of counting macros- it has so many food options and a barcode scanner for items that you can't find in the app. Customize your own ratios and get a summary emailed to you each week. It's amazing

title: Informative and user friendly!
body: Have several years experience with my fitness  pal and find macro system enables me to carve off last few pounds and see what foods help or hinder in that struggle. Very user friendly and nutritional information is astounding.

title: This is the best app I have ever paid for
body: Seriously perfect. Tracking macros without this feels impossible. Not only does it help with tracking but makes you never want to skip a day in the gym. Lets you put in goals and adding food is easy. Gainz!!!

title: MFP is so much better
body: I regret purchasing this app for sure. I've been using My Fitness Pal for the longest time, but wanted to set macro goals in grams rather than percents. My Macros + allows you to do that. However, the search engine is terrible. It's hard to find the exact food you are looking for. Even with the barcode scanner, I wasn't able to find nutrition data for many foods I wanted to log. It's far too time consuming to do this manually. The database in mfp is so much better.

title: Love it.
body: Would like to see a more chronological time entry listed in each column with the food eaten. Other than that I think it's a helpful and useful app to reach your goals. If your trying to burn fat, get in shape, lose lbs etc, you gotta know what's going in your mouth!

title: Best way to track macros
body: This app is stellar. It gives you macros per meal and counts down for you. It gives you red/yellow/green ranges when you hit your targets and will get back red when you go too far over your goal. Everything is verified on their app, too. It's great

title: Love this app!
body: Easy to use, like the format; sometimes the barcode scanner doesn't work or is unable to "read" the product. Overall, very pleased with this app! I have been using it daily for almost 4 months 😄

title: Perfect for basic macro tracking
body: Has a pretty solid food library. You have to finagle some things to get the right amount, but that's fine. It's prefect for tracking macros day to day.

title: Overall an amazing app for fitness goals
body: The app has several strong points including the ability to quickly see macros, customize those macro goals, built in macro calculator and easy scanning of food into meals.

title: Lack of foods and search function
body: I've been trying to switch to this app but it's just not working. Trying to find foods is a complete 'scratch-your-face-off' nightmare. I have the global search on but finding something as simple as "nectarines" was nearly impossible. We also eat a lot of organic foods and no matter what I type after "organic" the first option is a tomato basil sauce. I'm so frustrated that I've been using my previous app (mynetdiary) to get my food totals and THEN entering it here.

title: Like it!
body: It's good for simply tracking the 3 macros, which is great for what I've been doing for the last 8 months. I really like the pie chart and summaries as well. Micronutrients aren't big in this app, so if you're looking for that as well, you should go back to myfitnesspal. It would be nice if it worked with Fitbit or any activity tracker.

title: Great app
body: I got this on advice from my trainer to track my calories and, in particular, grams of protein, carbs and fat.

title: Exactly what u want it to be!
body: Great app! This is exactly what you'd want it to be. Database of food with nutritional info that you can log meal by meal and it keeps track of your macro totals. I've been using this for a few years now and it keeps getting better.

title: Best Macro Tracker
body: Comprehensive and easy to use! I like that it syncs with Avatar Nutrition so my goals/macros can transfer.

title: Not Impressed
body: Don't waste your money. $2.99 just to download their 'free' edition (you get most of these options with free apps out there). This app touts analysis and graphs to map your meal progress. NOPE, you want that, be prepared to fork over $20 per year. Completely misleading description and pictures. I was mainly interested in the Macro tracking and reporting. I find it hard having to manually enter foods I've ate or drinks I've consumed. It's a waste of time and money. MFP works better than this app. Save your money.

title: Worth every penny!
body: Definitely an app worth the $2.99 investment. Limitless options provide the fastest way to track macros for serious athletes and the everyday dieter. Very user friendly and aesthetically pleasing. A must have for anyone wanting an interactive approach to diet management. I use it everyday!

title: Very useful overall
body: Really like the app. The only thing I would improve is the food database. Sometimes it is difficult to just get data for whole, unprocessed foods, because you have to weed through so much other stuff. However, once you find it, it is very easy to use.

title: Great App
body: I love mymacros+ because it is simple and it works. For me it is much easier to use than myfitnesspal and it allows you to see the macronutrient breakdown easier. I didn't need another social network, I needed an app to track macros. This works well for that!

title: Can't live without it!
body: Love the app - easy viewing of Macros and easy to keep track of what you've ate and what you have left to eat. A lot of work getting it set up for your own individualized foods, but then easy to access and navigate.

title: Better than MFP
body: This is a great app for tracking food and customizing macros to the gram. Switched to this after using my fitness pal for years. It's really easy to add in my food for the day. I highly recommend this app for anyone looking to track their food/macros.

title: Great tracking app!
body: I love how easy it is to use! It's so simple to input new foods! Love how they send a weekly review at the end of every week! It shows how you're doing to make changes.

title: Big fan of MyMacros!
body: I have been using this app daily since April- I love it much more than other tracking apps! Foods are easy to enter and easy to find- even estimating with what is already saved has worked for my goals!

title: If I could give it more stars I would.
body: Ever since my weight loss journey I have used my fitness pal which is great. But I LOVE LOVE LOVE that it tells you have much you have of everything you have left for the day not just calories. I'm down 40 and still going!!

title: Great App for tracking macros
body: The food list that is already within the app are a bit limited so you will have to manually add some things.  Overall I think it's a very good app and the barcode scanner is quite handy.

user_name: Weather Snob says it is great!
title: Fantastic, convenient tracker
body: Very happy with the ease of use.  The interface isn't bogged down with all the distracting "features" in MFP that made it frustrating to use.  This tracker has all the things I need, and none of the things I don't!

title: Awesome!!
body: Well worth the money. Super easy to use and no nonsense. By far the best calorie counter I've used.

title: Very good!
body: Love it! I have tried many apps like this and none have been this good. It is cool because it doesn't focus so highly on the calories but more so on the essential macronutrients. When combined with "my workouts" app it is an awesome baseline for  total lifestyle tracking!

title: Super easy and customizable!
body: This app was so easy to learn and start using. My favorite part is you can add different macro plans and choose which one you are using depending on if it's a workout day or not. Much more customizable than myfitnesspal.

title: Slightly confusing
body: So I'm really new to counting macros and I wish they would explain how to and give some basic information in the app. It also needs some more work done on it. For $3 I would expect it to be completed and fully functional. Do not sell a product and "improve it down the line", that is not good business skills.

title: Best app!! Easy and Convenient
body: I am in love with this app! So much better than simply calorie counting. It's kind of like they thought of everything with this app. Helps tremendously with meal planning and counting my macros when eating out! I've been recommending this app to everyone :)

title: My Macros + is great
body: The$2.99 version is perfect for keeping track of carbs protein and fat. It counts down from your goal and let's you know the remainder you have for the day. Great scanner and the menu search has quite a bit. Well worth it!

title: Already Losing Weight!
body: First of all, the app is fun and easy to use. It makes eating more fun too! I've been using it for less than a week and can already see a significant difference in the way I look and feel. I'm so happy!

title: Disappointed
body: I purchased this app in hoping to making tracking my macros easier.  When clicking on recents it keeps defaulting to large portions.  It needs to be able to recognize the user and default to my portions.  You also need to be able to a do a multi add.   I think I will stick with my other app.  I wish I could get my $$ back on this one.  Takes too long to enter info.

title: Does Not Track Net Carbs
body: This does Not Track Net carbs only total carbs, which is useless for me. I messaged the developer and received this laughable response:

title: Super App for Keto Diet!
body: I recently started a keto diet, and downloaded this app to track my carbs, fat, proteins, and calories. While it has a bit of a learning curve, it's very much worth it. A keto diet is complicated to track, and this app, once you have mastered it, tracks effortlessly. Highly recommended.

title: Yes!
body: Easy to convert to grams. Quick once you get your staple foods put in. Barcode scanner works! Easy to enter quick amounts in if your short on time. I've been using this app for a solid 6 months. Haven't found anything better

title: A+
body: I'll make this short. Excellent app, very easy to use. Great price. Allows me to track my carbs fat protein and cals all quickly and easily. A+ great work on this app! Myfitnesspal is $10 a month for premium, which unlocks the macro feature. Save yourself $117 and get this instead!

title: Better then MFP
body: I've been trying to get use to MFP for almost a year and its just not user friendly. Just started using this app for one day and I got it down really fast. Easy to use and understand. Very basic which is what I like.

title: There's a problem.
body: I just downloaded this app. I entered my profile information but my height is stuck at 3'5 and I can't change it. I can't get it to change when I click edit profile and select the column. Can you please fix this problem so that my profile information is accurate and I can actually start using the app without a mistake in my profile. Thanks.

title: Love it!!
body: Very user friendly and has just as good features (or better) than the paid version of MFP. Only complaint is I wish food was easier to search but I eventually find it or create it myself!

title: Best Macro Tracker Ever
body: Although you have to manually enter the nutrition information for many foods, once you do that this app is simply phenomenal. I love being able to build meals, see the breakdown for each meal, and see my daily totals all at once. Honestly the best tracker for IIFYM dieters! 💪🏻 love it!

title: Fantastic
body: Started tracking macros with my girlfriend and this is the best app for macro tracking. Everything is customizable and easy to use. Love that it syncs with the My Workout app. I feel perfectly in control of my fitness and health goals with these apps!

title: BEST way to track macros while cutting/bulking
body: I have tried tons of apps that track macros, and this one does it the best. My favorite feature is the barcode scanner, which allows me to add foods to my list if the nutrition info is hard to find.

title: Great app for tracking, food database gets knocked for depth tho
body: Definitely a much better way to view your diet. The food database is pretty skewed/shallow comparatively which is the only downside.

title: Fantastic app!
body: This is a game changer for reaching my personal fitness goals. Understanding macros and how they work in your daily nutrition can make a major difference in your routine and it has for me. Easy to use and the custom recipes is my favorite feature.

title: Let down
body: Its good for calculating macros but for $2.99 the database is lacking. I recommend myfitnesspal instead. Ive spent more time making my own custom entries on this because there is not enough listed when you search. Barcode entry is available but it always crashes so once again I enter it on my own. With some work done on this app it could be great but not worth it right now.

title: Love This App!
body: As a personal trainer, I have found this App to be priceless both for me personally and professionally with my clients. Everyone I have sent to purchase this App has thanked me. It is the best Macro Keeping App I out there. I've deleted all others. No need for them anymore. Thanks guys!

title: It's almost there
body: I think the app is pretty good, the barcode scanner needs work as most items are not recognized and you need to manually input them. I also wish there was a way to insert recipes and be able to create a meal item out of that recipe. But overall it's a great app.

title: Macro friendly for real
body: Love this app so far. Love that you can set up your precise macros based on grams instead of increments of 5% of total days calories like MFP. Never could fine tune my macros the way I wanted through the other app. My Macro Plus is truly macro friendly.

title: Five stars
body: Love it, wish it had a fuller database.

title: Great app
body: Great for macro tracking. The barcode scanner gets the job done most of the time and if not it's easy to add in custom items. Also easy to program in recipes. Have used MFP in the past and think this is much better.

title: foodie
body: I love this app but since the update mine will not update from 4.5 to 5. I have an older iPhone but it has IOS 7.1.2 which is what is required. Is there a reason why it is not working? I try to open my macros and it closes

title: Perffff
body: It's an overall awesome app to track your daily food intake. You can even set different goals for different days. You can track your weight and even have a circle to follow. I give it four starts because I really need the micronutrients to be tracked too. They're just as important!

title: Works well.
body: The search function could use a little work, when I search for spaghetti and meatballs it gives me spaghetti and I have to scroll through 100 spaghetti's before I find one that is a complete dish. you should be able to filter by closest phrase match first.

title: Love the App!
body: Definitely a good app that includes so many features. Only thing I'm a little disappointed with is that sometimes it doesn't accurately display the macros from a certain product and it can get a little messy if you don't know how to properly use the app.

title: Perfection!!!!!
body: This application is second to none. The simplicity and accuracy as well as customizing options make this app far superior to the other applications. After trying this, MyFitness Pal has officially taken a back seat. For good!

title: single measurement for each food defined
body: This app has a large database of foods already entered, but a real show stopper for me is it seems to only allow one type of measurement for each food item in the database.  So if I want to measure a bowl of berries by grams instead of cups, I'm out of luck.  Very inconvenient for an app that is supposed to make measuring food consumption and planning very convenient.  Needs a little more thought.

title: Favorite Macro App
body: I love that this app has a huge database of foods, has a barcode scanner, I can input multiple days of macros and easily change what day I want, and when I replaced my phone I was able to bring back all my data stored! Yayy!

title: Tricky at first!
body: I love love my macros+ app. It was a little tricky for me to get used to after using another tracker but now I love it. I use the barcode scanner all the time and makes tracking so easy. Thanks for a wonderful way to track my food intake!!

title: Love it!
body: This app is easy to use and helps me keep track of my macros in an easy and convenient way. Plus, I really like that it has a barcode scanner so I can scan what I'm eating and enter in the correct measurements. I give it a big 'ol thumbs up 👍🏻

title: Useful
body: A useful app but I struggle with UI. Not so much that it deters me from using it. One update I would like to see is implementing background app refresh so the widget is up to date. As it stands now the new day shows yesterday's data (stale data) in the widget. This has been present for two months since I bought the app. Will update review if ever fixed.

title: This app is a lifesaver!!
body: I am terrible at tracking my macros but this app has made it so easy!  The barcode scanner is by far my favorite feature.  I've lost 4 pounds since I started using this and I expect to lose much more!

title: Love it!
body: This is a very helpful tool in losing those inches, but not losing strength!  My favorite part is that you can build recipes. It's a little time consuming, but in the end it's very helpful in recording exactly what you are eating. No more estimating or guessing.

title: Very user friendly!!
body: I absolutely love this app. It has made tracking macros very easy! Also the macro calculator that comes with the app is far superior than others in my opinion. Also only a one time fee!

title: Really like it
body: I have recommended this to several people I know. I like the flexibility that My Fitness Pal doesn't offer.  I wish that the measurements were more universal or could more easily convert grams to cups, etc.  Outside of that, great tool.

title: Great App!
body: If you're looking for an app that will simply record macros in neat, effective, and organized manner this one Is perfect. The beauty of it is that it simply does just that. A lot of other apps have a lot of unneeded features this one doesn't and does its job great.

title: It's OK
body: My biggest complaint is that you cannot upload recipes like MFP.  Also, it would make life so much easier if your app would easily change from oz, cups, tsp and Tbsp and that you could delete a food if you accidentally add it to your recipe.  I hopefully will be able to use this in the future, but not until I can add my own recipes.

title: Best Food Tracker To Date
body: I have used several food/macro tracking apps and this is by far the most reliable and easy to use.  The food database is huge and creating/editing food items is a breeze. To

title: Excellent app for macro tracking
body: My only complaint is the lack of pre-built food items. I'm sure this area will grow as the app becomes more popular.

title: Great app!
body: I am trying to gain weight or at least maintain it after dealing with cancer. This app definitely helps me keep track of my calories and protein consumption. It is sometimes limited in the barcodes it can scan or in the search tool. Other than that, very helpful app.

title: Great App for tracking macros
body: Love this app for tracking macronutrients, fiber, calories, etc. especially since the new upgrades added more options. For those rating low because of lack of micronutrient tracking, the title is MyMACROS.

title: Love it!!!
body: Love this app and recommend it all if the time. It only gets better and better. Customer service is great and response is quick if I have an issue. I find it easy to use and customize.

title: Good Tracking Tool
body: Really helps with setting up my meal preps and keep track of my macros. Wish it was a little more accurate though, some of the foods are slightly off. I find myself adding my own custom foods with the correct nutrition facts, but still works for what I need.

title: Great app!
body: This app makes counting my macros way easier.  I used to have to do it all on a piece of paper and it would take hours the night before to make sure I had all my food planned out for the next day.

title: Amazing!
body: I can honestly say this app has helped me when it came to my goals which is losing weight. Keeping track of my macros has never been easier, wouldn't recommend any other app

title: Best macro app
body: Can't beat it. Tracks everything down to the gram and the developer has even implemented suggestions I made to him via email. Great app, great support from the developer. A must buy for anyone trying to accurately track their diet

title: Great app!
body: I love how this app works!  Having the ability to only track macros is great, especially when you are primarily focused on macro intake.  Because it is less than a year old, the database isn't as large, but it is growing and has a lot of potential to be even better.

title: Simple & effective
body: Im a hard gainer and forgetful so this app is perfect for me. Before I eat I just use the barcode reader and select the serving size, really easy to navigate. A must for a person who doesn't want to calculate with grams or "guesstimate" number in there diet.

title: Better than MyFitnessPal
body: By far the best to date. Being able to customize your daily macros with exact numbers is awesome. On top of that I can switch between (refeed days and regular days) by a simple click. Best yet!!!

title: Wonderful
body: Such a great app to track macros, love how you can customize your daily goals by Gram and not percent like MFP. Started with MFP and used it for about 3 years, recently switched over to this and I'm loving it. Only thing that's missing is a bigger searchable database like MFP.

title: Needs force touch for weight logging
body: Loving this app so far! I like how my remaining macros are displayed prominently in front of me.

title: IIFYM
body: A great app to counting macros. Easy to use! Love the barcode scanner. Almost all the food I eat is already in the database which is awesome. Love that I can track my weight too and easily adjust macros if I'm not losing weight. Would be cool if it tracked water but not necessarily needed!

title: Simple, versatile, functional
body: Love this app! Easy to track different days (low cal, higher cal) and makes keeping a food diary super convenient. Never crashes and beautiful interface. Highly recommend.

title: Has potential
body: Loved the layout of app and it could've been perfect but there is no option to track workouts unless you want to spend another $3. Also, their food data is almost all wrong. Spend too much time correcting all the items I added to my diary. Contacted creator for refund but no response. Not even to tell me that it wasn't an option. Super lame.

title: Horrible, stay away
body: The worst app for counting macros. Barcodes hardly ever scan and when they do it can't find the food or finds it with wrong macro information that's way off from the nutrition label. The search function is equally useless. Example: if I enter "apple" you would think the first thing would be info for an average size apple but I stead it returns crap like "applebees apple pie fritter desert" or some such nonsense. Look for another app, this one is worthless.

title: Love this app!!
body: I have been using this app on a daily basis for years. It is easy to use and I love how I can customize everything. I highly recommend downloading it!! The customer service is always great as well!! :-)

title: My favorite!
body: Great app!  I can save recipes, copy meals to different days, look at how my day breaks down on the meal page or click through to see the breakdown of fiber,etc by meal. I recommend to anyone that asks me for a macro tracking app!

title: Best Macro tracker ever
body: Nothing more to say other than this really is the best macro tracker ever. Easy to use; love the way the "recent" foods is stored according to meals; able to save more than just the standard "three meals" that MyFitnessPal limits you to. Highly recommend!

title: Love!!
body: This app is so simple and easy to use. The best part is being able to adjust the macros to your needs. This is something that is huge!! It's simple to find food, easy to customize, and easy to add food. I love it!!!

title: Love it
body: I love the app! I had just started counting macros and felt like I was in over my head but this app helped me out a ton. I just wish they had a larger selection of food and i think you should be able to change method of measurements. For example from cup to ounce and so on.

title: Very Good
body: Intuitive. Easy to use. Quantity of foods is sometimes a bit wonky. (1 almond? Really? I would rather more foods were measured in grams or ounces) But it gets easier to work around that with practice. Simple to add custom foods. Works offline, which is great!

title: Not what I thought
body: I thought you'd be able to input your macro goals and have the app help you track them. While you can track macros daily it doesn't show how many macros you have left to goal. Also in order for you to track your workouts you have to buy an additional app for $3. I wouldn't buy this app again if I had this information.

title: Ke2li
body: I seriously love this app. Besides being able to track your macros, it has the ability to allow you to change and save new macro profile goals.

title: Best interface I've seen for any macro app
body: The barcode scanner is amazing, never had it not recognize a food, keeps a log of everything so you can go back and easily choose foods oh eat often. Love it!!!

title: Bad for entering past data
body: Really bad interface for weight data especially if you're putting in data from a different app. Really frustrating.

title: Great for lifters
body: This is a great app as far as tracking macros micros and calories it also has a nice weight tracking feature, but the app really needs to develop it's barcode scanning tool more like that of myfitnesspal which is one of the easiest ways to quickly add food

title: The Best
body: I paid a personal trainer $95 for a "personalized" meal/workout plan two days before finding this app!!! Wish I would have discovered this app sooner! It's legit and easy to use, I love it! I use this app & its sister workout app over the $95 plan I purchased!

title: Great app!
body: This app is great! Let's you set different macros for different days which the other myfitnesspal does not. Also it pops up in your notifications tab as how many macros are left. Also really cool feature

title: My macros are on POINT
body: Love the fact that you can search SO many brands and names! It takes a little getting used to because it's not too user friendly, but I love this app and it's helping me achieve my goals!!!

title: Perfectly simple
