body: If you're looking for s simple way to track your macros and calories, this is it. This is for the one who doesn't want any BS or fluff, just simple tracking and easy to use.

title: What's Not To Love
body: Barcode scanning function works great and my wife and I are shocked at the sheer volume of brands that it recognizes and in the odd chance it isn't in the app, it's super simple to add a custom recipe or brand into the app and easily reference it in your "Recent Foods" list.

title: Frustrating
body: This app is really frustrating when it comes to measurements. Half the time it's measured by amount, the other half by weight. For example, for some veggies the measurements are by cups, but for the same vegetable with a slight variation it will be measured by grams or ounces. And there's no way to change it. I shouldn't have to chop up to measure my raw cucumbers because it's classified under "Cucucumbers, raw- 1 cup chopped." Please fix this.

title: Love it
body: Great for tracking macros. Use it every day. Only thing I would change is to be able to search for a brand vs having to scroll through. But everything else I love

title: Love it!
body: This is an amazing app and I'm addicted to it! It's very user friendly and the detail that went into its creation is evident. I just wish that the barcode scanner would save the foods to recent or frequent foods so I didn't have to keep rescanning. FABULOUS APP.

title: Good app - not perfect
body: I do like it more than MFP but it has glitches and sometimes I have to look up foods on MFP OR ONLINE and add them myself.

title: Could be better
body: Love that it tracks the macros for each meal. I only wish that food scanner could recognize more items, search function was better and didn't just show fast food options, and could copy individual food item rather than entire meal.

title: Great App
body: This app is great! Would definitely recommend it. I've been lucky to find all my food choices already loaded and keeping track of my protein carb fat Ratio helps me make better choices everyday.

title: Sweetness Exemplified
body: Large food database, ability to add recipes and food info, easy to use interface makes tracking mindless and quick. I love this app and can't imagine using any other.

title: Great app!
body: I've only had this for one day and I love it! As a health coach And personal trainer it makes keeping track of my macros super easy. I like how the manual add items works if an item isn't in the database! Super great and I'll recommend this app to clients.

title: GREAT Resource!!
body: Working out is "easy". But keeping your food on point is where the magic happens! And this app makes that a much less difficult task! With the data base of goods, and the scanner, it's almost on autopilot! Love it!

title: Easy tracking
body: Most apps can be difficult to track on but this one is exceptionally easy to use and even breaks down my daily macros so I can see my ratios from day to day.

title: By far the best
body: I've used every tracking app out there and this is by far the easiest and best one I've ever used. Might take a second to get used to it but I'll never use another app!

title: Get this app
body: I use to use Myfitnespal until Sohee Lee recommended it. Been two years now, won't got back or get anything else. Use the workout app as well. Worth my money hands down. Ps - nothings perfect- nothing glitch free.

title: Surpasses my previous "go-to" app!
body: Great design, functionality, and power. It's worth the few bucks for an app that blows the competition out of the water. Best app on the market for tracking macros and continues to improve!

title: Great app.!
body: This is a great, user friendly way of tracking macros. I like that all my meals are saved, making it easier and faster to input information to track the next day's meals. Go Macros plus!

title: Great app!
body: Really a solid app built for those who know what they're doing.

title: Awesome!
body: Great app that allows flexibility in daily macros. My macros change every 2-3 days and the app allows me to change it easily. Lots of cool simple features that make tracking calories during my first contest prep a breeze!

title: Amazing app for tracking macros
body: This has literally everything I need to track my macros and the barcode scanner is scary accurate and quick. Easiest app to keep my nutrition on track for sure. Thanks Jason!!

title: LOVE!!
body: After attempting to use MFP for awhile to track my macros this app I was trying to find something better geared towards IIFYM... So glad I found this... Have only been using it a few days and it is awesome and so much easier.

title: Great app
body: Great app for tracking macros. I do wish recent items would pop up when you're searching..but other than that I love it and will continue to use it!

title: Amazing app
body: Freaking amazing app. It really helps keep everything in check. The ability to copy meals from one day to the next makes it extremely time efficient!!! Keep up the great work!!

title: Best tracker!
body: This app is amazing! Not only do I use it myself, but my clients use it as well! It's incredibly easy to use and very helpful if on an iifym type diet or if you just want to track your current meals to get started.

title: Does the job
body: Also a former MFP user, I like how everything is customizable here especially since my macros change weekly/sometimes daily. Quick add is convenient. Knocking off stars because the database is limited; about 75% of the foods I eat are not in the database (salmon sashimi!? Spicy salmon rolls!?). Nice UI and easy to use once you get used to it

title: Everything you need
body: This app allows you to set your individual macro goals and watch your progression to meeting them throughout the day. Easily able to set foods, copy meals, and create your favorite meals.

title: Great app.
body: If you are serious about nutrition but want to save time and have a work and personal life as well this is the app for you. Buddy recommended it to me and I am recommending to my own family and friends.

title: Love it!!
body: I love this app!! Love the set up and ease of use! Love that you can set different goals for training and non training days and that you can see macro totals for each meal!! I have recommended this to many friends!! Great work!

title: I like the app but could use some changes
body: I would love for more options when it comes to searching for foods. Hopefully they will add restaurant foods and grocery store items. I don't mind adding it to my list but when on the go it's harder.

title: Easy
body: This app is so easy to use. And I love it. It's allowed me to lose a ton of weight and I'm so happy it's able to be used so quickly. Great design and good price. Barcode acts funny sometimes, but overall I give it a 5/5.

title: Love it, but...
body: It's not quite as user friendly as other tracking apps. I LOVE how easy it is to manage and track your macros (as opposed to just your calories)but I wish there were more foods in their data bank, and that the search option was a little better.

title: Horrible data bases and very clunky
body: I decided to give mm+ a try after a few years of using myfitnesspal and after seeing a few endorsements from some well known fitness 'celebrities'. Unfortunately mm+ still has a lot of kinks to work out namely the development of its food data base and scanner.

title: Perfect
body: Easy to use interface. Easily customized nutrition info. Barcode scanner. Everything you can ask for to help you track your progress.

title: Difficult Interface
body: I read a review saying I could also track micronutrients with this app, which was the reason I gave it a try after a long and successful run with MyFitnessTracker, but apparently that's not the case. MFT has a much better barcode scanner, more comprehensive list of foods, and more intuitive interface. Bummed this app wasn't the answer for me.

title: Works great, finally got my wife to use one
body: Nutrition can inherently get complicated, but this app makes things quite simple. Anything my wife will use to better her health gets a five star review from me.

title: Solid app
body: Easy to use once you get the hang of it and allows custom macros. I know some prefer MFP's database but this has been very user friendly and easy to plug new foods in. Would recommend/10

title: Meh
body: After paying for this app I felt I wasted my money. A lot of foods are not in the app, so manual entry is needed. I don't particularly like the design of the app or anything of how it works (personal opinion). Other (Free) apps I have had prior would do just as well, if not better, than this app. Wish I could get my money back.

title: Easy to track!
body: Love this app! Just started tracking macros and this app makes things much easier than MFP. Also love the fact that I can have different nutrition goals and easily alternate.

title: Best bet for Macros Tracking
body: This is the only sophisticated app out there which allows you to set macro goals and track them with precision. The food catalogue certainly isn't as vast as MFP, but I add my foods to it daily in effort to build it up.

title: Yes
body: Just yes. If you count macros, you'll understand once you learn how to use it. My pregnant wife uses this to gain the right kind of weight as the baby grows. I use this for fitness. There's just no better app on the market for this.

title: Revolutionary
body: It won't do the work for you but will definitely put you on the right track to reach your goals a lot faster than you expected! Stoked

title: Love it!
body: Takes a little while to get the swing of the navigation, but it does everything I need out of a macro tracking app.  I definitely recommend it to all my clients.

title: Not worth it
body: I've used mfp for years but recently started to count macros. Mfp doesn't let you customize unless you pay the upgraded version & so I decided to give this app a shot but once I set my macros & tried logging in my food discovered that logging in grams isn't always available & when it is it's not accurate. Simply logging in raspberries in grams took 2 over 10 mins & the info is incorrect.

title: Excellent
body: Very happy with this app. It's better than my fitness pal. The only drag is that the pre imported foods that they have in the app aren't that accurate.

title: Give it a few days...
body: Takes a little getting used to after using MFP, but now that I got the hang of it, it is so much better than any other tracker.

title: Like it!
body: I like my macros because you can adjust your day to, high carb, or low carb easily! However the app does struggle to find foods, so I bar scan pretty much everything! But otherwise it's good!!

title: Missing the basics
body: The barcode scanner is not effective for some common brand name products. Furthermore, searching for specific foods does not yield accurate results. When I add a banana, I should have the option of adding a whole banana. Instead, this app only offers ounces as a quantity. I guess I'm the chump for paying for this terrible service. I have decided to switch back to one of the free apps that is much much better.

title: So Helpful & Time Saving
body: I wish that I could share meals within my circle but that's my only complaint. It's seriously helped me so much with keeping up with my calories and keeping me honest!

title: Good, can be unwieldy
body: Really really like this app, but it does take some getting used to. The search function isn't always great, and the interface took me a while to get the hang of, but now that I've learned all the little idiosyncrasies, I like it a ton

title: My macros is great
body: I love that I can log my food and see how it is making a difference in my health. Easy to use  and it makes it easy to follow the blueprint you set for yourself. Highly recommend.

title: Finally a normal nutrition tracker
body: While its not the prettiest app, it has everything that everyone has been looking for. You can track your macros by grams, no silly percentages. And it has a barcode scanner.

title: Great app, but would be even better with a few improvements
body: I have to track the times I ate and I would love there to be that option. Also, it would be great is there was a way to export a date range to PDF

title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
body: Super simple way to count macros. I've been doing this on paper because the other calorie counters out there only give percentages or something else I don't care about. Really nice.

title: Great ap
body: Great ap. Perfect for tracking carbs, calories and fat intake. Makes life much easier vs writing it all down in a notebook. It would be great to be able to track your workout in this same ap.

title: UI needs work
body: The UI needs serious work and I have yet to get it to share data with apple health.  The macros are different between MM+ and My Workout +, the apparently have slightly different algorithms.

title: Great app
body: I can't say enough how much I use and love this app! It has helped me live healthier and better my life. Easy to use. I've been using it for almost 4 years! Hands down best app to track meals with!

title: I tried, just can't continue
body: In theory the app looked great. Then after the download i started to use it.

title: Perfect for Bodybuilders.
body: Best app ever! Finally an app where you can input your own Macros no percentages or recommendations ! I am going to spread the word for this app as best as I can. I would like to see in the future a scanner feature !

title: Perfect App!!!
body: This is so awesome- all the options and being able to log 6 meals a day... I'm so excited about this!! I've use the other apps that don't have as many options- 😃

title: Pretty darn good
body: I love how you can enter your own values and stuff I just wish that there was more food in the database so search from because entering everything is a hassle. But once you have most of what you eat entered it becomes easier

title: Great tool
body: This app is great for planning your meals, especially for making adjustments at the end of the day. You always know how much food you have left to go. Great app and great responsive support from the author.

title: Lacking in Accuracy
body: Many items only track things like calories, fat, and protein. I wanted to track sodium and potassium, among other things, which renders the app mostly useless to me. Also, the barcode scanner worked well enough, but you can't use it to scan recipe ingredients.

title: Fabulous
body: I've never eaten this way before and have always found tracking to be so tedious. This app is easy to use and I get everything I need really quick ! Love it!!

title: Almost Super!
body: This app helps some however it is kinda struggle to find food products and also some of the serving measurements you have dont match the products you already have, other than that its ok.

title: Love it!
body: Great tool to use with avatar nutrition. It automatically updates your macros based on your weekly goals. Barcode scanner is great but finding the exact food isn't as easy as it is with MyFitnessPal.

title: Best Macro App Available
body: Very easy to use with so many different food options.  This also syncs with Avatar nutrition macro coaching which has absolutely been awesome for my weight loss goals! Worth the money!

title: Love it
body: I like how you can add your own food and customize it whenever and however. I also like the fact that you set different day goals.

title: Awesome
body: Easiest app to ever use to count ur macros once you know how to use it. By using it I've actually been more accurate with my numbers than ever before. Which only means better results.

title: Student
body: Awesome app!  As a full time student my meals sometimes get lost in the day, but this app allows me to enter my own food choices and keep track to ensure I get what I need to continue to push in the gym.  Great app. Thanks.

title: Awesome app
body: App is perfect for tracking food like I do. Killing it in the gym and rest is only a part of fitness and keeping up with proper nutrition is a huge part. This app makes it easy and convenient to do

title: Almost perfect
body: Only thing I would add is the ability to share custom recipes with a friend. Or maybe that is available and I haven't figured it out yet.

title: Awesome app and easy to use
body: This is a must if you are looking to track your macros / calories. Easy to add food on the go if you are somewhere new and add previously logged meals with one click.

title: Best one out there
body: While I routinely encounter a few minor bugs, this is my daily tracker and I remain very happy with it. I used to track on a spreadsheet I wrote because all the apps were amateur. But this one has stuck. Well done.

title: Best Macro Tracker
body: I've been tracking macros for a few years and tried a few different programs. This one is hands down the most precise and user friendly. Love it!

title: First time macro tracker
body: I love this app. This is my first time tracking macros as part of my diet. This works great for me and keeps me on track. It's so easy to search for foods and I like that it saves the foods I've searched for so I don't have to type them in again.

title: Great Macro Tracker
body: Does the job better than anything else I have found.  Especially the worldwide database of foods.  Love the search option and the ability to save favorites.

title: Back up to 5 stars
body: No longer having issues with barcode scanner or search. I only use this for macros tracking so it works great for me.

title: Need foods, ect. added to database!
body: I don't have the time to individually add nutritional info on practically every food item I consume. The database is seriously lacking and the scanner I thought worked until I double checked the nutritional info on the food it pulled up. Everything was completely off and had to be edited :( Guess I'll stick with myfitness pal for now...

title: Loving it
body: This app has been great for me. I finally made the switch to macros, and I set up my macros according to my body type and this app has really kept me on track!! It's great and easy to use.

title: Awesome tracker
body: This makes tracking macros so easy.  Well worth the money.  Would be nice if there was a way to track certain micro like sodium, on a daily basis.  I see it entered but can't seem to get the daily tally .

title: Nice and simple! Suggested add ons
body: Love using this app, especially the barcode scanner. Few things I would improve on this app is:

title: Worth the Money
body: I just started counting Macros and this app is very helpful.  There are a few little quirks with it but it still great to use.  Very easy to use.  Hopefully the database will grow with new users.

title: Bodybuilder macros app
body: Wanted to love this app after leaving MyFitnessPal, but just can't keep using it. The "verified" nutrition info for most of the foods I entered were wrong. Unless you have time to manually enter all the nutrition info for everything you eat (which takes hours every day), don't waste your time. Also switching between serving measurements like grams to cups, also throws the numbers way off.

title: Easy to use, impressive food list to choose from!!  Would buy again (if I had to!) 😀
body: If you're tracking macros, use this app!!!

title: Don't expect a reply from them if you have a question
body: The sample recipes display inaccurate macros . As a tip, when you calculate a calorie deficit plan, keep the lbs per week you want to lose on the lower side.  If you have questions/problems with the app, don't expect a reply from the maker.

title: Love this!
body: I love this app. It is easy to use. I love the barcode scanner which makes adding new foods easy. I also really like the ability to copy and paste entire meals to new days.

title: Great for tracking!
body: This app has been a lifesaver! I've had no issues with it at all, and the layout is simple to figure out and the app is clean doesn't feel cluttered at all. For the price it was well worth it!

title: Excellent
body: Finally someone took macro nutrient tracking to the next level. Highly recommend this for anyone that wants to really track their nutrients with accuracy and ease.

title: Simply Great
body: Very easy & simple to use. Keeps track of your daily macros & calories all in a swipe & adding a food item that's not already registered is easy as well.

title: Great app compared to others
body: Works great for me,  I have both this and Nutritionist app,  this one seems to not have any bug issues.  However I wish it did have a suggestion macros breakdown / meal depending on how much macros and meals you'll consume a day.

title: Awesome!
body: MFP even wont let me put in my own calories without defaulting to what they want or suggest, needless to say I switched to this app and am perfectly happy with it. It took some getting used to but it gets the job done and it's user friendly.

title: Awesome App
body: I'm new to tracking my macros so this app has been such a lifesaver!! Breaks everything down in easy to understand terms..and the barcode scanner with this app is a PLUS! Thank you!!😊

title: Great app for basic tracking
body: Data base for foods could use a thorough scrub and some additions for common restaurants but over all very handy to track with easy visual layout.

title: GREAT APP
body: Best app you can get for this price, it does absolutely everything essential. Could be optimized a bit to be more user friendly however once you learn how to use it, it makes tracking macros easy!

title: Love this app
body: Makes tracking so easy. Wish the food database was a little bigger though -- sometimes have to go elsewhere to get macros for items.

title: Best Overall Tracking App
body: Still could use improvement, and I wish it had a food directory as large as MyFitnessPal. Overall package is my preferred app. Been using it daily for over 6 months.

title: Great
body: I mean look. It helps YOU get the job done. It doesnt weigh and measure your food for you. Best app to accurately measure macros. Made for bodybuilders, not for soccer moms trying to feel better about all the margs they want to drink this weekend.

title: Obsessed
body: This app is actually amazing ! Cool features and easy to use....I find it way better then my fitness pal. Helps me a lot with recording my food intake! I definitely recommend it.

title: Super cool app!
body: Exactly what I was looking for to help me count my macros through out the day!! I love that you can customize and add your own foods! You can also create meals you consume often for easy adding! I love it!! :D

title: More sophisticated tracking
body: A few minor opportunities to be more user-friendly, but much more sophisticated in regards to setting gram-by-gram macro goals. Also, as a Trainer who always seems to be eating dinner for breakfast (Chicken? Sure!) and vice versa (Omelettes!), I like that the meals are numbered 1-6 rather than named.

title: MyMacros works!
body: It took me a couple of days to really learn the ins and outs to this app and really use it to my advantage but, now that I did, I absolutely love it!!  Very user friendly and easy to track!

title: Love this app!
body: Only thing I would add is a Fiber tracker to the bottom. Fiber is a key component of IIFYM so instead of going through & manually adding my fiber intake for the day it would be nice to just have this at the bottom!!

title: Bomb app
body: Love how it shows how many macros per meal rather than having to search for it. Definitely wish there were more commercial foods on here but still a great app

title: Great App
body: The app is great. I wanted an app to track my protein by grams and not by percentage of my daily intake. This app accomplishes that and more.

title: Solid App
body: Absolutely the best app I've used and I've tried them all at some point. One suggestion would be to include tracking the supps, etc. Also as dorky as it sounds track the cheat meals as well somehow. Nice app though, thanks!

title: Great app
body: I am loving this app so far and really appreciate the quick feedback/responses when there are issues or questions. I'd highly recommend!

title: Best macro tracking app
body: By far the best App to use if you track your food, the mist customizable app you can use in the industry! I recommend and set up macros using this with all my clients.

title: It's got potential
body: It's a good start.  It needs a link to a more complete food database.  The feedback form doesn't work.  Needs scanning added to iPads. It also needs the ability to add multiple macro profiles for those people who cycle macros based on training vs no training

title: MUST HAVE!!!!!
body: I incredibly love this new update! It fixed every single bug! In my opinion this app is the best calorie count app ever made! It's worth spending money to buy this! Better than MyFitnessPal!

title: Love overall
body: Just wish the barcode scanner was a little more reliable. Otherwise a very good and comprehensive app. I like that you can enter your own personal macros to customize the app to your personal goals.

title: Finally!
body: Finally an app that is easy to use for macros! I love being able to save different macro profiles and use them on different days!

title: Thoughts
body: I really love this app. It's user friendly. My only reason to not rate this a 5 stars is because i wish it would allow you to add any type of measurements. It would make it easier for me or a beginner.

title: Great
body: The app is easy to navigate, easy to understand and gives a complete overview of each meal, entire day and overall goals.

title: Very useful
body: This app is definitely better than the free macro apps, easy to use, many features, and reliable. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent way to keep on track and honest
body: I especially like the weekly reports! The numbers don't lie, it's like having your trainer right there with you!

title: Best Macro Tracking app there is
body: Probably the best and easiest to use macro tracking app out there.  Recommend it to anyone who is looking to track their macros. 10/10

title: Better than MFP for macros
body: Would recommend. The only downside is the fact that the search feature isn't up to par with MFP, but I'm sure that'll change over time. Especially once there are more users adding data.

title: Fast and thorough help
body: Still have a bit of learning to do, but I was SO blown away by the customer service received that I had to post a positive review!!! Best I've seen in a while 😊

title: Love this app!
body: So easy to stay on track with mm+. I think as it gets updated and some of the bugs removed it will be even better!

title: Great app to get on track
body: Very useful in tracking meals and planning out your day. Wish it integrated better with working out, which is in a sister app that isn't compatible with my model iphone (4).

title: Simply the best
body: Definitely better than MFP. Easy and quick to use. As soon as we can copy to/from others meal plans it will be perfect. Great buy.

title: Super User Friendly, especially for first time Macro-trackers
body: Used to use myfitnesspal. Made the switch and wouldn't ever switch back. Hoping one day that My Macros+ will sync with Fitbit.

title: Pretty great
body: Love that the app lets me set my own macro goals and let's me save frequent meals, copy meals, and enter recipes to get macro breakdowns. Sometimes the barcode scanner doesn't want to work and that gets annoying but everything else is rad.

title: Amazing app for daily tracking of macros and more
body: Track your macros and more effectively with this app. Goes great and helps me keep on track with my daily fitness/bodybuilding routine.

title: Worthless
body: This seems like a scam. Someone who got 300 people to give a worthless app 5 stars. Difficult to navigate. Ridiculously small and unverified foods. Can't even find a Starbucks grande iced latte. Don't spend a cent. And those who say it's better than MyFitnessPal: for all its weaknesses, and in the 3 years I've used it, and the 25 lb. weight reduction goal I achieved and kept off, MFP is light years ahead of this worthless app.

title: Simple and easy.
body: Continually improving. One thing that would be cool is the ability to upload macros from online recipes via url.

title: Awesome app!
body: Love this app! Makes tracking macros a breeze. Took a minute to get used to this app (had used MFP previously) but I wouldn't use any other app now. Highly recommended!!

title: Best app available
body: By far the best diet tracking app on the App Store. Completely customizable to my needs and really helped me reach my goals. 100x better than my fitness pal.

title: Great App!
body: I use this app every day. It's an amazing app. I've recommended this app to my friends since it does a really good job tracking your macros and progress. Also great rapid response on support!!

title: What did I do before this?!
body: This app makes it so easy to track macros! Big time saver too. I do not miss doing this by hand! Also I love that it syncs to MyWorkout app. Highly recommend!

title: Pretty Good
body: I love the app. I chose it over MFP and it does a good job of tracking my macros. Wish it had more foods in its database and a way to have those food's nutritional value verified. Overall, worth the $3!

title: Great App!
body: I have been using this app consistently for the past 6 weeks and I am very pleased with it!  Really helping me hit my macros for my goals! Thank you for this fitness tool!

title: Can be confusing.
body: When you first set a goal it is confusing on how to add that macro goal to your main screen but once you get that on there. It's great.

title: Love it!
body: Whenever I want to see some improvements in my physique this is the first tool I use and I always make the changes happen!

title: Extremely disappointed
body: HATED this app. Really inconvenient. If you misspell or can't remember a brand of a food item, it is impossible to find. I usually log and plan while I'm away from my kitchen so this is so inconvenient for me. MFP worked a lot better. I can't work with an app that doesn't give close suggestions like MFP. Not a lot of food in the database either. Waste of $2.99!

title: User Friendly
body: This app is very easy to navigate and the barcode scan is very useful! I have shared this with friends and family!

title: A
body: I used this app last year and liked it well enough, but stopped because the barcode scanner stopped working- I tried it again just now, hoping there had been an update fixing the problem (because I want to start tracking macros again), but nope.  Barcode scanner still not functioning.  Disappointed.

title: Good app-would be better with more food choices
body: The concept of the app is great. Love that it tracks my Macro goals but its lacking in food choices. Most selections are fast food which is annoying. Spending more time imputing food individually than I have with any other app.

title: Awesome Capabilities
body: By far the best app I've used for nutritional info tracking. Tons of cool ways to analyze what your daily nutritional intake looks like. Very user friendly. Highly recommended.

title: Good but not great.
body: The user interface is a it cumbersome. For example you cannot enter in custom ingredients while putting together a recipe. You must first separately define an ingredient under another menu then go back into the recipe. Also a glitch will not allow me to enter my height.

title: Solid app!
body: Search function can be a bit buggy. I also used a different macro calculator and plugged the numbers in manually. Does everything else I need though.

title: Makes life easier.
body: This app is so much easier for tracking macros than any other app I've tried. Totally worth it.

title: Great app
body: This is a simple and effective app. It allows for customization and is simple enough to use. One time purchase and definitely worth it.

title: Needs to update selection of foods
body: This app is very solid except that many foods that I eat cannot be found on the app, so then I have to look the food on a separate source. I know apps like myfitness pal include a wide variety of foods.

title: Barcode Scanner = Time Saver!
body: Totally love this app. It is super easy to use for any beginner, like myself. But the best way part is by far the barcode scanner and search box. Absolutely love it!

title: Awesome!
body: Started counting macros and this app has made it so easy!  Really simple and easy to use.  Definitely recommend for anyone wanting something for iifym

title: Good app
body: Good app, does what I need it to do. I just created recipes for all my daily meals and it makes tracking them really easy once you get it all set up. #Gainz

title: Flawless Syncing!
body: Great work. I can now switch between my iPhone and iPad and everything syncs up quickly and perfectly.

title: I love it
body: It's so nice to track my macros right on my phone. Also I was adding everything up by hand before so this is so much better.

title: Love it!!!
body: So easy to manipulate and switch between diet plans on carb cycling days.  The only reason this app doesn't get 5 stars is because the food library isn't that big, but that's not even a deal. Great app & does the trick.

title: A must for macro trackers
body: Great app. The UI isn't as good as some of the major apps but it is good at what it says it's good at, macros. The layout isn't super intuitive but that's okay. That will come in time I hope.

title: Great app!
body: Love the app, very convenient easy to use! The only reason why I don't give it 5 stars it's because it needs an upgrade so that it can include more products when using barcode scanner.

title: The only one of its kind
body: This is the only available app for calculating macros, which was much needed for serious lifters. I wish it were a bit more clean with navigation though.

title: Killer App! Worth a lot more
body: While this app is somewhat complex, and difficult for some to use (apparently), once you figure it out it is great! Exactly what I wanted and more.

title: Great App.
body: Have used this for 3 months now since being told about it by my nutritionist. Great way to keep track all day long.

title: Needs more items in search
body: Best app by far for counting macros. Database updated this year so many foods can be found by searching

title: Won't sync with Avatar Nutrition
body: I've connected my Avatar account to my MyMacros+ account but it won't pull my macro information over to the app, even after adding meals (which is supposed to be the initial trigger to sync, as stated on the Avatar site.)

title: Great Concept!
body: Great app for tracking your macros. Once it has more food products in the list to enter in your daily meal then it will be even better!! Please continue to update the list of foods.

title: Good app but...
body: I really like this app but for some reason it doesn't add up ur calories for the day correctly. I are 1600 and it recorded all he macros rite just not the calorie count, said I was at 1300.

title: Easy and precise
body: I use this every day. It's user friendly and more precise for tracking macros than other apps I have tried

title: Exactly what I was looking for.
body: Tracks macros very well, which was what I was looking for. Lots of thoughtful interface actions that make it fast and easy. Love the scanner too.

title: Update
body: I miss the goals being listed at the top, showing how close I am and if I went over. This has disapeared since the last update. Other than that, looking good.

title: Ease of use
body: I love how easy and simple this app is.  Gives you everything you need for clean, simple and easy macro tracking.

title: Awesome!
body: I love the way this app tracks everything for me so I have to put in little effort! Wish the bar scanning worked a little better but overall I am extremely pleased!!! 👊🏻

title: Macros
body: This app has proven super useful for tracking those macros.  I used it in conjunction with my journal for a while but I feel comfortable switching to just the app.  I haven't paired it with the workout tracker yet though

title: Excellent app
body: This app does just what I need. Any time there is a glitch or problem the support is very quick to resolve the problem.

title: Love it
body: User friendly! Everything you want to know is right on your home screen! So much more intuitive than MFP

title: Review
body: Not at all satisfied. Took forever to input food. When I searched for a food it was never what I ordered at a restaurant or the macros were off on the food label of my purchase.  Deleted the app and went to My Fitness Pal which is easy to use and the librarynis awesome. Save your money on the MM+ app. I wish I could get a refund.  This clown stole $3 from me. Smh

title: Seriously addicting app
body: I love this app, I would recommend it to anyone trying to make a lifestyle change or follow a specific plan. Excellent find.

title: Better than my fitness pal, easier, quicker, simpler.
body: Enjoy it because it's much better to get where u need to go.

title: Excellent App!
body: This is an incredible app for tracking macros.  It does everything that you would want it to do.  Strongly recommend!

title: Good app
body: Finding food in the "search" can be a pain, there are too many options. The barcode scanner feature is awesome. It can be a bit tiresome to program "favorite foods and meals".

title: Good overall tracker.
body: Excellent mid-level macro tracker.  For the price, one of the better basic programs.  Most things are available including many common restaurant menu items.  I'm satisfied.

title: Awesome
body: I like this app a lot.

title: Makes counting macros much easier!
body: I love the app because it is easy to use, super customizable, and extremely useful towards any nutritional goal😌

title: Great
body: UI is very simple and straightforward. Database seems to be *far* more accurate than MyFitnessPal, and the way this stores and converts custom foods is perfect. Now, if only it were compatible with Fitbit - that would be 5 stars ;)

title: Good but needs more verifiable data
body: The app itself is great but some backend improvements come to mind.

title: Excellent app.
body: This is the best of the macro counting apps. Four stars instead of five, just because the food database still needs improvement. I have to have a competing nutrition app as well just to take advantage of its larger database.

title: Pretty Good
body: Only thing that would make it great is if there were better options in he search bar. A lot of my things have to be entered manually.

title: The Best Tracker
body: I've tried a few nutrition apps in the past, this hands down is the best one I've tried. The layout ease of use are unparalleled.

title: Love it
body: I have been using this app for over a year and a half. The layout is great and super user friendly. The database keeps improving as well. Great app.

title: Great app
body: I have used the app since first release and with every updated feature has brought greater ease of use.

title: Excellent Macro Tracker
body: Overall the app is very good at tracking macros and works well with avatar nutrition. Only issue is the small database for food, but it is easy enough to find what you need and add your own custom database.

title: Food scale users beware
body: You can not track in grams in this app and it is thoroughly annoying and inconvenient. For all of the postives, like setting macros, this one little detail makes tracking a tedious conversion process that is not as accurate as if it just had grams as a measurement option.

title: Love it!
body: Love this app for macro tracking, much more in depth than trying to track in My Fitness Pal! Not the biggest data base of foods to pick from, but I'd rather manually enter numbers anyway, to ensure reliability. Overall, great app!

title: Pretty good app
body: The app is pretty good in terms of what you expect. Food bank is expansive and tracking weight is easy. Just wish the app allowed you to track training volume. Then, it'd be perfect.

title: Could be a lot better
body: No way to set a goal. I want to set my ideals macros so as I eat through the day I can see how I'm doing against the goal. It's not asking for much, no idea why this wouldn't have something like that. Food selections are poor, I've had to create customs for almost everything. On to find a better app. A shame I had to pay for this.

title: An amazing app
body: I absolutely love this app, and have keyed in over 300 foods. My only complaint is the lack of integration with other apps like myfitnesspal has. If you could track workouts or pair heart rate monitors this app would be unparalleled.

title: A+
body: I don't normally review things but this was well worth a few moments of my time. Overall a great app and easy to navigate. Made my IIFYM "diet" 10x easier to track :)

title: Great app!
body: Great, easy to use app to track food and macros. Love the easy barcode scanner which scans and saves all nutrition data for future use.

title: Amazingly Helpful!
body: Once I started counting macros I knew I needed an app. This happened to be the first one I found, but I looked at some others that were free. This one is just so much more helpful & informative!

title: Like it a lot more the MFP
body: Switched over about 6 months ago, no issues. Love that you can just input macros if you want.

title: Best tracking app I've tried
body: I've tried them all and this one is my favorite by far. Very user friendly

title: Awesome!!
body: Great app! It is very easy to use and has really helped me along my fitness journey. So easy to add and keep track of meals! A must have if you're looking for a macro counter!!

title: Review
body: I hope my five star review gives the developer some upgrades but honestly haven't noticed any need. Thorough app...perfect for micromanagers.....or should I say.....macromanagers :)

title: Great App!
body: Really love this, it helps me keep track of all my protein, carbs & fat intakes. Also, helps me keep track of my weight. I really recommend it to stay fit & in shape.

title: Needs major improvement
body: I went back to my fitness pal. This app has a horrible data base for food, half the labels I scan it doesn't have, the layout isn't very user friendly. Everything I can use on MFP without paying the fees. This app is a waste of money. Oh and to track your workouts with it you have to buy ANOTHER app.

Loving this app!!! Helps so much!!! It helps me to be more accountable by being more aware of my daily macro percents!!!!  Once it has your usual food choices very simple and very helpful!  Woot woot ☺️!!

title: User Friendly!
body: This app is very easy-to-use and very easy to customize for your preferences.  It makes following your macros simple!

title: Only One I'll Try
body: Just started counting my macros and it's the only one I'll ever use because it's easy and affordable. Just get it, you won't regret it.

title: Best app for complete detailed nutrient tracking!
body: I love it. Breaks down the macros in each food item, and collectively per meal. Easy to use but way more intricate/detailed.

title: Amazing app!
body: I've been using this app now for 10 months and got my mom using it about 3 months ago. we are both loving this app!

title: Excellent
body: Fantastic app to track macros! With this tool I'm getting in the best shape of my life. Would like to see database expanded even further to cover food searches. But excellent nonetheless.

title: Does the job!
body: Really like this app. Makes it super easy to track my kcals. Only thing I would change is the recent wouldn't delete foods as I enter new ones.

title: Needs an update
body: This app needs to have an update. When a friend tried adding me it won't even show I got a request. It would be nice if it aloud to put the daily progress pics like some of the other apps.

title: So far, so great!
body: It took me a day to get used to using it (fmr Fitness Pal user here), but I like it! I haven't done much exploring yet - have been using for only a few days so far - but I plan to continue!

title: Macro app review
body: Some of the caloric information is wrong that people input which can be frustrating other than that it gets the job done.

title: Easy and reliable
body: It's been a great app and still getting better. I couldn't think of using any other macro app to maintain my diet.

title: Once you get used to it, way better than MFP
body: Great interface. I mostly use the custom foods option.

title: Great
body: Makes macro tracking a breeze and keeps you motivated to eat right. If youre serious about counting your macros, it is well worth the money.

title: Excellent!
body: Great tracking app! The barcode scanner is a failsafe if you have any doubts about accuracy. User-friendly and quick.

title: It's great!
body: I love the app and that I can change the labels if I need to. Only problem is, their food data base isn't as big as my fitness pal

title: Great find!!
body: Purchased the app based on reviews from a fitness blog I follow and man what a good find. Seriously easy to use and very user friendly! I suggest this for anyone wanting to track macros and what not

title: Best Keto app
body: Could not find an app that I liked for Keto. This was WELL worth the money, effectively and easily tracks my macros, and is a super user-friendly interface.

title: Love the customizable macros
body: This app is awesome for my ever changing carb cycling figure competitor diet... Easily customizable to what ever my macro goals are for the day and love that it shows at a glance what I have left for the day!

title: Review
body: I love that you can change your macros and set them in any combination. I just wish it had a good data base as large as Myfitnesspal. Great app!

title: Very happy with the app
body: I maintain a ketogenic diet and have been very happy with the app. It would be great if it would synch to my other apps and apple health, but otherwise it is great.

title: LOVE this app!
body: I wanted an app that would allow me to customize my total macros and this one does just that. It makes my life so much easier! Love it!!

title: Not bad could be better
body: I still haven't figured out how to add food meals etc.. But as far as macros it's okay I double check there numbers and there always dead on. I see this app replacing my fitness pal once they get all the kink out

title: 5 star
body: Me and my coach stay connected through this app. He sees if I'm reaching my goals, and it helps keep me on track too seeing where I'm at! Love this app!

title: Great way to track
body: This is a good app to track your meals. The only thing I would add is a time stamp function. Other than that it's been easy and functional

title: Love this APP
body: I use it in conjunction with my fitness pal and love the breakdown of everything. In addition, it also breakdown a recipe if I wish to modify it in order to fit my Macros. Love it.

title: Awesome app!!
body: I fell in love with this app the first time I used it! I switched from MyFitnessPal to MyMacros and I'm SOOOO glad I did! It's super easy to use and just all-around a great app! Highly recommend it!

title: Perfect.
body: Maybe some slight user friend adjustments, but other than that, this app delivers as advertised for nutrition tracking beyond counting calories.

title: Love it
body: The app sends you an email at the end of each week of your weekly calories!

title: Fantastic!!!
body: Easy to do and has almost everything I eat. Even Starbucks down to the most complicated drink order! Love love love!!

title: Great functionality
body: This app allows me to track my macros quickly and easily. I recommend it to my nutrition clients!

title: Good app, great for general info on diet.
body: I really like the app, much better than most of the competitors.  I really like the barcode scanner.    Does need more "home prepared" courses in quick search (grilled chicken, baked tilapia, etc).

title: Perfect
body: I've never been able to figure out a way to track. Seriously this is an awesome app. LOVE the barcode scanner!

title: Great app
body: Love the app as it lets me track macros easily. Only complaint is for adding my own recipes is not as easy as other apps. So I enter recipes into a different app, then manually import a serving to this.

title: Great app!
body: I started cutting for my physique competition and this app has saved my life when it came to tracking my nutrition

title: Love it!
body: I love this app! Way better than MFP. Easier to track and the fast track option is on point 👌🏼

title: Works Great
body: Been using it for over a year now and it has helped keep me on track.

title: Great app when it works.
body: Very frustrated as I love this app when it works but lately it will not save some meals after they have been added by barcode. This has led me to go over my macros on several occasions. Please fix! Thanks!

title: Best macro tracking app out there
body: user friendly, accurate, great interface. 10/10

title: Almost there
body: MM+ is a good IIFYM diet tracker/planner. I cook from scratch so the recipe editor is heavily used. There are some UI rough spots. Though figured out, they continue to annoy. Basically, several key clickables look like text labels. Needs fixed.

title: Love the app! Wish it had more food options
body: I love the app but I think it would be helpful if it had more options. It is very hard to add a simple cup of roasted veggies without having to create a new recipe. Other than that it is awesome!

title: Fantabulous Macro App
body: This app by far is the best macro app I've found. It helps me plan out my daily meals and keep track of that all so important calories and macros.

title: Great app!
body: One of the best, and easiest apps to use. The title says it's all. It counts all of your macros for you. And it's very easy to use. Highly recommend for fitness enthusiasts/ bodybuilders.

title: Great app, database could be improved...
body: Love the app, especially the iOS8 enhancements. My only suggestion is the database could stand both pruning and expansion. Would also love to see tighter integration with your workout app.

title: Best App Ever
body: I use this app more than any other on my phone and it's truly the best I've ever had. Only app I've ever felt was well worth $3.

title: Better than MFP
body: Took a little while to get used to but I love it. I like the custom macros for a very reasonable price. In my opinion it's the best tracker out there. Keeps me on my toes.

title: Love it!!
body: I have been using this app for over a year any really like it. Super easy to use! Love all the data I can see and track!

title: Good App, Horrible Search Function
body: The search function needs to be fixed. If that is fixed, I would upgrade my review. As it is, I won't use it and don't recommend wasting money on it.

title: It's ok
body: I like the direction the app is heading. It's just not quite there. The circles feature is frustrating. It will not allow myself or friends accept follower requests. That bug needs to be addressed. There are also a few other things a bit clunky.

title: Nice Attempt
body: Nice attempt at a macro app but the UI just isn't there. It can be frustrating searching for food especially if you've used MFP before.

title: Great app
body: I really like this app. I love that you can see the macro breakdown for everything right in front of you. The food database and servings options are not as great as MFP but I like the macro breakdown on this app better.

title: Great app!
body: Recommend by my nutritional consultant to track my macros. Love that it has so many cool features! Wish that it could sync with FitBit for the exercise component!

title: Awesome!
body: This is a very well thought out macro tracking app. Easily beats writing and tracking via paper! Well worth the money!

title: A MUST have for Macros.
body: This app impressed me from the first day. Great for those who need to track Macronutrient info and plan there daily/weekly meals.

title: Best Macro Tracker!!!
body: If you're new at tracking Macro it can be discouraging, but I have been using this app off and on for over a year and I have to say this is THE BEST MACRO TRACKER out there! So easy to use and easy to make any changes. I love it!!!

title: Love it!
body: Gives accurate measuring to each food presented, able to save meals and so on and so forth. Thank you!

title: Love!
body: Most helpful tool in my health journey. I have fibromyalgia and keeping track of my macros have helped me cope with my pain in such a major way!

title: Great app, easy to use
body: A friend of mine told me to try this app out, well worth the money! Easy to track your daily intake!

title: Love it!
body: Not the most user friendly at first and doesn't recognize as much food as MyFitnessPal but the break down of Macros is awesome. Would definitely recommend!! 😊

title: 10 out of 10
body: This is great for keeping track of my daily intake and keeping me focused on my goals!

title: Best macro tracker out there, hands down.
body: Simply doesn't get any better or easier than this app.

title: Love this app!
body: Great app! Very simple with a lot of functionality! I love how quick it is to keep track of my nutritional goals. Worth the money!

title: Too much trouble

title: I'm revising my review...no longer five star.
body: As of yesterday I switched back to MFP even though I despise ads. At first I loved this app, but as I used it I found it to be glitchy and not as user friendly as MFP, unfortunately. First, the barcode scanner isn't nearly as sensitive as with MFP. It's not a quick process. Second, there are glitchy aspects when I try to manually enter in a food and/or edit nutritional info. Sometimes it works, but often I receive an error message or it just won't allow me to do it or for some wonky reason it defaults to "almonds" out of no where. What?!?! Moreover, many times the default serving size is "1gram." Now don't get me wrong...I'm totally in favor of the US transitioning to metric units but the fact of the matter is we're not there yet. That means since I'm not massing out every morsel that I put in my mouth, grams would be inaccurate for me. I'm not proficient enough at estimating portions based on grams, even knowing one paper clip is about a gram. Measuring out a certain quantity of potato chips (not grams) works for me, but I'm thinking this app is for people who do literally mass out every morsel. I'm not there yet - I'm alright with a little bit of estimating - and don't know that I'll ever be. Additionally, the food database isn't as expansive as MFP. Finally, MFP has figured out the easiest way for people to use their app, whether it's adding a food, exercise, etc.  This app isn't terrible, but it's not as smooth sailing either. Although I downloaded the paid companion fitness app to sync with this one, I prefer MFP's all-in-one app. I do like that I can see percentages of macros in this app, but it doesn't outweigh what I don't particularly like about the app. Bottom line - although I won't pay the monthly fee for MFP I am switching back.

title: I had no idea...
body: For years, I always felt like I had a healthy diet. I was even a total vegetarian for about ten years (don't you dare call me a vegan). After reading so many one sided arguments saying that I was doing everything right, I began questioning this infallible evidence. I started seeing study's showing how different fats benefited the body. I read about bioavailability of animal protein versus plant proteins. I finally came to my own conclusion that a well balanced, diverse diet is the most beneficial.

title: Home Screen widget and Barcode scanner
body: Not the most accurate bar code scanner. It’s off by a few grams which is not a big issue, but it’s a bit off putting when I have the nutritional facts in front of my face and the OCD in me kicks in. Also can’t seem to add the app into my Home Screen widget. Not sure if I have to change some settings or what not. Anyone have any solutions? Other than those two issues, the app functions great.

title: This app is frustrating
body: I only downloaded this from a recommendation and it’s SOO frustrating trying to use it. It claims they have several foods to help log but I had to manually input everything. The bar code scanner is pointless because it doesn’t work. You still have to manually adjust the numbers. After customizing my daily goals it doesn’t calculate the rest of your meals for you. Maybe I just got too spoiled with my last app. Definitely deleting this one and going back to just lose it. I just want my $2 back for downloading such a garbage app.

title: App has so much potential but lacks…
body: It’s a great app, BUT… BUT… But for years I have been submitting ideas that other apps have and track, this app needs a lot of those features like:

title: Good for macro cycling but recording needs improvement
body: The strongest aspect of this app is that it gives you the ability to enter multiple macro breakdowns that you can choose between on a daily basis. This is great for having high/low days or carb cycling. The issue I had was with finding foods and also manipulating serving size. Other apps let you choose between any unit of measurement but this one restricts you to just one or two.All in all the foundation of the app is great, and much better than others, but the process of actually entering foods and servings needs refinement. I would definitely use this as my primary app if those corrections were made

title: Lifechanger!
body: This app is amazing and the best for tracking macros if youre on a iifym diet. ive been using this app for the past 3 years, of course I would let loose occasionally on vacations. But once I want to get back on track, this app is my go to, iifym is a healty maintainable diet that works! A lot of other diets are fad diets. I love how this apps saves everything I put in and can customize. I also love how all my data and info is saved under my username as I had just damaged my phone and had to get it replaced, I accidentally uploaded my blank data onto the server but Jason the app creator was able to restore all my data back to me!! Lifesaver and lifechanger! Thank you for creating this amazing app! $3 is nothing to change your life!

title: Complicated

title: Needs to be better
body: I have a strong dislike for this apps bar code scanner. It is so time consuming and inconsistent. I’ve tried taking a picture of the nutrients but I always end up having to manually in put it. Could you please work on this?

title: Tutorial videos are no help
body: I purchased this app to help me track my macros hoping that it was going to be easy to do so. I have watched the tutorials to show me how to log my meals, then I go to log them and it only allows me to log one meal per day. The tutorials are terrible and don’t show or explain you how to continue to add the next meals for the same day. I was only able to log my breakfast and track my water. What a waste of $2.99. Now I have to figure out how to cancel the 7 day free trial for the pro version I signed up before I get charged another $19.99. I’m still working on this too. If I follow the tutorial on canceling my account, it is futile and I get no where. I’ll be upgrading My Fit Pal app instead, it’s much easier to navigate and they don’t charge to just download the app like My Macros + does.

title: Similar experiences to other users
body: Don’t waste the money! I also use MFP and wanted better macro tracking. I (stupidly) assumes that paying for an app unlocked all the features. You have to pay $19.99/year plus $9.99/month to get the “extra” features that made this app so appealing in the first place. I should’ve read more negative reviews before purchasing!

title: Recipe shortfall

title: Garbage
body: App is not capable of basic math. Bar code function only works sometimes. You can scan a bar code and even if the item I’d found it may have zero nutritional values included. I thought that was reasonable, but custom entries don’t calculate correctly either. For example, I created a custom entry that had 240 calories, 20 g of carb and 12 g of sugar. When I applied the item it calculated it at 80 cal, 20 carb and 12 sugar. I capfuls track better with an Excel spreadsheet. Don’t waste your $2.99

title: Great concept poorly executed
body: This app is such a disappointment. The food base is way to large and wildly in accurate. If you want to change the measurement it takes forever, if you scan using the bar code the information doesn’t match the nutrition label. The food library is as over crowded as MFP, no generics from a USDA food database. If you search banana there will be 60 options all vastly different and each in a different measurement. Editing anything is slow and glitchy. Overall this is a great concept with great features but the app is slow and not user friendly. Inputting food takes way too long.

response: Hi, Really sorry for the inconvenience about this. We have since released an update that fixes this crashing. Please head over to the app store and just make sure you're up to date. Sorry again for the inconvenience

title: Food selection/database not great
body: Food database is seriously lacking. And it’s so hard to find common sense quantities- like I ate half an avocado, and I have to choose between one ounce, one cup mashed (?!) etc. I found this with most fruit/vegetables when there should just be a quantity instead of ounces/cups. There were lots of things that weren’t even in the database. And multiple times I used the bar code scanner only to see completely different nutritional info from the package. This app is frustrating and not helpful.

title: Garbage
body: Your app is garbage. Forget trying to login after getting a new phone. There is no way for me to email the developer because I’m not logged in, but I need help to login!! I try to get a password reset and the way the app is setup I can’t even enter info in the fields to request a reset! It asks for a verification code and there’s no way for me to even enter that into the fields. So yeah. Talk about a couple bucks wasted.

title: Exhausting to use
body: The time I have spent logging my food since switching from MFP to MM+ has gone up immensely and I’m tracking way more haphazardly because creating recipes is nearly impossible and bar code scanning vegetarian protein and yogurt is mostly useless.

title: Great for fitness buffs / bodybuilders
body: I found this app to be much better than some of the other ones out there.  The bar code reader worked well for a lot of my items.  I was able to customize the meals I commonly eat and add them so that I don’t have to add every little ingredient.  When I had one challenge trying to figure out how to get things synched, the developer contacted me very quickly and provided just the right answers.  In the world of less than great apps, this one is awesome.

title: Not perfect, but perfect support
body: It takes a couple of days to find your way around MM+, and then it is mostly precise and easy to handle. I have used it for two months, on Android, iOs and Web, and love it.

title: Love the app, the web version not so much
body: I have been using the app for a few years now and I really love it as I usually eat the same things and I have all the foods created in my food library and it's easy to use. However, I decided to try the web version, foolishly signing up and paying for the $19.99 annual membership. When I first open the web version, all of my meals which are planned in the app don't show up on the web. When I tried to add my first meal in the web version, I received an error message. After having zero success with the web version, I contacted customer service and I received a response the next day telling me a refund would be processed once I went through the steps of cancelling it via the web site. Well we are going on 3 weeks and I've reached out multiple times and each time I get a response and then it is radio silence. Moral of the story - don't waste any money on the web version, stick to the one time payment of the app or mfp.

title: Like it but could be improved
body: Updated 9/2016

title: Best Macro Calculator
body: This app I heard about from watching one of Paul Revelia's YouTube videos. I had been using MFP for years. There are mostly pros over the cons in comparison. Hitting macro totals being the primary focus here, and it is easily visible almost everywhere on the screen. It took a bit to get the hang of the format but once I did I'm able to fly through easily. One tweak to consider would be when you try to enter what you plan to eat tomorrow and the day changes, it still says tomorrow until you go back a day and it will change. This app fixes the things that annoyed me about MFP (annoying homepage and difficulty seeing macro targets vs reality).

title: Awesome app

title: Needs a ton of work
body: Database is empty for the most part. I do like that it is cheaper than MFP. Custom macros and day-to-day goals is a winner for me. You have to pay $49.99 a year on MFP to do that. Fix y’alls database and add more options of how much of something you consume (ex. 1 cup, 1/3 cup, 1TSP of milk rather than just a 1 cup option). If you used 3TSP of milk for a recipe, you’d have to manually compute how many cups 3TSP is. This will save consumers a lot of work, which is the whole point of an app like this. It should be stress free and easy, yet this is the opposite.
